review: I decided to come try this game again because it really is fun. So far all the server issues that used to plague me are gone. I am happy to play and recommend Rocket League once again. Original Review from early 2016 I played this game for over 70 hours just wonderfully. Then after some update in late 2015 it became unplayable for me. Constant disconnects and rubber banding plague every match I've tried since then and I've tried many hours as my time played shows. I have tried every method I could find to remedy but nothing has worked even tried a different ISP and couple differents routers (even though I play many other online games without any problems). The problems lie with the game and poor servers as many many people can attest. Once the game is playable for me once again and this won't be a negative review.P.S. Microtransaction BS is BS and should be handled like BS flushed away and forgotten.

review: One of the best game I have ever played. I will never stop loving to play this as it's challenging and forces you get better every single time you play. The only way to dislike this game is to play mindlessly hoping to eventually get better and complaining about it being laggy or teammates being awful. I will agree that the servers are not always perfect and sometimes the balls clip but in the end if you're skilled enough and actively trying to be better you will have a lot of fun. I will also agree that whom you play with is important but as long as you don't do too many mistakes and take the opportunities that you're presented with you'll do just fine most of the time.

review: Easy to learn but hard to master. As in real soccer complex behaviour arises from simple rules. You will have moments of pure elation at your increasing skill and then other moments when you hate your own stupid mistakes. Just keep going and keep learning!A few tips for you Positioning and strategy are as important as ball skills. Don't ragequit because the matchmaking will penalise you. Disable moronic voice chat. If you want fun then play on the casual servers and if you want a challenge then play on the competitive servers (ranked).SUMMARY *Very* addictive fun and you don't need to like either soccer or cars!

review: What started out in 2015 as a frustrating unique and amusing way to waste time on PS4 would eventually lead me to buying and modding a nice PC rig to play this game seriously. Playing this game you'll find yourself going through phases. SunlessKhan on youtube has a great video about this titled "every rocket league player." Very accurate. You'll start out having loads of fun as you laugh at yourself trying to get a grip on the mechanics. Then you'll move on to a bit of frustration once you feel as though you should be playing better but you're getting smashed by people flying through the air. So you spend time learning how to move through the air efficiently. You'll feel a bit of pride followed by ever more frustration as you continue to get smashed by ceiling shots and pristine positioning. So you'll learn how to do ceiling shots and improve positioning. You'll win some and feel great. Then you'll get smashed by flicks elite dribble control and fakes. Rinse. And. Repeat. There is no ceiling on improvement in this game. You can ALWAYS get better. If you've read through this great wall of text and you're still on the fence just give it a go. Get the game. It's a challenge perpetually.

review: I only have about 20 hours of gameplay at the moment for this game but I have enjoyed every moment of it.From figuring out the first few flips to making simple goals and finally pulling off some simplistic air goals (nothing feels better than that). One thing I feel so far about this game is that it is simple to grasp yet there is a very high skill level if you're willing to keep trying new crazy moves and work on your accuracy as well as teamwork. Teamwork may not seem too important until you start getting closer to the elite division matches you learn very quickly that it is not always about scoring a goal but also setting up your teammates to score.In any case I highly suggest trying this game out even at the $20 price tag and especially if it ever goes on sale.One extra note concerning the cross play aspect between the PC and the Playstation. You can get into randomized matches with either type players however you can only intentionally get into a private match with a friend that is on a different system at the moment (e.g. if you're on the PC and your friend is on a Playstation you must create a match and they must join you). Additionally through this method you cannot play the typical ranked/unranked online matches only against other friends or computers.*Edit If you cannot stand games that Give you the cold sweats Cause you to RageButtClench Force you to panic Periodically disallows blinking Gives way too much sense of accomplishment...you may want to avoid this game**Edit I now have a little over 97 hours of gameplay and still feel the same way about this game. The matches now have become far more difficult since my friends and I have been ranking up but it makes it all the more fun. After a certain point you truly do have to rely on everyone on your team to know how to Make contact with the ball in the air Play as goalie Be an aggressive striker Work as a team many goals come from passing to a teammate***Edit (188 Hours)What? You still have not tried this game yet?
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is a fun and unique game where you play soccer but with a TWIST... you play with CARS! In Rocket League you can play ranked or unranked which is a ranking system from the highest rank to the lowest rank. You can get items to customize your car and even get different types of cars such as a boost wheels topper(hat) and many different skins and for the items you dont want you can trade with other players to get something better or if you have 5 of the same type of item ( Common Uncommon Rare Very Rare Import Body Exotic And of course mystery decal) then you can trade it in for one item of a higher rarity. But beware of scammers! You can also train in the exhibiton or go there just for some fun! You can also buy crates which is a random item which could possibly be a mystery decal. And it's under 20$!!!! I definitely recommend this to anyone that like soccer or cars or BOTH and even if you dont like those 2 things it's still a really good game and i highly recommend you check it out NOW!!!

review: Product received for free. I've played on Ps4 and Pc. On both platform I got around 700 800 hrs in total.I started playing RL in July 2015 when the game was free for PS+ users.Graphic 9.5/10Gameplay 9.5/10Mechanic 10/10Options 10/10Variety 8/10Innovation 7.5/10Matchmaking/Connection 8.5/10Rewards/Loot 5/10Community 7.5/10EndGame 9/10Pros There's a ton of modes that you can play they add game modes in game to get more variety. Casual or Harcore player both can play this game You can always improve in this game ALWAYS (Even pros does) Esport tournaments (everybody can join) Super friendly for new comers HUD and control are easy to learn but not to master. Great to play with friends!!!! Any Controllers can be used on PC Trading cosmetics Private matches/Mini Tournaments Very Good matchmaking in ranked 99% of the time I've played in ranks it's against people of the same skill level as I. Any other game modes it's against random ranks. Good season rewards Not P2W the best car overall is a free one. Great community in generalCons There's maybe a ton of extra game modes but you won't play 20 games back to back of one game mode. (Becomes boring in my opinion) Repetitive it's not the same actions or the same decisions that you are making over and over but the gameplay is always the same. Microtransactions Rocket league didn't have them in the first year that i've played. It was a very good year but since they launch it I feel they put all their efforts on cosmetics and events around them.. they still do provide new content but it's just new game modes and like I said before most of the time after 5 games you are going back to normal mode. They do give 5 free keys every events for players that plays the game in that period that item that you unlock cannot be trade with other players because you got it for free. Sometimes it can be hard to play in other regions. (Pings/Packet loss/ETC) People didn't had problems before some patches ago. Since you play cross platform it's weird when a Ps4 or Xbox can get only 30 FPS but PC is uncapped. That's the main reason why I enjoy playing more on PC then PS4. (I see the difference) Bad rewards overall beside the season rewards and the free keys the game doesn't give you meaning or nice rewards. It's a strange combination of racing and soccer (and hockey basketball). RL added some power ups (I forget the actual term used) that have put a new spin on the game but you can chose to play with the power ups/buffs off if you desire. Oh I almost forgot the most important thing explosions! Lots and lots of explosions.

review: With a little over 400 hours into this game I figured i'd review it. For those who have this on your wishlist or have simply just been on the fence about this game I have one thing to say BUY IT. There are numerous reviews that will go more in depth on the pros and cons of this game but I simply say BUY IT. This isnt one of those games you put on the wishlist till a big sale comes this is a game that is priced right and done right. Honestly I dont need to elaborate much more as there are plenty of reviews that hit the pro and cons of this game. At its face this game is very easy to pickup and enjoy. However you'll soon realize that its much more complex than it seems. It takes many hours to become skilled and a lot of trial and error in the training modes to figure out how you like your controls camera ect ect. Trust me once you play it you'll understnad why soo many fellow gamers have recommended this game. 10/10 would buy the delorian again.

review: Psyonix have done a great job creating a game which combines vehicles and sport to deliver a unique and extremely entertaining experience.Visually I was impressed with the game. The diverse playing fields and the customisation options for your car give the game its own visual style. The use of strong vibrant colours generates a pleasant atmosphere. With the customisation feature players have so many choices to make regarding the style of their cars from the wheels decals flags and hats.The game controls are quick to learn and master. With that said though it is difficult to hit the ball at the perfect time or dribble across the playing field but that's the best thing about Rocket League the difficulty of having complete control of the ball using a car creates so much tension. Players hopelessly boost drift and jump to gain control of the ball. It's often hilarious to watch opposing teams and teammates miss the ball and ram into each other to gain possession. Everyone's lack of ability is what makes it so rewarding when you finally do score by timing your jump perfectly or hitting the ball at the right angle. Half the time I scored its because I unintentionally hit the ball at an opposing team player and he/she shoots an own goal. The game is genuinely intense and it's the first time in a while where a game has made me move and jump in my seat.I like Rocket League. Its such a satisfying game. After a few hours however I began to lose my motivation in the matches. The game starts to repeat itself which is expected as it is a sports game but I feel that other gameplay features could be incoorperated to keep the ball rolling (pun not intended). I don't think the game is in my favourite games of all time but it is definitley an enjoyable experience and a must play.7//10
title: Rocket League®

I think rocket league players should be able to have access to a phone number or better an email address where the good players can copy and paste what these nasty bullies are writing to others during the game as it ruins the game but thinking of others out there with mental health concerns it can also ruin other players self esteem or confidence and it could seriously be a game changer for the recieving end of the bullying. The reporting process needs to entail alot my detail about how they are bullying because if other players are encouraging and writing you should kill yourself I am not ok with reading this or recieving this in any way. review: I have had this game for a good month or two and every day I have played for at least 30 minutes. This game has everything! I bought the game for free when they had the game on a sale for a special weekend or something like that. It was for three days. I played it for maybe two days totaling all the hours. So at the end I was like "I have to get this." So I bought it for $20 (or $30 I can't remember). IT WAS WORTH IT!Now if the developers (Psyonic Inc.) ever see this review if it's okay I'd like to suggest just a couple new things to add in the game. There could be more customization options when we create a local season when playing with the AI. I'd like to be able to Customize the players Customize the players' names Customize the players' attributes (might collide with setting the difficulty again just suggesting new things to do) Increase difficulty (It goes from Rookie &gt Pro &gt All Star. All Star has become easy for me now. Maybe something like Rookie &gt Pro &gt All Star &gt Legend &gt Hall of Fame just another suggestion) Customize the teams (option to change all the team names to fit a possible theme maybe likewise with the player names and attributes) Customize the team logos (option for custom logos draw or upload) Customize the season length (more options instead of the normal every 9 weeks again only a suggestion) Customize the cars themselves (MAYBE up to y'all!) There could be more customization options with creating an exhibition game (same as above but without the season length) SIDE NOTE You don't have to add everything in this list at the same time in the same update. You don't have to even put in all these things I'm just suggesting but it would be nice to have with this game since I know of other games that have those options. If these options were implemented with this game as awesome as it is this game could be Fortnite. I like Fortnite but I play this more than I do Fortnite.
title: Rocket League®

review: It's an unfortunate situation with online multiplayer games no matter how well balanced or fun the mechanics are in a game you can't stop the community from turning it into a dump. Rocket League is the epitome of this. It's simple polished and when you have the right circumstances it can be extremely exciting. Then when you factor in the monkey like behaviour of most people it becomes much less enjoyable. If you have a group of friends you can party up with it won't be as much of a problem but if you don't always have someone on call to join you here's what you can expect. Near constant ragequitting due to Psyonix doing approximately NOTHING to punish ragequitters (read trash) even 10 months since the game's release even in ranked matches Being frequently and forcibly placed into in progress matches (usually on the losing side) due to said ragequitters If you are placed into a losing match and you are able to turn it in your favor the enemy team will spend the remainder of the match trying to hit you instead of the ball Players with a veteran rank (dozens of hours) that somehow don't understand the basics of the game who will also ragequit Players on your team who deliberately try to lose in ranked matches and then trashtalk you The disgusting childish attitude of steam forum users if you have a problemOn a side note the main menu has a flashing "DOWNLOADABLE CONTENT" button that looks different from the others right at the top. This button is placed above the buttons to play the video game you bought. Just wanted to let you know Psyonix's priorities and what they think of you for buying their game.

The worst of it is that I'm not the best at this game so i like to play casual and everytime some exits or joins the game in progress it turns into a damn slide show!! This never used to happen maybe a very slight hitch occasionally but the game becomes unplayable for 3 to 4 seconds anytime someone comes or goes. Updates are fine but whatever Psychotics have done to this game in the last few months it has been completely ruined for me..

review: __07/23/2018__ 8/10 The Perfect 5 Minute FixRocket League is a wonderfully creative and enjoyable mashup of fast cars and oversized soccer. I truly enjoy everything rocket league is with the exception of a few minor annoyances. If you I need to get a quick gaming fix in to kill some time or blow off some steam Rocket League is my go to game in my library. Its fast paced requires skill and frequently rewards the player in the form of cosmetic items. The implimentation of seasons has been a breathe of fresh air ever since the game was first released and the number of holiday events in the game keep players busy earning swag to show off and/or trade to other players.Rocket League isn't by any means perfect... but almost. The microtransactions are out of hand and most all of the "cool" skins and effects are locked behind crate key purchases which dont really tier down in price if you want to buy in bulk. Another annoyance I have with the game is the cross platform system in which they have adopted. Many times PC players get stuck with consol players which can make it difficult to communicate with one another. This leads to poor coordination and frustrating losses the higher you climb in the rankings. To prevent this I hope they impliment and option in the future where a player can check a box that will allow them to opt out of cross platform matchmaking and just play with the playerbase on their platform. Yes this seems counter productive to implimenting cross platform servers in the first place but in ranked matchmaking players can become toxic when team synergy is lacking and can create an unpleasent experience for those trying to climb the ladder.Again Rocket League though not perfect is a great casual quick fix game that anyone can pick up and enjoy. It's in my opinion a must in any gamers library.
title: Rocket League®

review: First off i will say that i have 400 hours on record. And i will say that i am just the slightest bit addicted to this game. Second off i wanna say a thank you to psyonix (which i never thought of doing) but here it goes. Thank you thank the devs for making your dlcs so amazingly cheap and offordable. 5 bucks for 2 cars boosts and rims AND toppers AND flags? UNHEARD OF in the gaming industry. Thats like buying a semitruck (a brand new Kenowrth one at that) for 20 000 dollars instead of the casual half a million dollars they are marked at initally. So yeah Thanks Psyonix. I dont mean that in any other way other than litteraly not sarcastic (get new servers tho they kinda suck... My granda could run faster than they can process where the ball is) but i will say this.I really ing enjoy how people buy keys. 20 at a time. I have done this so therefore i can laugh at it but sometimes its HILARIOUS to the point where i am rolling on the ground laughing and my family thinks im insane. You see these videos out there titled 150 CARES OPENING!! OMG!!! so i log onto my fake youtube acc to see whats up. Well... It turs out the maker of the video bought. BOUGHT. 150 dollars worth of in game content at one time. ROFL.Thank you again for caring about the people who play the game. I never really liked or disliked neo tokyo but i will say that its annoying P But yee Thx for makin da gam boi and makin it possible (pronounce it with the most spanish accent posiible) aaaaaanyways this im out

Now in Season 9 I'm Diamond 1. It's been really fun to watch myself get better and make progression on a competitive game! The game can fun like I said. It can cause a lot of rage too as the game sucks sometimes. Aside from toxic teammates oppents and toxic text chat which you can mute all of this btw it's a really fun game. review: To preface I love this game. It's one of my favorites. But for new players I need to warn you that you better have a good internet connection.Unless you live in a country with impeccable ISP's (thanks Ajit Pai _ ) or you're an intern that can plug directly into Psyonix's server stacks you're going to get latency variation problems the likes of which never seen before. It was perfectly fine before the Spring Fever update but someone decided to mess with the server stability and now I'm averaging between 120 200(!) ping in ranked. Try kicking a soccer ball that has the ability to teleport on a whim and is also noncorporeal. That's what it's like at least for me. Discussion forum posts can also back me up.Community is okay ish but please Psyonix. Fix your servers. It's bad. Really bad.
title: Rocket League®

review: Never in my life would I have thought I would like Rocket League. I mean I hate soccer irl and I don't play a lot of strictly multiplayer games. However this game is so fun to play and I can't stop. It makes you feel like a badass even when you're doing nothing right. The nice thing about playing it online is that everyone's terrible just by virtue of how chaotic it is so nobody really gets an advantage beyond luck. And there's no hokey skill trees or progression to alienate new players. All in all the best multiplayer game I own right now.
title: Rocket League®

review: After 20 years of hardcore gaming from Atari to the console wars to PC somehow this game has became my most played non MMORPG of all time..... in just 3 months.There are 3 major elements that make this game incredible Purely fun simple gameplay 10/10You will have a hard time finding a game that extracts so much fun from such simple concepts. The physics engine is the real hero but also the seemingly infinite combinations of the basic maneuvers (jump rocket boost and dodge) turn the game into a constant struggle between what your mind wants to do and what you are able to get your car to do. And nothing is more rewarding than finally getting your car to finally make that acrobatic flying backwards aerial off the wall goal. When you're not playing like a graceless flying monkey you can play like its a demolition derby by harassing defenders ruining opponents shots and 'sploding annoying goalies. The beauty of Rocket League is that while winning is fun failing is just as fun. Unbelievably Steep Skill Curve with an Unreachable Ceiling 10/10In an odd way the appeal of this game incredibly similar to the appeal of the game of Golf you are constantly enjoying yourself while constantly trying to get better. You will go through dozens of 'phases' of improvement from first learning aerials to learning aerial dodges &amp power shots to learning dribbling and wall shots and backwards aerials and air rolls and goalie skills and pro passes ... and on and on it goes! Rocket League has one of the most rewarding skill curves of any game I have ever played.If you are someone that likes to simply play around and have fun you can have endless fun playing RL ... yet at the same time if you are someone that likes to challenge yourself and chase perfection by constantly honing your skill vs. competition RL can provide endless challenges too. It's quite rare for a game to so seamlessly mesh both possibilities.Competitive Progression 6/10If simply mastering a skill or having mindless fun aren't enough and you need an actual goal to chase or a way to represent your progress then Rocket League's ranked system is fairly good at doing so. While the matchmaking system has its flaws teammates can frustrate and the rewards/achievements are completely trivial ... it still does provide a reasonable representation of your progress. But don't expect anything more than bragging rights &amp fame for tireless efforts because this game is not interested in providing any 'rewards' that aren't decorative. And don't expect to be chasing any rare items or skins or cars because virtually all of them can be accumulated with ease fairly quickly (sans DLC only variations). The game is very strict with it's approach to balance to the point that you will never gain any item or object to make your car better from day one until the very last game of RL you play you will have the exact same tools to play the game that you will ever have.But DO expect a competitive game platform that is perfectly suited to spawn a serious e sports community.
title: Rocket League®

review: The perfect combination of absurdity and competitiveness.Once you start this game you're completely sucked into it. There is a learning curve yes. But that should not stop you from playing this game with colourful and cartoony graphics a satisfying feel and a competitive edge. Not very hard to learn extremely hard to master. Skins are also quite a big part of the game (if you want it to be) allthough I am never in favor of microtransactions. The community in the lower ranks can be quite toxic and unfriendly but a simple mute should fix that. I do recommend searching someone to play with be it on the various fora steam acqaintances or someone you meet in game it is much easier to develop your skill and rank up when doing so with someone whom you play with regularly. I 100% recommend this game.(p.s best played with a controller)
title: Rocket League®

For me this game is a place where i am able to spend my time having a lot of fun with my friends after school be able to communicate with people and meeting somebody else opinion about the items or the gameplay.This game has a lot to give so dont be aware of buying it !

review: I wish I could rate this game out of ten rather than a yes no scenario because this game is barely recommendable. I like the concept of the original game this is based on. So unique and its good to have an updated verision of this game. But this game has issues. They added an extra difficulty level which is appreciated. They changed car mechanics which I prefer the manouverability of the original game. Bot mechanics havent changed bar the increased difficulty level. And online matchmaking has been non existent upon release which I find unbelievable considering that the original game had some serious match making issues. I feel this game has had such little effort put into it considering there has been a previous release of essentially the same game that has been out for 7 years. I would have expected more.

review: Until yesterday I would have been giving this a positive review.Yesterday I had my steam account compromised even though I use a unique password and the steam mobile authenticator imediately a user was added to my friends list and I noticed I was on rocket league even though I had not launched it which tipped me off to my account being compromised after recovering and securing my accont I contacted Psyonix support as steam had no direct contact and for any in game items issues they direct you to the game support. I received a response stating that no trade can be reversed and they pretty much tried to shift the blame to steam and myself. I then requested any recommendations other than contacting the person who stole my items to get my items back and they have responded with "I completely understand where you are coming from but I'm afraid we wouldn't be able to provide that information. From our end I can only tell you that we can't retrieve the items for you."As such I have no way of contacting steam and Psyonix are refusing to try to get my items back which I paid real money for some of the crates(halloween) and for the keys to open them.
title: Rocket League®

I really hope Psyonix can fix this and make it so you don't get matched up with AFK players anymore. If they are able to fix it it would make the game fun to play again.

review: This is an incredibly good game! The developers are amazing. There are some problems with the servers as the game became a lot more popular than the developers had expected. They constantly write updates on their twitter and talk to the community. The game is cross platform with the PS4 but as of yet you cannot create a party cross platform because Sony/Steam's rules doesn't allow it. The developers have said that they are working on a solution to bypass that.The game is extremely fun and really addicting. The graphics are beautiful and there is a lot of collectibles.If you are planning to play this game you should play it with a controller. The game is just a lot better with a controller.It is the best game I have played this year!

review: don't get into that game really it's highly addictive 'cause it has a really good gameplay (skill dependant high reward for good actions and well simply lot of fun) but is plagued by the WORST MATCHMAKING EVER unbalanced teams not always but half of the time with 30.000 active players (140.000 total) it's in itself an achievement. no sanctions against toxic players meaning it's full of these. you often get matched in already started games cause someone left that said game but eh didn't they wonder if people are leaving it may not be a spontaneous idea that poped into the guy's mind? maybe he left cause he had a flamer team? or cause he got matched with too strong/too weak mates/ennemies? if you're a solo Q player you often get matched vs 3 men premades giving a real advantage in this game. then when you leave a game for whatever reason (pick one or several above) and you start Qing again you're often getting matched in the exact same game you just left at this point it's some genious mind. oh and you can make as many threads as you want on their forum they just don't give a fcck really Dstarted out as an indie studio with passionate devs ended up like EA or zenimax.some people that have all answers to every single problem over the globe will tell ya "stop cry just play ranked solves all of those issues you jerk!" but well i need a fair amount of casual matches to warm up before i get to ranked and very often i leave rocket league before i can even get to the ranked play phase.so yeah the price is not that big and actually it's still worth it but you're probably gonna get addicted and get really really disappointed once you'll reach a certain skill level and take the game quite seriously (what you will do just by playing) cause of that matchmaking which is honestly the worst i ever saw and cause of those devs that won't moove their fat aass for everything else than skin boxes. ( &lt salt detected )today i've spent 30 minutes trying to get into a real match the game didn't allowed me to play only once in a correct match only joining in already started matches that your team is loosing by far i don't play this. quite amazing though spent 30 minutes on the game and i couldn't play those guys are geniusesPS sorry for bad english! review: Rocket League is a fantastic game which has nailed game design philosophy of elegance via simplicity. The game is easy to hop into as a beginner but has a skill ceiling so high you'll be tweaking your play as long as you stick with it. Drive around in your rocket powered car on a soccer pitch competing in 1v1 2v2 3v3 or 4v4 matches both online and off. With matches lasting 5 minutes it's an easy game to hop into when you don't have a huge amount of time to sink into a game but it's so good you'll have trouble only playing one match. It features 1v1 2v2 and 3v3 (solo queue and party queue) matches for the ranked ladder. These modes give a sense of progression as you rank up from unranked to bronse 1 3 silver 1 3 gold 1 3 and the godly platinum tier. Just as you think you've started to master the game and you climb higher in rankings you play someone who does things you've never seen before and they wipe the floor with you truely a humbling experience. There is always room to improve. It's not all about competition though. The game offers 1v1 2v2 3v3 and 4v4 unranked modes as well as a newly added mutator mode which puts you into an unranked game with crazy and fun modifications like slo mo low gravity increased boost strength cube ball and more. This game has something to offer both casual and competive players and with the fun gameplay and quick matches it's a no brainer. I've gotten well more than my $20 worth out of it.

review: I really want to enjoy this game a lot of my friends play it. Unfortuately the game is tedious driving back and forth after a ball feels like bashing my head against a wall. It was fun for the first few weeks now it is repetitive.Major changes need to take place to keep the game fun I don't see that happening. For starters 4v4 on this small of an arena is unplayable. Second stacking defenders creates terrible stalemates. Rules need to be in place that limit the amount of defenders same reason way soccer hockey basketball have rules for it.Netcode is the worst I've seen the ball teleports changes directions cars teleport and I have 100/100MB fiber connection.In short the game needs more game modes some different rules stable netcode or else it will disappear soon.

review: Super fun game if you view it as a party game or something just to kill time. Don't get sucked in too hard on rankings and you have a ton of fun with it. Also highly recommend coming up with your own terminology for moves you pull off in the game as it makes commentary with friends extremely fun. Try using "boop" when you set someone up "cheeky horn corp" when you try a sick aerial "cheeky king lou" when you get a nice bicycle kick a "folly floater" for a long slow shot across the field a "lazy susan" for a slow goal "spicy susan" for a fast goal and a "tositios mild slasa susan" for a medium speed goal. Also when you over commit for a goal and the opponents end up scoring because no one is back playing goal make sure to call it a "Shaboobadoopy." Trust me it's a ton of fun.
title: Rocket League®

review: I'd say I have my fair share of hours into this game and all I have to say is that it's fantastic. The game is wonderful on all levels whether just starting out or an experienced pro this game never was boring to me. The game has quite the learning curve and definitely a bigger one than I expected. The replayability of this game is great I always find myself coming back to it to refine my skills. A must have game.
title: Rocket League®

review: Very addicting and very fun! And the community of players whether their veteran or just new rookie to the game everyone is just very friendly and encouraging even if you accidentally score on your own team. It happens and it's such a breath of fresh air after dealing with the toxic communities of LOL DOTA2 PUBG FORTNITE and all the in between games where the littles mistake gets you reported and banned. You run into a couple bad sports who get mad and leave the game and there is no pentalties for leaving a game and abandoning people but it's very rare you end up dealing with people who degrease you for making mistakes and some will offer to teach you a few tricks to help you catch on quicker. I give this game 9 out of 10 start only because there are no penalties or suspensions for those rare people who get mad and abandon their team leaving the game. Other then that I have no negative words to say about this fun and addictive game where you find yourself saying "one more match before I go to bed" over and over as much as you would binging episode after episode of Netflix

review: Really enjoyed Rocket League! Lots of unlockables to get. Scoring is rewarding. Especially in 3v3. I would recommend using a controller for this game. I started out on my keyboard but grabbed a Xbox 360 controller to see if I liked it better. It was hard making the adjustment from keyboard to mouse but it is definitely worth the effort to learn. I was able to control my car much more effectively and it made aerials easier as well. Have yet to played ranked but intend to once I get a little more practice with the controller. I rate this game a 7/10. The game is good but can get repetitive. I usually binge and then have to take a break for a few days.

review: Easily one of the most addicting games I've played. Every match is 5 minutes (plus OT and people watching the replays) and the skill cap is very high so you are always improving. Psyonix is amazing with updates the only DLC are car packs and Psy has seasonal updates along with new game modes occasionally. They added the crate and key system which funds the tournaments while giving us a shot at some really cool visual upgrades to our cars. 90% of the things in crates is worth wanting (the other 10% are the low tier decals that I wouldn't want but that's subjective). There is a great amount of cars and an insane amount of custimization so you'll always find the car that suits you. The online community can be toxic at times but you have the option to mute and report so that's not a big deal. Just play your heart out!Overall a beautiful game by an amazing group of developers. They listen to what the community says and the constant fight to get into a higher rank in comp along with the steady increase in the number of people who are good at the game will have you clawing for more game time.
title: Rocket League®

review: You don't own Rocket League? Do you only have an Xbox and parents who don't love you? That's what all your friends who play Rocket League are saying about you. The Psy guys definitely got the formula right on this one. Even when you start playing and suck so bad it hurts you can't stop. And even when you get so good you could juggle the ball like a hippie hopping a hacky sack you still are not as good as the Mt Dew doping 12 yea olds that are handily eating your lunch and you STILL can't get enough. It's dead simple to understand and only gets better when you find yourself on a team of people who know how to play and coordinate. Always fast paced and the matches are typically quick so the ADHD part of you can enjoy and say every 5 minutes "Maybe just one more". The visuals sound and music are all perfect. Playing with a controller or keyboard works just fine and there's barely a learning curve. The mutators were a fun inclusion but introduce so many new variables you might find yourself quickly frustrated or overwhelmed especially if the setup just doesn't work well. Try a few mutator matches and you'll see what I mean. My only gripe is that PC peeps can't find their PS4 pals in vise versa. Granted the multiplayer system is very streamlined and getting into a match takes no effort. But it would be nice to somehow get my friends in Hawaii in for marathon matches. And if you like to collect things like Pokemon there's plenty of DLC and bits to buy or find to keep your brain entertained. If you're a fan of Hockey Soccer Basketball Volleyball Rollerjam Cars Games Fun Life or Paul Reiser you need Rocket League.
title: Rocket League®

review: I started this game after losing consecutive matches to CS GO. For the starters like me I need approximately 20 hours to get used to the physics used in this game. This game is really good in terms of community and physics. Although a controller is recommended for PC users as well I managed to win some matches using a keyboard and mouse. This game is recommended for people who needed a break from FPS games. Another thing I like is that this game is not pay to win which most AAA games implanted micro transactions just for that.Gameplay 8/10Very unique gameplay as it uses a racing car to play 'soccer' in a field. Really liked the idea playing this game however some skills such as aerial hits requires quite some time to practice. Overall not a bad game for its price. Community 7/10I met less toxic people in this game probably in 1/15 matches. Most players I met uses a console to play this game. Performance 9/10Very good performance even on my low spec Nvidia laptop. Amazingly optimized for an Unreal Engine game compared to PUBG. Servers 7/10Servers are actually pretty good and optimised in general I have generally no complains except for servers located in Japan where lag is unbearable at times.

BUT&lt &lt &lt &lt &lt after playing it. IT'S A BLAST! Even hulled my wife over to play split screen with me. She made sounds I never heard her make ( and yeah shes made some sounds let me tell you ). Then I got my step son to play with us. ALL ON A SINGLE GAME AND ALL ON 1 COMPUTER! All the while we were on the same team with my brother in a online match! Thats some mother smack'n CO OP for you!The game it self is great! From casual folks who want to play from time to time to super competitive players this game suits all types. The game is also skill based every player is equal its how you play that affects the game. No single match is the same. There are quite a few modes to play.This game is awesome!

review: I played this for about 1 and a half years on PS4 and the switch to PC wasn t as painful as i expected.I didn t get to keep any of my items etc. which kind of is a bummer. But i can definetly let that slide. My PC is pretty mediocre atm (GTX 560 1GB FX 6100) and i get solid 160Fps on low med settings. I didn t expect such nice framerates this game runs incredibly well.I plugged in my PS4 controller and changed a few keybinds fine tuned the GFX and Camera and i was ready to go. I would recommend a controller but i have a friend of mine who plays on keyboard and mouse and he is doing completely fine. It s mostly what you re used to that matters.This is still one of my favorite games ever. It s a fairly simple concept but the skill ceiling is incredibly tall. There are air dribbles air drags fakes and that s just a few of the things your rocket powered car can do.There is so much you can do in this game there are so many ways to play and customize.And also you have the steam workshop which is constantly getting more content.You can find racetracks huge half pipes and even a literal toilet.I would recommend this to anyone that enjoys driving games but want s something new.This this is a breath of fresh air.

review: Rocket league is a simple yet dynamic game for all skill levels. Starting out as a rookie you will rise through ranks and playstyles alike. Where new players will have great fun in learning the elemental controls and hitting the ball where it hurts more advanced players will want to start testing the merits of flying. Having conquered these at an elementary level the fun starts for real. There's really no limit to the amount of idiotic tenuously difficult flying actions you can perform. And oh imagine the joy of leaving your opponents dumbfolded in sight of your absurdly awesome goals!

review: 40+ hours later and here is my review.GAMEPLAY Rocket League is basically FIFA but with cars. (soccar?)A game lasts five minutes with up to four people a team.And it is an incredibly fun and entertaining experience.The AI for bots is great as expected.The stadiums are always unique in a way.Online is a bit laggy but otherwise very entertaining.The Season Mode is always very challenging but fun.9/10 Addictive.GRAPHICS The visuals are stunning. Not much to say there is there?8/10 AmazingFRAME RATE The game is very laggy on higher resolution sadly. But I use small to medium sized resolutions and it runs close enough to 60 FPS.6/10 Choppy At TimesOVERALL A solid 8/10.The game is 100% worth it. Just play on a low resolution and average graphics.But if you look at all my negatives more then buy it on a small sale.

review: RC cars and Soccer (football for you Brits out there). What more could you want? It's tricky to get the hang of at first but once you get the controls down it's fairly simple. I've heard mixed debates over Keyboard or Controler gameplay and to be honest I find keyboard gameplay rather easy to learn. The only downside is that it seems the games can be weighted towards one color over the other. For instance if you have 4 players in one match Orange can beat Blue 10 1. If the same 4 players rematch Blue could win 7 2. Most of it is player skill Match Making is pretty good about putting similarly skilled players together. Other than that it's a blast! Highly reccomended for anyone into car/racing games or soccer(football)!

review: Let me tell you a story.A few days ago I stared a season. Each day I would play one match of this season. My team were Dinomoon. With Tex and Merlin at my side there wasn't anything we couldn't accompish. And we were winning games. We won 9 1 4 0 and other numbers. Then came the final the championship game. Dinomoob vs Dragons. We scored twice during the first 2 1/2 minutes. Then the Dragons pulled two back. Down to the wire. It came to extra time. We battered at the doors of Dragon castle but they just wouldn't let us in. They even attacked at us a fair bit. For 10 minutes we attacked then alas the Imp managed to get a shot in defelected off Tex. We lost. 3 2. I was heartbroken I was destroyed.I ing love this game. No other game has given me the excitement and nerve of attempting to beat a bunch of computers at what essentially is car football. I swear at one point it was 4 in the morning and I sat in my underpants eating doritos and trying to beat some stupid pirates. They're not even real people! Why do I care? I care because me Tex and Merlin are a team. We're the best around. We're Dinomoon.And Online play is pretty fun too.
title: Rocket League®

review: A game the allows you to jump in and straight away have fun but has lots of room to learn tricks and better ways to get the ball. Doesn't make you grind to get items you just unlock one after every match win or lose. Quite easy to get 100% on achievements if that's what you like.Great fun and highly addictive. Worth every penny.

review: Product received for free. Rocket League is my go to game to play at any given time. Even more so when friends are available to play. Gameplay is amazing. It's well optimized so that even PCs closer to the mid lower end can still run the game smoothly. Just don't expect to be great at the game right off the start. Only thing I've really had an issue with aside from queueing for comp 2v2s and getting matched against people with 300+ ping. Quite annoying. But other than that their servers can ocassionally be iffy but generally settle down after a short period of time.
title: Rocket League®

review: Product received for free. Rocket League is a game that always introduces new aspects to you and never lets you get bored. It is definitely a 'just 5 more minutes' game but amazingly entertaining at the same time. The trading community is excellent and finally getting an item you always wanted can leave you feeling so accomplished. The car customization itself is an awesome feature that offers so many different customizations. As you progress through the different skill levels there are new techniques to learn and playstyles which are awesome to know. The competitive scene behind this game is getting larger and it is so fun to watch such high level players play!All in all i'd completely recommend this game to anyone whether you're a casual player or very competitive!
title: Rocket League®

review: Simply the best bang for the buck game I've ever played on PC. Love how easy it is to drop in and play a few matches. This is the best way I've found to unwind after work and a great way to wake up the brain on the weekend. )

review: Rocket League is a very fast paced competitive game that one will not understand just how fun it is until they have played it. I have explained it to friends and they thought "oh that sounds cool" but when we did local play (yes you can do that what game does that now a days) we were yelling and screaming in excitement because Rocket League provides what one could call something like an adrenaline rush because you feel you must hurry and get the ball before others so that you can score a point before they do. I often found myself giving the controller a death grip which hurt my hands. There are a ton of things to unlock for your cars. I'm like 25 hours in and I'm a pretty good player and I'm still unlocking things. They even make holiday unlockables. Around Halloween you could have a candy corn trail instead of a normal rocket trail and all sorts of other things. Psyonix has done an outstanding job with this game and it's definitely paying off. This game is in the league of competitveness as Super Smash Bros and Call of Duty. I'm burnt out on Call of Duty too but both of those games are MLG and Rocket League has already become one. Defintely pick it up.

review: The game is a perfect time killer. Although it has one major issue MATCHMAKING.As a SEMI PRO ranked player I often get teamed with 2 absolute beginners or somebody who borrowed the game and is playing for the first time but as someone else using someone else's account and that someone often being ranked PRO or EXPERT. When in such a team I do play as good as I can but still lose by 5+ goals thus losing rank points and thus losing patience and the will to play further. I'm not saying that I am super good I already said I am SEMI PRO. But I can score goals defend and move well around the court even make nice assists when teammates know how to position themselves and play. An even bigger problem is that leaving this kind of game bans you for 15 minutes because you didn't finish it. What you put me in a team of noobs against a team of veterans and then expect me to wait until the game ends so they can pound me 21 2 or so? .. makes no sense.. I paid for the game and I want to play it it's not fair to ban people for being mad at your lousy matchmaking alhorithm.. If I find a teammate useless I would like to vote to kick him out. If you still need to allow people to leave you should at least ensure that the remaining team has a chance. But don't just let people leave the game when they want to and watch the remainder get pounded! I also played bunch of games with people who are as good as I am with some great players and in mixed teams rarely lost a game even those that I did lose I lost by 1 or 2 goals. Not 10. So to summarize...Gameplay 9/10Matchmaking 3/10Multi player fairness 5/10Graphics 7/10 (but don't need to be better)Menus 9/10General rules 8/10Physics 9/10 Overall 7.1/10
title: Rocket League®

review: Very fun game good for teaming or just alone
title: Rocket League®

review: Pro Fun game if you like playing against nothing but AI.Cons Everything.Matchmaking is atrocious and seems to give a flying f*** about putting players of similar skill together.Rank system is utterly ridiculous. You can win 9 games then lose 1 and end up at a lower rank than when you started.Game play. Have a player drop out mid game (due to lag or any other reason)? You're now playing with unbalanced teams. The game doesn't give any kind of handicap doesn't limit the other team to one less spawn or anything at all.The devs clearly give not one steaming sh!t about balanced play. The ONLY reason this game has anybody left playing is because they managed to get Valve to include it with Steam Controller purchases.
title: Rocket League®

review: A very addicting game! It's simple enough for just about anyone has nice graphics and sound design cool soundtrack and doesn't cost much. And with recent addition of Mutators it's even more fun! If I had to give any negative points to it is that there's no punishment to players that leave simply because the other team is doing better or even just scores 1 goal. It also doesn't seem to really take advantage of the Mutators settings in the public que only having less than 5 different possible settings that could appear. I would also love to see some dynamic maps with hills and stuff.

Then there was a discount and I bouthg it with 14$. after I played it a while I understood that this game worth 20$ and I recommend it to anyone! review: What I like to call the perfect "break" gameWhat I mean by the break game is that this game to me is a perfect escape from when you need a break from more serious games. Just lost a game of Dota or League and need to clear your head? This game will do it. This game is just pure instant fun that sucks you in every single match. it has all the fun and competition of gaming without the serious tone and attmosphere of other games.My only cons at this point are not really cons but more of what I would like to see become available in the game. I would like steam to support workshop for this game to create custom vehicle decals ad possibly even custom maps with obstabcles? I would also enjoy if the developers added a game mode with weapons it would be a seperate game mode but would be fun to be able to lay traps or blow up the ball handler with a rocket.10/10 worth the $

review: If you plan to go competitive/ranked be prepared for horrible matchmaking.You'll be matched vs 3 premades as solo you will play as Bronze vs. Gold and vice versa.Game sometimes randomly doesn't stop at 0 and allows play for a few seconds lost many battles due to this "amazing" feature.I removed my earlier negative review as I felt some things are better but again I'm left frustrated as I'm getting matched vs guys who randomly score 3 goals (15 bounces they don't even know how it went in) while my team is full of braindead noobs who don't even try to win. "xD" this is their most constructive sentence.Also their punishment for leavers is horrible. You'll see many many times players leave just after going 1 2 goals behind.In my placement games I had leavers in at least half of games.Ranked ladders are not transparent you have no idea how much you need to progress. TL DR if you're looking for casual fun and if you don't care about winning you'll enjoy and have funIf you want to climb up you'll face a tons of frustration nearly every game. Only case of avoiding this is that you're super talented or simply smurfing.3rd EDIT Still disguisting MM disguisting RNG disguisting teammates. Negative review till eternity.4th EDIT Piece of SH I T game I hate this pile of garbage. F****** rng everywhere. You destroy someone just to get a quadruple bounce into your net 3 F***** times in a row. I F***** hate this F****** game. It's not once that I had a streak of 10 games in a row where monkey team mates either troll of FF after 15 seconds. I wish I'm exaggerating.5th EDIT Losing 5 10 games in a row isn't rare same with wins. Perform well or bad it's RNG what decides. You lead 2 0 last 35s enemy scores 3 goals that even they cannot explain how that got in and this happens nearly every day.3 random guys matched with 3 premade team is a nonsense this happens nearly every game.Final Edit this game will never get my positive review not in a hundred years.Frustrations and imbalance is present in every game.
title: Rocket League®

review: I haven't had a game get a grip on my balls like this in awhile. After over 800 hours I feel compelled to write a review for my bottom . It's soccer with rocket cars. Extremely easy to pick up very very difficult to master. At the base level its fun to around like you're 6 years old in his first year of peewee soccer. You find new skins cars tires hats antennas boost styles goal explosions and chances to get ones that track stats or are painted a different color. They have random cosmetics drop in crates the keys are $1 each or can be traded for. Yes it would be nice to be able to just outright purchase the cosmetics you want but if you're used to player driven barter style economies (eg Guild Wars 1 TF2 etc) then it's nothing insane. You have 0 in game advantages for opening crates and the base game is easily worth the regular price let alone a sale. As you learn to not suck so bad you'll start to be exposed to the more advanced mechanics. Half flips aerial shots wall shots wavedashing dribbling flicking will break multiple controllers trying to even accomplish. There are basic practice minigames that let you hone the simple skills. Players can create their own practice maps to cover the more advanced mechanics and allow things to change over time while maintaining updated practices. The matches are 5 minutes. Goal replays and kickoff timer add a few seconds however a tie game will go into indefinite overtime. It's great for sneaking a match or two if you only have intermittent downtimes but can still steal hours of your life at a go. If you get bored of the 1v1 2v2 3v3 or 4v4 soccer matches you can play one of the other game modes basketball hockey dropshot or rumble. Private matches can be set up with a ton of mutators so you could play basketball with powerups and infinite boost. The world is your oyster.Overall I literally love rocket car soccer. 10/10
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is one of those games that is so hard not to love. There doesn't need to be a real drawnout love letter for the game it's simple it controls well and it's fun and could run on basically any machine too (on lowest settings) I read complaints about last years update adding essentially loot crates and keys and things. But I personally don't see a problem with it since it doesn't at all effect the gameplay experience you'd have to be pretty stupid to think a game is ruined because it has some paid cosmetics considering it doesn't at all effect the gameplay. Anyhoo I can't say anything competetively since this isn't a game I play with any kind of competetive attitude just a fun super cool game with jet powered RC cars playing soccer or basketball depending on the game mode. It's cheap it provides an enormous amount of entertainment and runs very well totally reccomend getting it if you have friends that play everything is better with friends D

review: Best game ever everyone who thinks to Buy it Go ahead its such a great Game for Casual and Competitive gamer! &lt 3Edit Generic game sadly there is no other option for a game like this cuz Copyrights for everything there is ) Real Review Community almost worse then League of Legends (Players are unfriendly and try to lookout for every mistake you make) Gameplay Kinda decent but lately Psyonix prefers Stupid Seasonal Passes and Cosmetics over Stable Gaming ) ( the most focus for the game devs is definitly on the Esport scene ) ps the servers are bad and laggy almost 24/7 the game really does give you a hit in the face if you dont have "Decent" connection. pps The only usable cars in the game are 1 Free car and 2 Cars which are 2$ each ) &lt 3 If you are thinking i might be a random just after a few hours doing a review (this account does exist to play with my friends who arent playing the game as frequent as i do. Overall my ranks are from Mid Tier to a quite Higher Tier with about 3000h on Record / about 15% afk/queue time The game overall was a good idea but the devs lost focus on it and well the physiques the servers the gameplay overall make the game less fun over time i would recommend the game to most of the people but dont pay 20$ on steam buy if from a key site like so you roughly pay 8 to 10$

review: ENG/ESPThis game is as fun and casual as it's strategic and complex!The mechanics are so simple yet so elegant. Learning curve takes a couple of minutes to master. But then it's game on!I find myself looking for new plays or moves to up my game. But if I feel like just running around chasing the ball it's still as fun.Also if you're at work/school and need to relax for a while Rocket League provides just the right dose. A match doesn't last more than 5 minutes so you can squeeze a couple of games in your break.Highly recommend this game!Wish the cars had different stats to further customize your game. But you know what? Doesn't matter! Tons of funI give it 9/10 peps D Este juego es la onda! Es tan casual y divertido como complejo. La mecanica es tan simple como elegante. Aprender a jugarlo toma solo un par de minutos. Me he dado cuenta que me pongo a analizar nuevas jugadas y formas de ganar pero si solo quiero correr detras de la pelota es igual de divertido.Si estas en el trabajo/escuela y tienes un rato libre es ideal para esa dosis de juego. Las partidas no duran mas de 5 minutos y son divertidisimas.Recomiendo altamente este juego!Le doy 9/10 peps )

review: I made fun of this game for a good 3 months before someone got me to play it..now It's on my favorites list and played casually.This is the only game I have ever played on my PC where prefer to use a controller as apposed to a keyboard and mouse. It is fast paced quick and dirty. You are a car..you have to slam a giant soccer ball into the other net and keep it away from yours..you can decorate your car and do flips.. you can fly through the air and slam into a giant soccer ball...sold.If you like sports games racing games or "party" games I highly recommend this. review: Have played this game for months on PS4 and am now diving into the PC version due to a few annoying issues with the PS4 version (which I won't bother getting into here). I'll give a brief rundown of a few pros and cons of this great game.Pros Addictive Fun Gameplay This game is simply a blast to play. It is one of those games that you'll tell yourself you'll play for an hour and then 6 hours later it's 3am and you're still going. The game controls really well the physics are mostly very good and it's a game that you feel you can constantly improve at and get just a little better and play a little smarter as you learn it which keeps you motivated. Beautiful Graphics Other than a few small missteps this is an impressive looking game particularly the backgrounds of the various stadiums. Great Soundtrack The music in the menu screens is just phenomenal there's nary a weak track to be found. I'll sometimes loiter in the menus longer than I should just because I don't want to stop listening to the music.Cons Ranking System is Terrible This is the one big flaw with the game. It's just a horrible attempt at a ranking system that honestly defies logic. Basically you gain and lose the same ranking points at game 1 as you do at game 10 000 which makes zero sense in a ranking system. Your ranking should fluctuate heavily in your first 50 or so games before slowly settling into a zone and the points you get from each match declining as your ranking gains more weight. Instead you have to grind your way up the rankings from the very beginning gaining a meager 6 8 points for your first win when you should be gaining 100+. Community Elements Are Lacking In Game There are no online teams or any kind of online leagues or tournaments in the game which is a huge disappointment (you can play a season mode offline). There isn't even any kind of in game friend system or easy way to invite a player to a party you're forced to use PS4/Steam's features to get a player into your group. Game Can be Humbling This is a game that can make you feel like a complete dolt at times as you inexplicably whiff on a ball you were sure you had lined up.Would definitely recommend this game to just about anybody even those who don't typically like sports or team games as it's so unique and entertaining that it deserves a look.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket leauge is a great competitive game. Matchmaking is quick for the most part and the ping is good if you are looking for matches in your area. The customization is good and isn't all too hard to unlock everything. There are tires cars paints antennas hats. All of the cars tires (etc) have been thought through and made fantastically so there isn't one car that everyone likes while the others are poorly designed. The game is really easy to play with friends and to have a good time and mess around or can be very competitive with ranked. Even though the game may seem repetitive to some players the more you play and the better you get the more fun you will have. I would highly reccomend this game. $20.00 might be asking a little to some people but i say that it is a fair price. In my opinion you should only buy this game if you want to endulge many hours into it.But I feel like it is a must buy sometime down the road for everyone.

review: Played it since the release and it has a really steep learning curve. Once you get the controls it's quite some fun if you get to play with/against equal teams. I want to give it a thumbs up but matchmaking is pretty much non existent which results in completely ed up ranked games and tons of leavers in normal games.Edit 24.03.18 Community is still cancer. Matchmaking still sucks.Edit 07.09.18 Community a tad less cancer(still too much) and instead of giving us nice rewards for still playing we get to pay more for a bunch of useless locked behind another paywall
title: Rocket League®

review: If you have some good Matches its fun and with a good team its even better.As always in such PvP arena games...I don't know how good or bad matchmaking is but it seems that singleplayer or 2 player teams always have a massive disadvantage cause they often get beginners and lowskill Soloplayers in their team and get matched against premade teams. Even if you have a good team the matchmaking rips it apart and takes good teammembers from your team to the enemy team after one match.Events are fun and you get some things for your cars or something.Also many games there are too many unskilled players or trolls just jumping around stupily and disturbing more then they help. So even if you shoot 2 4 Goals on your own you get even more goals against your team cause some players are too confused with thier steering and just go for the ball like lemmings or bots skip the ball to the enemy or shoot owngoals.So in the end most of the time you have to watch for your own random teammembers that they don't ruin the game and this is extreme annoying after a couple of games even if you win.After so many games I can only partly recommend this game cause it is no fun at all if you see that you can win a game nearly alone cause the enemy is weak and just one unskilled player can ruin it all. And this is happening in 6 of 10 games. Or you get matched as soloplayer in 0 6 games with one minute left. But the rest of the games it is fun buy it in sale.
title: Rocket League®

review: It's car soccer (or football whatever floats your boat).Some people take this inherently silly game way too seriously but it's a fun game. Fun with friends fun alone. It gets intense at times but at 5 minutes long the games never have a chance to get so heated that it makes you truly steamed.You'll also routinely impress yourself with something you did half purposely half accidentally. Gameplay The gameplay is reliably pretty good and since the addition of mutators (alternate game modes with things such as a ball that's a cube) the game has a lot more variety. There's offline play if you can't do online but with some practice you might find that the bots aren't actually all that good except for the occasional impossible shot they'll make. 9.5/10Graphics/Visual Experience Unique to say the least. A good looking game without needing to be too showy. They're not trying to blow your mind with god rays and bloom and individually animated blades of grass but everything has a unified feel and looks like they really paid attention when making the game. 8.5/10Sound The sound effects are good and you'll quickly learn what each unique sound tells you about what's happening when your camera is pointing the other way. The directional sound is good enough that I can routinely dodge people trying to rear end me by listening to their engine. On top of all this the soundtrack is absolutely sublime. 10/10Replayability Somehow the gimmick of car soccer on only cosmetically different stages has some surprising life in it. This simple game doesn't get old nearly as fast as you'd expect. 9/10How it Runs Very well. Considering how simple the game is I'd be disappointed if it were poorly optimized at all.

review: Pro side + Incredibly addictive and fun for a while.+ High skill cap.Con Side Fun only for a short while because the gameplay is actually incredibly shallow as well. No support for anything it seems except keyboard and XBOX controller. I can't get any of my Logitech or Thrust devices to work and I am not alone. There are mapping tools out there that have been suggested but also only work for a few of us. No friggin proper camera!No kidding this game has no proper camera! While mouse free look is standard in just about every single 3rd person view game on PC the developers of this game decided to skip this basic feature and just make it random whether you see anything or not. There are rumors it was to prevent advantages of PC players over console players since the game is cross platform. You can lock your camera on the ball getting your camera blocked by walls or losing sight of the goal other players or your own car while the camera is zoomed in on the ball in mid air or while driving along walls or you can lock the camera on your car losing sight of everything but your car again.Of course there is the camera swivel feature which is about as useful as the other camera features. You can't control the swivel degree you simply throw your head around in one direction and try to identify whatever just whizzed by on your screen because even if you stopped the swivel from going almost all the way to the rear it snapped back to the front view instantly. If you want to keep your eye on something to your side for longer than a split second you need to twitch the camera into that direction giving you some kind of epileptic vision which coincidentally is exactly the same effect you get when you try to use the swivel with your mouse movements. People quit nonstop. Whether it is connection related or intentional quitting you often feel like playing with and against a line of players. Every 20 seconds its "next please!". No proper chat support. Right only people on the PC version can write in/read the chat. The people playing on consoles are restricted to chat commands and unfortunately they seem to enjoy it a lot. Probably an incredibly high tech feature on consoles they love it SO much that many console players will spam the hell out of the chat commands. Together with the beep that comes with the command it gets annoying and is unblock able. You are only able to block people in voice chat. Lack of customization. Cars all have the same stats according to the developers' official statements but slightly different hit boxes. If I could tinker with my car tuning it with more than just a handful of visuals (and hats! wtf!) the fun would last a lot longer.Verdict Fun game but shallow and lacking the most basic features of ANY game namely Proper camera proper chat proper peripheral support.Not worth 20 bucks IMHO unless maybe you are a console player and got used to all the ridiculously low tech features anyway.
title: Rocket League®

review: EDIT They appear to have fixed the problem I was complaining about. As of January 1 2016 the online gameplay was fluid and smooth. Truly an enjoyable experience. This is one of (if not the) best competitive automobile soccer games on the market (a huge library to be sure.)The single player experience unfortunately is the same as below but with the improved servers who wants to play single player?Do NOT buy this game until they fix the servers. The lag makes this game unplayable online. Everyone rubberbands all over the court. I had a game where the ball just appeared in our net.If you decide to play this game offline with ai teammates you should also be prepared for disappointment. On rookie difficulty a toddler could destroy the ai 10 0. One step up to pro and it seems like you are playing against 7 players when it is truly 4 v4.I had a season where I lost 4 games 0 1. all 4 goals were scored by my ai teammates (out of 9 games.)I cannot believe a certain angry gamer gave this solid 4 game a 9 out of 10 with a badass seal of approval.

review: About or over 100 hours and this game is still fun! (I played 2 months after release on PS4) I never liked playing Sports games because they never interested me but this is the only one that does. It has improved by so much from all the updates I missed out on (stopped playing for about 5 6 months on PS4) and I can tell the devs are working their best on this game. So far all maps and new gamemode updates are free Car DLC is not a must own You do not need a Middle End PC to run over atleast 55 FPS (I have a GTX 750 Ti and runs at a constant 60+ FPS and max is 125 FPS on Max Settings) Community isn't that cancer.. about a 3.5/10 cancer level I do recommend this game for anyone no matter what types of game you play(if you dont like competitive play dont play Ranked) Well optimized NOT a pay to win gameThe only thing i can think of thats bad is the Keyboard/Mouse bindings(Unless youre able to learn them fast)I personally use my PS4 controller.10/10

Just make sure you go online before passong judgement.

review: This is the first online multiplayer game to have me screaming in joy just woke up my fiancée when scoring a goal at the very last second.Now more objectively it's a soccer game in which you play as only a single player. Not only that your entire body regulates the angle at which the ball is launched so it's actually more akin to playing as a single foot of a soccer player trying to hit the ball just right. There's a lot of the tactical depth of a regular soccer game with an execution challenge layered on top. Awesome.

review: In my opinion one of the best games I've played over the past few months and if you like the idea of RC Cars combined with footbal/soccer it is definitely worth the 20 bucks.Rocket League has a great learning curve combined with a simple "easy to play hard to master" playstyle.Personally there are just a few downsides being a laptop player there are some maps which give me a FPS drop (for example Aquadome in which i play with 40 45 FPS rather than the usual 60) but with a decent PC you won't have that problem. The second downside apllies mostly to casual games where you find all those salty players who leave at the very instant when the other team scores a 1 2 or a 0 1.Overall it is a brilliant game with great gameplay mechanics and a mostly very nice community.

review: This game is amazing! it is so well made and super fun to play anytime. you can play with your friends or just hop into a game with some new people no matter what you do its always fun to play! I have 31 hours under my belt of this game and im already a level 21 Pro its super fun i did all that in just a week!! its not hard to get good it definently took some getting used to but with enough of time and many bad games lol you will get better. I highly recommend using a controller as it is much easier than mouse and keyboard.VVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVV Read Below VVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVOne problem I realised was that when i first got the game it was super laggy and it was not internet lag so if you are expirencing this here is an easy way to fix it. Simply go to your options and go to Video Settings switch all the settings that say Quality or High Quality to High Performance or Performance then uncheck the box that says Motion Blur at the very bottom now this last thing might not be necessary but go into a game and if you still lag then turn of High Quality Shaders at the very top of the check boxes.Other than that this game is excellent and by far my favorite game ever made I would recommend this to a friend or just a random person. It is so well made and is amazing and awesome! Hope this review helped thank you for reading it!

review: I first played this game on the PS4 as it was free. Once I played a few matches and saw some of my friends had it on Steam I glady gave them my money and bought for the PC.What can you say aboutt his game? Fast frantic easy to pick up hard to master and get the timing down for lob shots and floating balls! Lots of options to customize your car and winning something after every match really makes you want to play one more to get the cool item! My only con is the lag sometimes on the servers as I only pick US East or West and while there are plenty of players online most of the time it is never a full game. The AI players in a MP match are brutal and usually the best player and just destroying everybody. I really hope they come out with maybe a different game type more cars more items and stages. I would gladly pay another 5 bucks for a DLC pack. Pick this game up you won't be disappointed!
