review: Imma be realistic and try not to make out the game too well Pros Training Training training training This game has brought a new level and dimension of training You dont just go around hitting the ball Or doing some dumb task for points Proffisional players still use the training because it is very very realistic and gives great scenarios depending on the diffeculty of your chosen level so if you are new or a great rocketeer the training is a nice destination to head. There is no wait You dont wait for no games No loading screens No players (for more than 15 seconds if some jerk left the match before start) No waiting for dlc to buy even . You can just head on to the great training have a match with bots see the garage SOOOO may things you can do to spend that 1 minute match making Started from the bottom now it is here This game started as "Supersonic Acrobatic Rocket Powered Battle Cars! "which was an indie game for PS3 made by a very talented person The game had its own fourm for all the players to talk and mengle And it had many good changes from that small game #Thank_Psyonix The Game is not controlled by any company or any one other than the developers . so dont expect some thing like tencent from that other league to come in and make you buy dumb stuff Customization If you wanna game you probably read that there are more than 1 BILLION diffrent ways to make your car well that is with out the new updates the dlcs and the epic stuff each car has . i would say no less than 1.4 Billion. Not Pay To Win No matter what some one told you Lets say you baught the batmobile It is no diffrent than a Battle Car that is free I dont remeber what it is called but there is a video of some one doing the math for every dlc car So the DLC is all just more customization Quick chat . You dont have to waste time typing There is quick chat which allows you to say stuff like Thanks! . Take the shot. Wow! OMG! ! #$ . The Players You rarely see a douch that says "wow you suck " or "you should uninstall" the game is just too fun for that i Guarentee that you will laugh so hard while playing it because of the derpy stuff that keeps happening Mute and report function God i wish more games had that You can even mute all players with 1 button. Not repetetive if you feel it is then there are sooo many modes you can play Still feeling that You have mutator setting to setup mini games and even prank some friends in a private matchCons The game Does not punish People hard enough if you leave any match it is a 15 min ban . with a loss ofc the player/s that are in your team will have a huge disadvantage and lose their match and maybe their rank even after leaving 4 times in a row it is still 15 min ban . The AI is not that good to be honest you can read it like the palm of your hand While i was level 8 i won a 1v1 vs an allstar bot becauase he was so easy to read at that time i didnt even know you could walk on the wall and jump. Ranked is open to every one So smurfs and newbies that think they got it will jump into ranked no problemo Trolling is super easy Like Really really easy . You cant change some DLC cars At the time of writing this there is only the time machine in back to the future and the batmobile that you cant change any thing about them except for color Which kinda sucks This is a small one but i think it is worth mentioning In the training you dont see the ball until like 3 seconds In the launcher trainings that makes it very hard to predict the ball so some times you have to memorize the training which isnt that realistec In my opinion the acheivments in this game are bad i didnt feel that i have acheived much with 32 Cant add friends Or party with console players .Final Rating 8.7/10 Should fix some stuffalso this game has alot of dlcs LOLyou should buy this if you are the guy that is competitve and wants to have fun

review: Rocket League is a very enjoyable and addicting game that can consume all of your time in what seems like just a few minutes. It's high action feel combined with the teamwork aspect makes it a great game to play with friends. There are so many play styles made possible by Rocket League's manuevering controls. It's as addicting as CSGO but takes about 1/12 the time to play a competitive game. It is easy to pick up but complicated enough to give challenges to players of all skill levels. The well created ranking system gives you motivation to get better. It makes for a great time with friends filled with lots of laughs.

review: Oh perfectly wonderful...Let's start with game length it's short so there's no huge commitment time wise but it's long enough to get a bit invested in your team winning and notice who's on the enemy team. Then there's teams. You can get into a party with your buddies and keep going but the moment one of you has to leave that doesn't interrupt the others from continuing. Or if you accidentally get into a game without a party member when you leave the game you don't just automatically leave the party too. Then there's the actual gameplay pure genius. the physics are fun. Driving on walls is fun. Blowing people up is fun. Play this game if you like to have fun. The practice arena is nice for noobs to hone some of their skills and learn more about the mechanics of the game. It's missing something as far as challenge goes but it's hard to really go there with anything practice for video games. True practice comes from the arena. It really isn't optimal for a mouse and keyboard but hopefully the controller coming in... eventually... will change things for me. Anyway it's a great game for just hanging out having fun being indecent human beings and enjoying a good explosion or two.

review: This is a really great and addicting game yet only a few little adjustments should be added.You have to buy keys which is really annoying. I have a few crates and I was really hoping to be able to open them until I heard that keys cost money which is really disappointing. I would really like if keys could be acheived through playing the game.Secondly bots and afk people are not easily kicked. Sometimes I have to play a whole 5 minute game of ranked just so that I do not rank down even though it is an easy and time consuming win. Playing against these bots and afk people are somewhat common in ranked solo games.Other than these two things Rocket League is a really addicting and well made game. Please do not take these things into account too harshly when considering buying this game.Hope this helps. )

review: I love this game well worth it's money. It's very fun and different. Most games like this get boring but this game doesn't very easily. I am having some problems. I take my computer over to a friends house and want to show them my stuff but they don't have internet and I'm in offline mode. I'm logged into my steam account but I'm player two not my profile so all my things are gone. So I thought it wasn't too much a problem but when I close the game and do something else and return to the game I have to start all over making the game pointless to play offline. Anyone else have/has this problem if you know how to fix this can you message me please. the kids were kind of sad all the stuff they unlocked was gone and the 3 hours they spent were for nothing. Another problem I'm having is split screen. i know it can but for some reason it won't. I believe I need two X box controllers or another controller all together but shouldn't I be able to play with my keyboard and mouse while the other player gets my controller? Any advice about this?But these little problems are mostly personal this doesn't take away from the game in anyway. It's still an amzing game and kids really really love it. Not sure if it's only me but losing the stuff bugs me didn't so much the kids but did to me. Other then those little problems I have nothing against this game. I love it and glad I bought it and I don't really buy games so that is saying a lot. I hope someone can help me with these little problems if so thank you if not enjoy this epic game.

review: Rocket League brings fun soccer games but it's not for everyoneAs the header clearly states this is a very fun game on making soccer with speeding cars. The controls are fairly easy to learn on what moves you have to make during a fast paced match and you need to know when and where to do them. There are two camera angles you can play the game one is focused on the ball and the other is focused behind your car. Most of the time you will likely use the ball cam. Switching between these two camera angles will become necessary in a match depending on the situation.The soundtrack is good if you like upbeat electronic music some of them you might be interested in listening to outside of this game if you wish. Gameplay is solid and people will have fun playing this game no matter what your skill level is. I recommend playing this game either with friends or with other random people. My only complaint is that the gameplay can become repetitive if you do not 'spice' things up if you will. There are other modes of variety to offer but the core gameplay is still the same and the repetitive gameplay can turn some people off.If you think you want to buy this game or not I made a simple fan made trailer summarizing the game. It is a bit dated since I released this back in July 21st 2016 when it was up to date at the time. But the core gameplay is still the same. https //www.youtube.com/watch?v 8aQxDEZl0RcThe DLC for the premium vehicles offered here is unnecessary and you don't have to get them to enjoy this game. Personally I didn't feel a very significant difference in gameplay when driving the DLC cars compared to the normal cars that everyone can get. Overall the game is fun with good gameplay if you like soccer car action in a videogame.8/10
title: Rocket League®

review: I absolutely love this game since it combines two of my favorite things cars and soccer.If you love either you will love this game. It is a very non demanding game that is very very easy to learn and get used to. One thing I would recommend is having your favorite controller ready to play with this game since the keyboard and mouse can be very hard to use.I love this game's customizability and the ingame items that you can buy such as dlc cars and keys are very well priced. Rocket league is a great essential game to have if you have a laptop and controller you can carry around and play games on. Overall this game would get a 9/10 from me.
title: Rocket League®

review: Since I bought this game back in July I ve played Rocket League almost every day and I m still loving every second of it. The game is so simple so elegant in its design that regardless of your skill level it s easy to just dive in and have a great time whether you re playing it competitively or just for fun. It possesses that hard to define and often intangible quality that all the best games possess excellent game feel. That empowering sense of control where even the smallest actions you can perform feel good to do in and of themselves every significant one rewards you with satisfying visual and aural feedback. It all culminates to give you this this profoundly visceral experience where every barely missed goal every epic save every daring aerial manoeuvre it all inspires the kind of nail biting tension that has you on the edge of your seat inhaling sharply through clenched teeth.As it stands Rocket League is my multiplayer game of the year and it would take something absolutely mind blowing to dethrone it at this point. Kudos to all the men and women at Psyonix who helped to make this game a reality!
title: Rocket League®

review: For 15 and less than 3 for each DLC you can't really fault this game. Flawless mechanics Fluid control scheme (however i did change the drift button on my 360 pad to LB instead of X) Endless replayability each game feels unique in its playthrough (that is online) Endless customisation for the vehicles with new cosmetic items coming out regularly (couple of times a month on average) Offline gameplay will become boring fast i imagine most people do season just for the achievement anything other than 1v1 on ranked when you are playing solo can be potentially frustrating as there are bad apples in every community (or apples with pitiful motor skills) but its not hard to find a group or partner over all the community is quite friendly compared to most pc games As you can see from my playtime the snappy 5 minute games are hard to walk away from especially if you are winning

review: Do you have an expensive gaming gear a good microphone experience with soccer games and enough money to get DLCs? Well you won t need any of those because all you need is a good connection and a controller. Welcome to Rocket League where as a starter it will be a struggle for you to get out of lower ranks due to smurfs. You will be flexed on with high end items and use a voice chat which sounds like the voice chat from 2000 s Valve games. Not to mention that if you live in Asia you will never find a game to play and you ll have to play on NA or EU servers where the ping is higher than the population in Asia. The game itself offers a lot of opportunities and hours of entertainment. Play it with your friends or if you don t have any make some inside the game. Also please don t use camera shake just disable it there s no need to use it. Thank You!

review: I've never been a fan of soccer. Pretty boring sport if you ask me. However This is the best game ever made. I have 2500 hours in the game and I am not stopping any time soon. It's easy to get into the game and start learning the basics. You can join in matches and play with others at your skill. Then as you improve so will your competition. The skill cap is huge on this game. There's always new skills and techniques being discovered like the wave dash and ceiling shots. Buy it!

The practice sessions are extremely helpful and the learning curve is concorded quickly and gives you are real sense of accomplishment when you celebrate your first goal by ripping off your Dorito covered shirt. Recommend playing with a controller and forgetting anything you knew about Soccer before entering an online match and pray that you have good teammates.

review: I CAN'T STOP PLAYING SEND HELP.Rocket League is a combination of football and rocket powered cars done in such a way that it is far greater tha the sum of its parts. title: Rocket League®

review: This game is absolute madness! In a good way.Pros Decent selection of options to customize your vehicle (more unlock as you play). Suspense filled matches as the timer decreases and both teams are on par with each other. Easy pre set chat options to help communicate with your team. Lots of fun especially with friends! Ranked play for thrill seekers. Nice selection of music tracks to listen to while in the menu. Graphics and gameplay are well done.Cons No clear distinction between vehicles in terms of hit boxes. I would suggest having hit boxes shown in a practice setting so players can find a vehicle that suits their play style (there really shouldn't be much difference as all the cars go the same speed but their hit boxes may skew the angles at which the ball rebounds). If you are playing a ranked match and your teammates decide to leave they won't be replaced. This basically means the opposing team will have an unfair advantage and automatically win the match and you will lose rank points just for getting paired up with toxic players. No anti gravity space mode where the real madness ensues. Can't drive upside down at the top of the stadium and drop down to scare people.
title: Rocket League®

review: Time machineYour girlfriend your parents your friends will all hate this game. But you you will not... because you know the secrets it holds. This game is actually a time machine to the future. 5 minutes in game is equal to 25 in the real world. This makes it possible to boost towards the future. This will transform your life! Ever waited for that slow friend yet again? Boot up Rocket League and BOOM 10 minutes later deep in overtime your friend must wait for you as you pull off the best powerslide! What about your girlfriend? Boot up Rocket League and BOOM 15 minutes later no one can play just one game your girlfriend is watching you pull off the sickest aerial ever known to man! It's a self goal but who cares? What about your sleep? Boot up Rocket League and BOOM 840 minutes later because one game is just warm up people are showering you with compliments ("What a save!") as you fake the most epic saves whiffing left and right! What about your boring vacations? Boot up Rocket League and BOOM 7 days later because Prospect I is for noobs you're actually not terrible and you discover that the cars with matching colors are your teammates. You use this knowledge to your advantage by trying to outscore your teammates in points. You lose the match but win the scoresheet. What about your summer vacation? You fire up Rocket League and BOOM 1 month later because you need to nail he dribbling you've understood that ranked is where you play to win. You smash into as many opponents as possible knowing this must guarantee your stupid teammates an easy opportunity to score and win making sure you the MVP can climb the ranks. What about the free time you need to kill afterlosing tour day time job because you played RL at work? You fire up Rocket League and BOOM half a year later with 500 hours in game you will still be a beginner in this game but you will have time traveled HALF A YEAR! It's a bit much but you just need one. more. game...(Holy s*** I'm writing a crappy review for this game in the middle of the night solely because i love it. Just buy it you silly nob.)10/10 would recommend. Use a controller.
title: Rocket League®

review: A highly polished version of Supersonic Rocket Powered Battle Cars First ImpressionsI debated getting this game for a long time as I had already played SRPBC on the PS3 to death.That game was insanely difficult due to horrible camera angles and lack of polish but once you mastered it is was a lot of fun with friends!Fast forward to the 2015 holiday sale where I saw the hype after 6 months was not dying down. For the price and for the nostalgia I decided to get it (as with most games on the sale... is this what they call "hoarding"?).I am happy to see that this is pretty much the same game but with very clean cameras and it runs like butter on my 4 year old system on maximum settings.ProsHighly polished version of a game that was insanely fun but never got much coverage.Customizability letting you give your car a personalized touch though I'm not sure I like the microtransactions part.New modes and content being added to the game give this replayability.Matchmaking is very populated taking mere seconds to find you a match.ConsPeople rage quit matches after 1 lost goal. On 2v2 this is particularly annoying as you end up playing with AI vs a strong duo due to people wanting easy wins.I will update this review as I play more. For now my first impressions are very high regarding this game. My only regret is not buying this half a year ago.Also very important to note play this game with a controller. If you do not own one this might not be enjoyable for you.
title: Rocket League®

review: This is a tough one to review but made harder by Steams stupid rating system of Yes or No.The game is superb fun beautiful and addictive.The issue is that since launch the servers have been a nightmare game breaking lag downtime turn off social features and more.We've seen no progress on fixing it just a post in the forum that claims they are fixing the issue but weeks later nothing has improved.The game is now festering on the installed games list but now never played because of the unplayable lag.You think your driving at the ball then you go to hit the ball and you realised the ball is actually at the other end of the pitch. You turn you car right and it jumps 10 feet to the right and then fires you forward across the pitch to only then fire you back to where you started.Right now don't waste your money monitor the forums and wait for evidence that this games servers have been fixed.

review: Rocket League is a Salt Mine. You have three types of people in this game you got the people who try there ing asses off like if they dont win there family is going to be killed by Fire. then you got your mentaly people who you just want to scream at them to ing do somthing usefull then you got your salty as people where they cry like little babys if they dont win. now I will admit that I want to throw my monitor across the room at times where I get player number two 5 times in a row and lose five times in a row on comp. Now I love this game and when everything goes great is is one hell of a game those last min it moments where your down 5 to 0 and you make that epic come back those are great moments and you will truly remember them (also there is one more type of person there called the quiters they will either just leave the game if the other team scores 3 point and you guys have zero or even worse they try to make your team just give up and forfit.) If you made it this far turn around I am standing behind you.

review: Fun times await!In my opinion a casual game with a good learning curve. The learning curve adds good depth to the game. What amazes me more is how various other video games and brands online media publishers for video games etc have been included in the game in the form of car's visual additions. Flags etc. I can also wave my own country flag attached to my car. I love it!16/07/2018 If you are in India and are getting above 100 ping on all servers then turn your router ON and OFF. Do it a couple times till you get lower pings. This is a issue on your ISPs side assigning you to a zone in their network which just gives high pings all over accross most game you will ever play on the internet. I know this becuase I have had many times where I had low pings in the 60s as well for the same in game region. Go try it.

review: Rocket League is maddeningly fantastic. I have put easily 100 hours on the PS4 verson and am slowly swapping to playing on PC more and more. Straight up. I LOVE this game. I am quickly getting a routine of playing a game when I get up practicing at lunch and getting a few games at night. I make games for a living and this game hits all the check boxes. It may infact be the perfect game for E Sport. A word of warning though. The matchmaking system is exceptinally busted. Expect to be frustrated with it in it's current build. Word on the street is this will be fixed soon. So train up!

review: Not recommended for patriotic Liechtensteiners who wish to fly their most beloved flag people who become sad and depressed when beaten at games or people that become angry serial killers when beaten at games. If you believe you aren't one of those things go right ahead. But please don't kill me if you find out you actually are that third one. Turns you into the kind of person that would steal an own goal from your teammate. What a save! What a save! What a save! No way! What a save! What a save! What a save! (Repeat ad nauseam) AI teammates somehow annoy both you and your opponents at the same time whilst still being useless. That absolute friggin' LUCK SHOT ARE YOU KIDDING ME F$ ! Aquadome. Lack of any real storyline. Feeling of helpless despondency when your opponent bicycle aerial backwards scores. Why so many crates? Makes a bad sense of time management absolutely catastrophic.BUT+Oooh shiny new thing in crate. Doesn't it look so good on me?+Feeling of immense victory when you bicycle aerial backwards score whilst your opponent watches.+Neo Tokyo.+Cars are balanced with seemingly identical top speeds so non sporty types can actually achieve something with the ball for once.+Jumping off the walls at people like a demented spider.+Can imagine yourself being a professional after winning (until/unless you actually watch ranked competitive gameplay)+Self explanatory gameplay.+You are a rocket car that flies and (probably) has a hat what more do you want out of life?+Rockets (Please see above)
title: Rocket League®

review: 11 Oct 2018 The average age of the community has gotten a lot younger the average IQ has dropped below 90 the average racism has reached Third Reich levels and the average skill level for the ranks that I used to consider not bad (Plat III and above) is now absolute bull feces. It is true that this is the only game I still play everyday but 10 minutes after every time I open the game I get tachycardic due to the community's absolutely disgusting character traits and words and I close down the game. I don't think I will continue playing this game if it goes on like this. Literally all my friends have uninstalled it for good. Instead of your crates and idiotic chat ban system dear Psyonix do something about your disgusting community rating your game "for ages 3 and above" earns you a lot of money but it's gonna be us veteran gamers who'll play this game years after it stops being popular not those kids that you exclusively cater to. On the long run you will be dead poor and forgotten.
title: Rocket League®

Could still be the OS even though they're right in the settings but if not I hope this gets fixed.

review: A great game that elegantly represents the idea "easy to pick up difficult to master"The game shines in it's simple clean execution of a soccer game where the players are cars. There isn't a ton of information to wrap your head around. Pick a vehicle throw some decor on it if you want and hit the field.The bots are pretty good to newcomers although seasoned players will need to turn to online play to feel a real challenge. Even so you can work on your trickier shots in trainings seasons and exhibitions in order to feel more competitive in online play.The graphics are exactly what you'd want good enough to be pleasing but clearly not the focus of the game. The color palette is fun and energetic and the particle effects make you excited about scoring goals boosting around and demolishing the opposition.The sound is expertly crafted to provide enough atmosphere to feel immersed but not so much that it draws your attention from the real focus working as a team to score goals.Overall I'd say this is one of those games that everyone should have in their library eventually. It appeals to casual and hardcore gamers and the 5 minute match length means it's something you can pick up and put back down with ease. Well maybe not put down with ease. This game will definitely give you that "one more game..." itch and boy does scratching it feel good.

review: *** I have like 80 100 hours in this game and i am pretty sure i can write a review on pros and contras **PROS Like that you can play with coss platform players. Nice about you can play split screen if you have 1keyboard/controller and 1 controller. The rank system are done nicely. I like the physics in this game and how you manage to litterally fly with the ball marking an goal. You can pimp your car with an infinit of possiblytis. A lot of games like dropshot ruble hoops.Now come the contras **CONTRAS You can't trade or add player cross platform but only your platform. Is not so optimized they can do so much more with the engines. You can't choose the map on what you want to play on online They don't have the Market selling/buying things like wheels m. decals etc... You need to add an player to trade with him.You can't give him a trade link...*** After that i think i can recommend this game.

review: The story starts with that strange game called Supersonic acrobatic rocket powered battle cars some years ago and I was wandering what a title that is? It sound like not one but two game trying hard to get your attention.Then I tried.It was like learning to go on bike all over again you can feel it. And meanwhile you are struggling around to control the car the way you want you have to hit that big ball to score just like in football.It had one of the most complex control scheme of the games I played and after awhile after you play online games against others and stumble on a skilled player (they were very few back then) and see them flying and striking a score meanwhile you are trying to understand where you are before you realize you are now watching the replay of the goal after that and then some. After all the shame you have felt for being "bad" you take all your faith you have in yourself and with the ball floating way way up in the air you jump hit the boost after having tilted your car upwards and try to guide it where the ball will be in the next 0.5 seconds. Scared you see the oppent doing the samething. You have to be there first. Boost! You hear the virtual metallic clash and as the ball start going downwards but the trajectory is far off what you wanted. No time to even think that you could have done better and you see your teamate charging through the field with beams comin out of his wheels and hitting the ball at full speed and sending it right in the oppent's goal. The ball explode. Joy and brotherhood.A rush that hardly elsewhere you can feel.Oh yes now in Rocket League!So glad you have developed these games Psyonix.And here I think there is much more room then only multplayer for such a massive freedom of control of this funny cars!
title: Rocket League®

review: For $20 you get a lot with this game 4 player local and online coop custom training for practicing offline career mode Steam workshop for custom maps from users modifiers to change things up every once and a while a huge player base continued support from Psyonix with new maps and items and a core gameplay that's so fun and addicting that "... Just one more game" will become your catchphrase. It's a fun game for the whole family easy to pickup and play but has enough depth that makes mastering it worth the first few dozens of hours of feeling like a newborn trying to walk for the first time. The community of the game is huge with the competitive scene being pretty fierce and you can find games pretty easily from my experience on standard game modes. I highly recommend giving this game a chance though I would recommend using a controller for the best time.

review: Just owning this game exacted a childhood dream of mine to play soccer BUT WITH ROCKET PROPELLED CARS BABY!Pros Easy to play Hard to master. Your cars get hats.....need I say more? Many customizable options for your vehicles to show off your style (and Hats!) Cross Platform play to ensure maximum potentional victims/teammates. Just a great quick way to blow off some steam and just have fun. Awesome soundtrack (for what it's worth)Cons The Cross Play function doesn't allow you to Party up with friends from other platforms...yet. The Bots that replace real people in online matches normally help the other team. Doesn't make your meals for you.Overall I'd give this game a solid 9/10 with the other 1/10 coming when they have fully figured out the Cross Platform play and get their servers all up to 100%. But in any case this game is a MUST BUY!

review: This will probably be my favourite game of the year unless the Sept Dec period brings something truly remarkable. Nothing else has been so reliably fun.I was just answering a question from someone else "Why is this game fun?". The answer I gave is that it's half super slick aerial moves that make you feel omnipotent and half impotent panic as you're forced to watch the ball drift past you because you couldn't manoeuvre in time (or as I put it half Pod Racing and half Inflatable Sumo Wrestling in a pub garden). The tension between those two game states is weirdly addictive.

review: Soccer meets driving once again in the long awaited physics based sequel to the beloved arena classic Supersonic Acrobatic Rocket Powered Battle Cars! A futuristic Sports Action game Rocket League equips players with booster rigged vehicles that can be crashed into balls for incredible goals or epic saves across multiple highly detailed arenas. Using an advanced physics system to simulate realistic interactions Rocket League relies on mass and momentum to give players a complete sense of intuitive control in this unbelievable high octane re imagining of association football. Awesome features include All new Season Mode that allows players to enjoy a full single player experience Extensive Battle Car customizations with more than 10 billion possible combinations Unlockable items and vehicles stat tracking leaderboards and more Addictive 8 player online action with a variety of different team sizes and configurations Amazing 2 3 and 4 player splitscreen mode that can be played locally or taken online against other splitscreen players Broadcast quality replays that allow you to fast forward rewind or view the action from anywhere in the arena Competitive cross platform gameplay with PlayStation 4 usersNOTE Because of agreements with our online service provider there are certain regions that are unable to connect to Rocket League s online multiplayer component. As a result server access is restricted in China Crimea Cuba Iran North Korea Sudan and Syria. Apologies to our customers in those regions. SteamOS and Mac Beta Versions As of September 8 2016 the SteamOS and Mac versions of Rocket League were released to "Beta." SteamOS is the only "officially" supported Linux client though other Linux platforms may be compatible. Likewise the Mac version may or may not work on older systems with an integrated video solution and a dedicated GPU is highly recommended (Macs from 2013 or after should be okay). Mac system requirements are as follows OS MacOS X 10.8.5 Processor Intel Core i5 2.4 GHz Memory 8 GB RAM Graphics OpenGL 4.1 ATI Radeon HD 5670 NVIDIA GeForce GT 640M Intel HD Graphics 4000 or Iris Pro GraphicsBe sure and check ongoing patch notes for SteamOS and Mac beta updates going forward. Listed below are all known issues for both versions of the game as of September 8 2016 The correct store page for DLC purchased through the Showroom doesn t show up for Big Picture users. This is a Steam client specific issue that Valve will be fixing in an upcoming patch There are occasional crashes when exiting from a match to the main menu The statues in Urban Central do not display correctly You may experience intermittent blurring issues (Mac Only) Xbox 360 controllers won t work. You will need a third party driver solution to use themView the Rocket League Terms of Use at www.rocketleaguegame.com/tos
title: Rocket League®

title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is an exceptional implementation of physics in video games. It's an offshoot of the sport soccer where players control cars that kick a giant ball trying to score points by getting it into a goal. The premise sounds simple enough but the clever implementation of physics and a high skill ceiling to abuse them transforms an idea that may sound novel and slightly unweildy to an experience that is both exhilerating and addicting. GAMEPLAY &amp PHYSICS Momentum and angles are everything. You need the momentum to kick the big floaty bouncy ball across the pitch and into your opponents' goal but you have to hit it at the right angle to get it in. Considering this you're controlling a car so you can go fast but can't turn on a dime so the game gives you some unique tools to utilize. You can jump for one thing and pressing the jump button again without pressing a direction on your keypad/control stick makes you double jump but if you mash a direction when you press the jump button while in the air your car will flip and move in that direction giving you an important amount of air control. This is how players "kick" the ball and the feeling of rushing down the field jumping and flipping into the ball so it gets in the goal is nothing short of satisfying. Another important tool is the boost gauge which is the one finite resource you have. Boosting at max speed gives you a monstrous amount of momentum and provided you hit the ball at the right angle it's a shot that is very difficult for the opposing team to defend because the ball is moving so fast. Also if you collide with another player at max speed you can destroy their car in a glorious explosion giving you a precious few seconds of advantage while they respawn. Using boost is the highest risk as you lose control the faster you go and you need to conserve it to overtake opponents when they have control of the ball. It can be refilled by moving over glowing spots dotted on the field and it's important to strategize your movement across the field to cover those spots when you're running low. Combining these tools and learning to properly use them is the key to getting good at this game and their deceptively simple implementation gives it an easy to play hard to master aspect that is instantly approachable to all typse of players.PERFORMANCE &amp CONTROLLERS This game is absurdly well optimized and though my GPU is fairly old (AMD HD 7850) it ran at a smooth 60 FPS from the very first time I booted up the game. The only thing I needed to change in the options menu was to tick the Borderless Window option. It is HIGHLY RECOMMENDED you use a controller. It's a third person driving game and as far as precision goes a keyboard is sub optimal. There are no sever issues or connection issues that I've encountered it's as simple as clicking "play online" selecting a game mode and waiting for a few minutes. You can even customize your car and mess with options while in a party with friends. *cough*CS GO*cough*AESTHETICS &amp CUSTOMIZATION On this last topic I have to say what really makes me happy is that there are no tangible gameplay advantages you can get through unlockables. All of them are cosmetic so you can drive a stinkin' big van and it's just as effective as the sleek sports car your friend is using. You can also add decals different looking wheels change your paint job (sadly restricted to different hues of red/blue for the 2 teams) accessories for your car's antenna different particles that come out of your car's afterburner when you boost and even hats. You earn them after every round win or lose. There is DLC for cosmetics but no microtransactions. CONCLUSION As far as taking a real life sport and imbuing it with the kind of creativity you can only get from video games Rocket League is to Soccer what Mario Kart is to NASCAR. A competitive game as fun as it is whimsical. But what Rocket League has over Mario Kart and its ilk is that it levels the playing field for everybody where the only thing that can get you to the top is pure skill. I highly recommend it.

There are more relaxed modes for fun too. This is probably my favorite game of all time.

Yes definatelyIs it worth 30 . . . I would have just walked on by but after playing it Still Yes!!!This is one of those games you can have a quick 10 minutes on if you wish to get the feel good factor or get long term enjoyment out of it. It doesn't matter much but beware of the SALT.Overall this game is a solid 8.0 out of 10.0 right now. review: The game is simple but ridiculously addicting I can't tell you how many times I asked myself "How is this game so simple and fun at the same time" Its a soccer game with customizable cars you drive over boosts to go faster and attempt to hit the ball into the "Net" aka the Goal. I find this game to be more laid back and chill put on some music and party up with your friends. I would recommend this game to anyone if you like video games racing video games soccer games sport games or even just wanna try something new. This game is simple to play and can be mastered realtively quickly. I highly suggest purchasing the DLC with the customizable cars and different flags/decals that come with it if you are looking to play the game for a while and have new content!In short This game is fun and simple and is really easy to play once you get the controls down! You basically are just playing soccer with a car and a ball!

review: I freakin' love this game! It's not too difficult to get the hang of after a bit of playing. The basic training the game provides is useful for new players and the Season mode is a pretty cool experience. Online is smooth and really competitive.
title: Rocket League®

review: Probably the most fun I have had in a while. It's a simple premise that makes out to be great fun. It's just so crazy in concept that it is golden in practice. The tutorial section does very well to introduce all the tips and tricks for newcoming players to basically put them on the same base a regular player.I have to say the best part about this game is that it rewards you for playing the game by giving you more customizable parts ranging from cars decals wheels and oddly hats. It gives you all of that for simply playing instead of having to use microtransactions. The only complaint I have is that the decals are specific to each car so if you unlock a cool skull decal for one car it won't work for the other. But that is only a minor issue.The gameplay is awesome and a blast to play with friends. If you've seen the youtubers play this just imagine how fun it is when you are behind the wheel.

review: When Rocket League first came out I downloaded it for FREE on the Playstation store. Years later it's one of the most popular online competitive games out there. Play two on two or three vs three. You have a vehicle and you basically play soccer but with cars. It's a fun game with newly added game modes and a competitive mode which shows your rank and skills. You can customize your favorite car with new wheels paint job turbo colors and a lot more!!! Since Rocket League is so popular they have teamed up with multiple companies to deliver you some very cool cars like the three Batmobiles they have due to the partnership with DC Comics. Rocket League is an arcade style pick up and play fun game all around. Great online multiplayer game.

review: "Yo man check out this game!"... they said."lol silly football with cars"... I thought.So I eventually got the game and guess what it's one of the most surprising titles I've played for a long time. The graphics are very polished the game runs great. Matches are short and it takes you 20s from starting the game until being ingame. It's even possible to play without sound.The matchmaking lets you choose between standard and ranked matches for 1v1 2v2 3v3 etc. It's great together with friends. The crossplatform play works well and really helps the game's population.If your friends bug you to get this game you probably should. The game is actually easy to learn but hard to master (Kronovi anyone?).

review: The best multiplayer game to come out in years. The short 5 minute matches are intense fun and addictive. I can never play just one. There is also a very pleasing natural progression of skill for those who stick with it. Operating the vehicle becomes second nature. Moves that were hard at first become no brainers. Tricks that seemed impossible become doable and then become all the time occurances.It's also one of the ultimate online team games. 2v2 and 3v3 have globally ranked boards to climb with 1 or 2 friends. Team familiarity and communication become a must as rank rises and the competition gets stiffer but just as the skill naturally increases over time so too does the team work as everyone finds a way to mesh their own unique style of play together into a cohesive whole. And after all experiencing the joy of that last second buzzer beater to end a hard fought match is best with buddies to share it with.Do I recommend this game? Yes. Absolutely a must own. (I also recommend investing in a controller to play it but it's not required.)If you are at all intrigued watch some online pro teams play on youtube. It's great stuff.

review: Well... what can I say its football with cars!Rocket league is honestly a very fun gam even if your not big in to cars or football like me!There really isn't much to say on Rocket league as its a fairly simplistic game.There are two teams ranging from 1v1 matches 2v2 matches 3v3 matches and 4v4 matches.Each team tries to hit the ball into the oppositions goal as you would expect.However there are some extra game mechanics introduced with rocket league to mix up the games flow.I wont go into detail on them all however I will talk about some.Tricks Whilst playing you are taught to use a variety of tricks and stunts to help you get ahead of somebody or to hit the ball into the goal. There are many combos you can try out to see what tactic works best for you. You are taught these in the training coarse.Boosters Boosters are the name I've given to the little speed boost you achieve in game. Throughout the match you will achieve energy for extra speed that can be activated at any time. What this does is it basically acts like rocket boosters (hence the name of the game) that increase your speed while driving OR if you use it in the air you can begin flying for a very limited time allowing you to pull off some epic shots mid air!There are many other mechanics such as wall riding jumping (and double jumping) which you can see for yourself on youtube or in the game.Pros Incredible gameplay.Fast pacedHectic games (especially in 4v4)SPLITSCREEN so when your friends come over you can all play together and pull off some great shots! Supports up to for people.Extremely well optimized. (As you would think)Suprisingly decent graphics (when on max settings 1080p)Anybody new or expert can acheive incredible goals and saves. If your picking up this game for the first time its almost a guarantee that you will pull off tons of awesome shots during your time playing this.Car customizationCons Slightly pricey at $20 USD but I promise it is worth every penny.Matchmaking is a little rough at this point in time for most people for me personally its been very good with minor delays here and there.Final verdict 9/10The problems people have been experiencing with connections hasn't affected me to badly and the gameplay during the matches is just awesome (especially when with friends!)The seems to suffer from very little problems (aside from other peoples matchmaking experiences) and the gameplay is just plain ridiculous and fun to play with your friends.
title: Rocket League®

review: Where do I even begin with this. Rocket league is a fantastic game that runs well on most pcs. the game itself is very fun and addictive yet intuitive and simple. the game is frustrating at first because of janky controls but you do get used to them and they become amazing over time. the online support is amazing and it perfectly puts people into skill groups so you don't fight a mlg pro on your first time playing. The game is awesome to play with friends and is a great game over all but I do think that it could use some different maps and perhaps even some more gamemodes. Though i completely hate the sport soccer I do really like rocket leauge.8.5/10

review: Possibly one of my favorite games honestlyFor a casual player this game is perfect for the competitive not so much.Recently Psyonix has given more time and appreciation into making new crates and new customization options for your cars (to put them in crates and make more money) and have been paying less and less attention into fixing common issues rubber banding FPS drops on highly capable systems and general server lag with internet also capable of handling the game. It's always been a good game at it's core but as long as Psyonix stays on this path of caring less about their playerbase and more about the money it will succumb into the same path Valve was once brought down. Simply using people for their money saying they will fix these common problems and still no light has been shed on these same problems. Still terrible network lag still FPS drops rubber banding customization bugs at times random crashes servers dropping out at random times and new updates coming in late (albeit that may be subject to a Steam issue too.)Yes I will continue to play this game. But as far as this goes I'm not happy about their ways. I'd probably get a refund if I still could. Overall has a lot of issues. It acts like it's an early access game but then acts confident in other ways. I've always been passionate for the game but it seems some of these things will never change as it comes to the kinds of people that develop these competitive type games. Same thing happened to CS GO TF2 Payday 2 and Call of Duty (an obvious choice).Don't buy if you're looking for a competitive game to settle your debts. It sucks in that way.If you're looking to just have a bit of fun in unranked gameplay BUY! Now. It's great. Otherwise don't.
title: Rocket League®

review: best game
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League invents a new sport of its own using driving and ball physics. + The core mechanics are flawless. Controls are smooth and hitting the ball feels rewarding. And it's difficult requiring precise timing and spatial awareness. Beyond the robust foundation the game may not be for everyone. It relies on matchmaking which won't always give you a good time. And it's severely skill based so when the initial wonder of flying cars wears off you'll need to find motivation to practice and improve your skills to experience any new gameplay.9 / 10 DRIVING GAME.

review: Rocket League the relaunched version of the well known SARPBC game is the follow up and improved (imo) version of it's older brother. The game is simple you have multiple amounts (1v1 2v2 3v3 4v4) of players that battle eachother with rocketpowered toy cars and try to get the ball in the opponent's goal. Sounds pretty simple and that's Rocket League's strength.. AT FIRST.You start out with equal ranked players unless you have more experienced players in your party and you start the basics. Jumping Double Jumping Defending Trying to ACTUALLY hit that ball without looking like a 'noob' etc.The more matches you play the more experienced players you encounter (granted there's high level players who are at the game too) the more awesome goals you'll see happening.Hovering Learning how to play with your team.. That's the harder part.You can design your own cars with the unlockable stickers/decals/styles/hats/trails/.. and that's fine. You can choose how you look in this game but there's some actual restrictions (you'll find out).Do I recommend this game? Yes!Is it unplayable without controller? For me it is..Do you need to buy DLC for it? Not really it's all about your personal choice. Stadiums are free.Is it better on PC or PS4? For me it's the same since I play with a PS4 controller but typing goes faster on PC.. That's it.Hope you have fun with it the game is worth the money either way!
title: Rocket League®

review: After playing this for a while I have some mixed review here.First of all this game is really fun to play with or without friends. After allmost 500h of gameplay I still don't know how to do some amazing wall tricks or even play properly. On one side we have a good game fun to play. I can't tell much about graphics cuz I play on PC with low med settings. But nothing is gold ( as my current rank ) because community is going toxic. Report button is there just to send chat logs and it does nothing. In the last 4 5 months after one patch this game become a glitch fest for me and my friend. 70% of the games I lose are because ball slips over my car or it went through it. Opponent cars are sometimes faster than my car for no reason. Most of You will say it is about "skill" and I acknowledge that but when the game wants You to loose You will lose. This glitches bugs or whatever You shall call strange movements of a ball could be because of slow internet I accept that but when everybody ( not everybody cares ) can see that I doubt so. Maybe it is just my "luck".

review: A very satisfying game that's deeper than it looks.If you wanna pick it up just to play once every now and then it's well worth doing so but getting into competitive matches and forming actual teams with strategies reveals a whole other side to this game. The devs really care about their creation and that's pretty evident in how they are continually updating it. A game about car football doesn't take itself seriously thankfully so it's full of quirky things like crossover cosmetics and celebrations. Splitscreen in any modern game is such a nice thing to see also. Well worth the relatively low cost.

review: This is by far one of the most entertaining games I have ever played. Throwing my car into another one with boost active just creates a huge pleasure explosion when I see the words "Demolition" pop up at the top of my screen. Even though points aren't rewarded for that it's still fun as hell.Pros Fast paced exciting gameplay.Match making is really good.Servers have great connection.When I connect to New York servers I'm finally getting players from around that area and not from Asia or something.Easy to run doesn't need a powerful computer to get 60fps.GRAPHICS ARE FANTASTIC FOR A LOW PC REQUIREMENT GAME.Cons Although it is good sometimes matchmaking has trouble finding players of your skill level so you can be left with a rookie against two masters (this happens frequently).Boost drains like incredibly fast.Small amount of bugs. Ex. clipping out of the arena floating in the air for the rest of the game even after goals are scored.This game is very good for its price of only $20 personally I could see this game getting bumped up to $40 or even $60 when it becomes an eSports game. Hopefully that doesn't happen but in my eyes that's how much this game is worth.This game is a hell of a lot of fun to play with one buddy two buddies and even three buddies. Or you can leave them all behind and go play a 1v1 or you can get randomized but that's not really the point of this game. The point is to bring all of your friends together to form a big team as this is what makes the game fun.The game is a solid 8/10. It can definitely work on the bugs and the matchmaking but aside from those everything else is pretty much picture perfect.
title: Rocket League®

review: Warning do not play this game if you are still in school. It will consume your entire life both educational and social. My grades have all been cut in half and I haven't spoken to my family in days. My friends tried to stage an in game intervention but after I blew them up 7 times (extermination points SICKK) they ragequit like all of the other players I beat. On the plus side I have insane driving skills in real life now (I think).The best game I've played so far.Do you like driving games?Do you like team sports games?Do you like playing individual sports games?Do you like making people ragequit by blowing them up over and over again?If you answered yes to any of the above questions buy this game. If not buy it anyways.The game is surprisingly strategic easy to learn and a heck of a lot of fun to play online/with friends! Seriously download this game.

review: I've always found the greatest love in the smaller games. Super Hexagon is one of my favorite games of all time. Hand of Fate is my go to Dungeon Crawler. This game is the top of a list I didn't know I had. It has been a very VERY long time since a game has literally invoked knee jerk reactions from me.And this occurs nearly everytime I just go to hit the ball.Rocket League will invoke an andrenaline surge very few games will pull off. You will spasm shiver jump and make ridiculous noises numerous times per game.The game is simple you and up to 3 other people on your team compete against another team to put the ball in the other's net. You do so by reaching ludcious speeds well timed jumps and occassionally flying.The only unlocks are cosmetic and you get one unlock per completed match chosen randomly. There is no performance enhancement except skill.This game is fast and it will take a lot of time before you start figuring out the timing of jumps and when you should hang back as a goalie.My one and only complaint is that the game leaves much of the phsyics instruction for you to figure out. The tutorials and practices really just put balls in the air for you to it. It does nothing to teach you the finer points of actually hitting a moving ball in play.For $20 which is perhaps a tad steep given the content this game offers tons of replayabilty with a sense of focus excitement and the side effect of unintended exercise from when you finally hit the ball at breakneck speed while in the air flipping forward and rocket the ball across the field and into the net causing you to jump three feet up and slam your knees into the desk.
title: Rocket League®

review: Edit It's been about 18 hours now. I still love the game but the crashes are occuring more and more frequently it feels like. If it keeps at the current pace with crashes I think I may have to change my recommendation for this game. Hopefully within a week they fix these issues.Edit Also adding to the top of my review that this game has split screen local co op! That right there is an awesome feature to consider buying the game. So if you have 2 PC controllers you could play with your friends or significant other in the same room on the same desktop!While I love this game there are still some bugs. The ones I have seen in my first 4 hours are items not counting what they should (time goals etc) and I have had consistent crashes to desktop when loading the garage. The positive side is at least these bugs aren't directly impacting my games but it is an impact on the gaming experience.The awesome part about this game is that it has the competitive fun feeling I remember from playing Unreal Tournaments capture the flag but of course this is a different format. The unreal engine has to be one of my favorite engines for games like these. It is beautiful clear and it gets the job done. The hitboxes do need some fine tuning but overall it is a very polished experience during the game. I have had almost no issues with lag or dropped FPS (I am choosing to search for games on my part of the US). I am recommending this game and hopefully some friends decide to get it. If you do hit me up!Edit About 10 hours into the game now. I have had a couple games with lag but it isn't that many compared to how much I have played. A couple of things I would like is more customization options. Mainly I want to be able to have different flags and headgear for each team. For instance if I am red I wouldn't mind having the fire truck helmet but when I am blue I would maybe want something else. Also it would be nice if there was an option so that the flags and helmets follow the color scheme of your car and I don't think it should be mandatory but like I said an option. As far as multiplayer is concerned a lot of people rage quit early on but it is kind of funny because the AI that takes over for them actually does better. There was a game where it was 0 3 we were losing. My teamates rage quit and I stayed with my bot buddies and ended up winning 7 4. This could be a problem because I shouldn't have been able to win but I guess people are still getting used to the game so bots may be better than the average player for the first month or so. Also there should be a penalty for those who consistently rage quit. Other competitive online games have solutions for this and I think rocket league should look at other games to see what has worked better than what hasn't.
title: Rocket League®

Drive your rocket fueled car to victory using any manuevers you can only dream of in 5 minute rounds and if it comes to it overtime.the game is very rewarding as you win items and crates constantly just by playing. review: So you're thinking about buying Rocket League. You might be thinking that this game is just "that one weird game in your library" but you'll soon find yourself glued to your chair flying around feeling like a master in game. A little sooner you will find out that many before you have also accomplished this. You will train hard to master this craft of the air. But eventually realize that there is already a pro scene whom are way above you level. But in the end you have grown attached to the game. You will start to play competitive. You now have a good base knowlegde of the game or rather so you think but oh the game is tricky you find yourself in a pickle for you are now playing against players above your average and your teammate is useless. I can help you no more it is up to you now to carry the team and win the match!

review: Rocket League is a multiplayer game of angles and timing. The only difference here is that you use a car to hit a ball. Playing for a long time doesn't guarantee you becoming skilled but you'll have a solid base and hopefully don't repeat the same mistakes you made when you first started playing it. Most people will let you know about it using chat commands sarcastically or call you whatever swear words you can think of. I don't want people to be put off by this cos it's something you can expect from any multiplayer game but since the teams are smaller than in FPS games you get a bigger whiff of the hatred thrown in your direction and the guilt from making a mistake is higher cos most games are 2v2 or 3v3. Therefore your teammates also have a lower tolerance for mistakes so get used to losing a teammate when you mess up even with them risking a time penalty in competitive mode. 1v3 or 2v3 matches can build character or completely throw you off your game but that's all that Rocket League has ever been a game of skill not a cutesy football game with cars.Recently they added a custom training mode which was long overdue cos personally I lack the imagination to grow as a player so I need these new tutorials to get a sense of how all these tricks work and there's a lot of them. A few hundred hours ago I thought once I master aerials I will be set but consistently executing well timed aerials is the bare minimum of Rocket League and I can't even manage that most of the time. I swear I'm still making the same mistakes I made when I first started cos one thing I'm so used to using ball cam that I'm often missing shots on the ground and in the air as well. In a way I've painted myself to a corner and I'm stuck in a limbo of ascending and descending between Prospect I and II in Solo Standard. I've actually regressed in my playstyle and stopped taking risks which freezes your judgement and makes you prone to even more mistakes. No matter how much hatred or disappointment is expressed at your expense never forget that the real goal here is to have fun.All this depressing stuff aside Rocket League is incredibly fun otherwise I wouldn't still be playing it. You always want to get better at it. If it weren't for the incredibly responsive and accurate controls this would not have been the success that it is. Being focused enough to anticipate every move the trajectory of the ball and to perfectly time your shot is the entire game.
title: Rocket League®

review: This game has stolen my soul or at least my free time.Some recommendations for those starting out make sure to take some time playing the exhibition games against bots. Once you get the basic mechanics down take some time to slow down and plan your moves and shots more carefully. Chasing the ball everywhere is a sure fire way to lose a match.In the standard 3v3 match be aware of the roles that typically need to be played someone to center the ball someone to strike the goal and someone to stay back and defend. Ideally players rotate through these roles as the game ebbs and flows but sometimes it's better to stick back there in the goal and defend if no one else will.The subreddit is pretty active and a great place to get tips.Enjoy!

review: I can't put it down. This is probably one of the BEST games to play socially. It's also great for quick time killers or as a way to clear your head. I can only imagine what a Rocket League LAN must feel like.Are you competitive? Get this game and play ranked.Are you not? Get this game and play casual.There's no major story here other than following it on MLG. There are no plot holes no poor characters and no grinds (although if you want all the cosmetic items you will need to play quite a few games). No pay to win. This is pure sporting and social gaming gold.The craziest thing is that when I screw up or my team is trash I can't get mad. I don't go on tilt. It's just too freaking fun.10/10 would score on myself again.
title: Rocket League®

review: Product received for free. Rocket League introduced the next great game currently on the market. The game is simple it looks beautiful and can run on incapable hardware. PROS A fun "soccer like" (football like smh) game to play with cars Customizability is possible even without spending money on crates The game can be played on low end hardware Many different gamemodes to spice up game (Rocket Labs Hockey etc.)CONS Controls are easy to learn but hard to master (you aren't going to hit all your ariels without practice) Competitive rating system is decent but could use improvement (only minor) Minor connection/server issues (possibly fixed)Solid game and very satisfied with how this game turned out. I would recommend it to all. It's a fun game to play with games and has gametypes to play solo.I rate Rocket League 4.5/5

review: Lauded for its intuitive controls balanced play and pick up and play multiplayer in every which way (be it online or split screen lan) the simple concept of car soccer has never been so appealing. The developers are big now but a happy community has always been their #1 priority. A controller is recommended to prevent carpal tunnel. This is a phenomenal game to play at all ages and appeals to every genre. I've detested racing games or anything related to a sport but after enough peer pressure and I've already sunk a respectable amount of hours into it. It works as a pick up and play because of its short time spans in each game 5 minutes. You can play up to 4 cars a side and it now has hockey and basketball types. Worthwhile content is free but you pay extra for cosmetic cars and decals. Matchmaking is fast and the competitive rank up system is a nice touch to keep you interested in playing from time to time. A note for people starting out I'll add that this is one of those games that can be rewarding or horribly punishing when you first start. You'll feel like you're aimlessly chasing dipping dodging and diving around this ball. You could score on your net or hit a field long goal because you hit it a certain way. Don't be so hard on yourself and know that half of the game is predicting where the ball is going to be so you can hit it.When it's on sale or if a friend thinks you'd like it pick it up. You'll surprise yourself just like I did.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is one of the best games ever in my opinion. It combines 2 completely different concepts cars and soccer and fuses them together in a fiery explosion of goal scoring insane plays unbelievable freestyle aerials (which I can't say I can do... YET!) and just an amazing game all together. I love the whole entire system of customization which ranges from car bodies to rocket boosts to goal explosions. The soundtrack is top notch best of any game I've played. The recent addition of some insane pumping beats from Monstercat get me hyped for some soccar everytime I launch the game. There is many different gamemodes from classic Soccar to slippery Hockey dunking Hoops sophisticated Dropshot and powerup packed Rumble. There is also a competitive ranked season for more serious players which is satisfying when you win but can make you salty if your team isn't exactly on point hehe. It is also entertaining to watch the streams of the Rocket League Chsmpionship Series on Twitch an organized Esports event where the pros go head to head competing for a large prize pool of money. All in all Rocket League is a supremely fun game which I highly reccomend. I seriously hope that you reading this reveiw will invest 20 bucks for a game that will give you hours of clutch plays amazing overtime wins and addmittedly some rage along the way! (There's the ups and the downs eh?) I extremely reccomend!!!
title: Rocket League®

review: Wow this game exceeded my expectations. I was expecting a car game where you drive around and hit balls into goals. I got that but I also thought that it would be really boring and would be a game trend that fades away quickly. That's one reason I was hesitating to buy this. I waited until it was $13.99 on sale and I bought it. The graphics are AMAZING for an indie game the gameplay (even the singleplayer which I play a lot) is very smooth and fun to play. So far the community that I've met is very friendly and are never poor sports. I really like all the customization options you have and that you can have antennas that are video game and company based (VAULT BOY WOOT). As a child I used to play a lot of racing games like Project Gotham Racing for the 1st Xbox and I can just tell that if I were a kid (not a squid) I would love this game even more than I do now. (NOTE I recommend playing with a controller because it's much easier to play with. I use the Xbox One controller when I play. Oh and the keys are all able to be remapped.) This is the first review where I've actually written over 6 sentences. I rate this game 10/10.July 4th (2016) Edit Okay I'm coming back late July 4th to revise my review. I now have 54 hours and I have become addicted to this game again. I've learned the ways of double jumping and predicting people's actions and I'm now practicing aerials. I'm level 27 and I can say that this game is still very fun when you get competitive at it. Now I am not the best level 27 but it's still fun to play. Also playing this game with friends is very fun (WHEN THEY PLAY WITH YOU) and it can be very funny at times and very very salty. You may say things you don't mean too... (like I'M NEVER PLAYING COMPETITIVE WITH YOU AGAIN YOU SCORED TWICE ON OUR OWN GOAL!) It's all fun.I do really recommend this game but remember it's easy to start playing but very VERY hard to master.July 9 (2017) Edit I'm an expert (lvl 40) now and I have 206 hours. This game is good. That is all.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is an awesome game for messing around or for competitiveness with friends. The GoodsAddictive and astoundingly enjoyableController support (going to talk about this a little bit more later within the review)HATS!!! (TF2 lovers like myself will buy for the hats alone)Online and private matches/matchmakingCustomization is phenomenalGraphics are pretty awesome and doesn't take all that much to run.Even though I've only had this game less than three days I thoroughly enjoy practicing with my friends and joining in lobbies with random players as well! Customization is detailed and gives your car an original look. I have an outdated WIndows XP and I can run this at 60 100fps+ 95% of the timeThe BadsAI can be a little bit dysfunctional and qwerky even at higher leveled botsThe party function tends to not work. Even though it's not a particularly big part of the game it can be annoyingKeyboard layout and handling is very strangeI played a round of Unfair (1v2 and the bots are incredibly difficult) and would sometimes not even try to block a goal when they're near or at the goal. The party function doesn't break too often but I've seen it happen a couple times and it's purely annoying. Keyboards are almost not viable for play because the turning is very loose and frustrating. Other than that this game is a precious jewel.Overall I would rate this at 8.5/10 great game

It provides a great balance of fun and competition with a seemingly endless skill ceiling!

review: Extremely addictive game with some of the most pure skill based play you could imagine. This game is the type of game where you can easily pick up the basics and jump into some matches and have loads of fun. At the same time the skill ceiling is extremely high because of how precise the physics are. learning to truly control the ball and the car at the same time is quite difficult but extremely rewarding once mastered. Im not a car guy nor am i a sports guy but i do really enjoy playing well executed video games. Rocket league is a well executed video game with a rather bizzare concept that actually works really well.

title: Rocket League®

review: The most enjoyment I've had from a game in a very long time! This game is honestly perfect. It's cheap. It's highly enjoyable and the gameplay is great. The devs seems to have wanted to produce a game that s a throwback to the early days of gaming. Before hyper realistic graphics and storylines was anywhere. This game is just FUN. It s not moving it s not emotional it s not realistic (obviously) it s just a bloody good time that you can spend hours of time playing. Rocket League has both an easy and a steep learning curve. It takes all of 2 minutes so get the basics but actually becoming proficient learning the timings using the boost efficiently operating the two camera angles take time and there s a hell of a lot to be learnt. I also highly recommend this game to people who mostly play 1 game over and over (Dota CSGO BF4 Arma3 etc). It s a fantastic game to just play for an hour between scrims or to chill out over after a long sessions. It feels like a wonderful break from other games. In terms of how the guns runs? Perfection. Controller support is great. Options menu is great. Game runs superb and will do on even old systems (Phenoum X2 XFX5770 4GB). Overall this game is a steal at 15. For those thinking I ll just wait for a sale.. don t bother with that. You will not regret spending 15 for this game.
title: Rocket League®

review: What a game! It has been a while since I have played a game that puts me on the edge of my seat. This game gets my heart racing especially when the game runs into overtime. 10/10 would recommend to a friend.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket league is a car divegrass simulatorIt's pretty good overall. The gameplay is tight matches last about 5 10 minutes each.There are local split screen multiplayer modes which is a rare thing to see on PC so that's good.Cosmetic items in game (car types wheels hats rocket trails) are completely free and unlocked by playing the game. No microtransactions here.You can choose which server (or servers) to use to find online games. Oceana Europe NA west and NA east. The multiplayer menu is easy to navigate and game modes are easy to choose.The only real downside is that the game requires a controller to really play properly. But this is a great game and for 20 dollars it's hard to pass up.

review: I was pondering whether or not to give this a positive review as I came directly from three ranked games. More on that later.So the game is really fun to play with your friends and can prove to be a real thrill when the match goes really well. Sometimes you just feel that the ball don't go wherever you want it to go but that can be due to a large number of factors. Just fall back and have a go at it again or signal your teammates to try and cover up. So the game have great potential for a fun time. Although there are certain negative points worth mentioning.Firstly the positives + Great fun+ Great map architecture+ In game soundtrack which you can turn off should you want to (just lower the volume of it).+ A load of different cars each with their own unique appearance free to customize.+ Car customization you can choose the decals team based color "color" material wheels antenna boost trail and last but not least the "hat". + Easy to start.+ Hard to master.+ Cross compatibility with PS4 (no Xbox One that I know of as of yet).+/ Large skill gap that can be found within the same match. So for the negatives and here is the reason for the first sentence Hugely toxic community. Get used to report people and/or muting them and get used to be called an idiot or noob. This sucks but there is not much that can be done from our side more than reporting them. THIS IS NOT ONLY WITHIN YOUR TEAM THE ENEMIES WILL CALL YOU THAT AS WELL. There are of course moments when you get a nice match when no one will be toxic. The ranking system could use a rework as you can be matched against a player of much higher skill than what you are. Bottom line Yes you should buy this game and play with your friends. That way you get nice players on your team at least.
title: Rocket League®

review: Put several hundred hours in the PS3 predecessor. The gameplay is identical and I'm very happy about that. They've added league play (which you probably figured out by the name) a new training system and lots of customizable accessories that work similar to Strange items in TF2 tracking this or that stat. And it's very very pretty. The AI seems to be a bit smarter in some ways and a bit worse in others I'm seeing more odd hits around the goal that wouldn't happen in SSARPBC. E.g. the AI will occasionally hit it in the wrong direction entirely on offense and there seem to be a higher number of own goals. If you're looking to go back to the PS3 style ball cam it's in options "Hold Ball Camera" if you don't like the toggle system.

review: Rocket League is a multiplayer sports/driving game where you play 3v3 to try and score goals over 5 minutes of play. There are also options of 2v2 4v4 and other unconventional modes such as Hoops and asymmetric futbol maps.This game has a very high skill ceiling but is easily accessible to the pleb gamer like myself and a lot of nuance behind what is essentially a very simple premise score goals. When you screw up it's pretty obvious that it's your own fault and the game isn't unfair on that front. The music in menus are a very small part of the experience but is quite chill nonetheless.Psyonix also knows how to do good DLC. The entirety of it is purely aesthetic in nature and there are plenty of free updates so none of the playing content is locked behind a paywall. The packages are small morsel like bites of additional customisation for your car and as at 15/05/2016 I own 1 DLC currently.Speaking of customisation there are extensive options for paint jobs decals wheels antennae toppers boosts which helps keep the aesthetics of the game fresh.I am absolute at the game but it is fun in its own merit and would definitely recommend this game though it must be noted that the majority of my playtime has been with mates over Skype so YMMV.

review: When you create a physics engine and place a ball and remote control cars you get this such a simply yet entertaining game which actually promotes a competitive atmosphere. I have yet to get bored of this game and I feel like I've put so many hours already.
