Seriously a great game both casually and competively.
title: Rocket League®

review: This game has taken over my life the past few months. The developers are so in sync with their fanbase in terms of new content that it should remain fresh for a while. And it has in my opinion everything that defines the perfect game * Replayability it ages well and doesn't get old quickly* Multiplayer separation of competitive and casual modes and cross platform online* Simplicity Easy to learn difficult to master* Customization absurd level of combinations in both gameplay and vehicles* Content free updates and inexpensive (and non required) DLC nearly every month* Community between the developers' support and the community at /r/RocketLeague I don't think I've found many games that can compareIf you've never played I'd highly recommend it. Without a doubt one of the greatest games I've ever played

review: I have this game on my xbox and will get it on steam as soon as i can but this is one of the best games I've ever played. You start out as a noob who can barely control their car it is somewhat frustrating but scoring a goal is insanely fun. over a few weeks you may begin to get better at this game but have no idea how else you can get better. As you rank up you see people flying around and you look up on youtube how to do that. You begin practicing this now and you keep doing this with other skills. This is not a game where you can just be naturally good at it like cod or bf or madden etc... This game is basically a sport. You start out as one of the worst players ever but as you go on you gain experience and get better. Although this game does not look like soccer it plays much more like soccer than fifa or any other socceer games. YOU have to learn to control the ball. You cant just flick a stick to do a dribble move you have to put time and effort in practicing. This game does have one big big problem. The servers. Every other game it feels like I get this lag spike where I basically disconnect from the game for like 10 seconds then comeback this is not my wifi acting up I get 24 ping and in many other games have little to no connection issues. If not for this problem I truly believe that this game would have won game of the year especially considering it almost did even with these issues.
title: Rocket League®

title: Rocket League®

review: I find this to be a fast paced game with good music and nice visuals. The control you have over the vehicle is pretty impressive but it is definitely one of those games where it is quick to pick up but difficult to truly master. As always there is more diversity in player skill when played online but even the AI does a decent job for practice. Vehicle customization can be aggrevating as not all things you unlock are available on all cars right away but it is always nice when you unlock something you can use. I wouldn't be surprised to see more customizations added as the game progresses. Overall very entertaining and worth the $20!

review: "Playing Soccer with flying cars" doesn't do it justice. Rocket League is an astoundingly enjoyable game that you just have to play to understand. It seems like trying to hit the ball accurately with a car would be difficult and frustrating but the controls are intuitive and can be picked up quickly. Rocket League has that amazing quality of being "easy to learn but hard to master".From your first match you'll start to pick up on the controls quickly and before long you'll find yourself flying through the air to spike the ball down into the opponents net.Matches are only 5 minutes so it's fast paced with very little time commitment meaning even if you only have 10min to play you can still squeeze a quick game or two of Rocket League in.It's got split screen multiplayer so it's great for playing on a TV with friends/family and it still has enough strategic/mechanical depth to give even the most serious eSports competitor a challenge.The developer (Psyonix) is great the game has only been out a few months and already they're adding significant new content as free patches as well as adding new cosmetic content available via reasonably priced DLC.Rocket League is probably my favorite game currently I've already spent over 150 hours enjoying it and I can't wait for the next 150 and beyond.Update I'm now comfortably past 300 hours in and the game is still just as enjoyable as it was if not moreso. Psyonix has added it's first non standard map mutators and a custom hockey game type that are all very fun. There's a patch set to come out in the next couple weeks that includes several new non standard maps as well as changes to the way ranked works and many new items and more. The size of the playerbase seems to have increased so seems most people agree with me that the game has only been getting better from an already stellar start.Update 2 Now 1200 hours in. Psyonix has continued to release new and interesting content like Hoops Rumble etc. The base game is still just as stellar as it was if anything they've made it smoother which I didn't realize was even possible. They added a ton of new car customization options and new maps and have put substantial time/money into developing an esports scene which continues to grow the game. Rocket League has taken a place in my game library of one of the sparingly few games that I pretty much never get tired of. Rarely does a day go by where I don't play at least a few matches even if I'm just goofing around in unranked. I don't think I'll ever have a bad thing to say about the game it's truly spectacular. The only negative thing I could say is like any competitive game the community can be toxic at times so if you're easily tilted consider playing with chat disabled.
title: Rocket League®

review: Massive props to the devs on this. A fairly good idea fleshed out with really great little touches and a real deep understanding on what players of this game want. 4 player split screen co op in 2015 is virtually unheard of. Most devs expect PC gamers (well most gamers really) to be sad little 13 year olds welded to their chairs not wanting to interact with others except online.This game caters to real people. It does not restrict how you play this game. In any way. It could have been free to play and been ruined (hope to good god this never happens) it could have been restrictive as to who plays (i.e online 1 player per pc) and been ruined.It's a fairly good idea for a game but it's the little touches that make this one of the best games I've played for quite some time. And I'm not a massive football fan (can't really stand it although I am getting quite into womens leagues...).Definitely recommended to all as above all else it's bloody good fun to play. This is one game i'd do Esports for.
title: Rocket League®

review: As someone who enjoyed watching some big name youtubers play this the only thing preventing me from purchasing immediately from the joy they had was the fact that I'm not a big cars games sort of person. But regardless Rocket League is one of the best soccer/football video games I've played in a dang long time.The car element to rocket league is arguably one of the more sensible choices to the game that helps to make for a skillfull yet enjoyable element. Having a FPS or TPS based human or overseeing eyeball in the sky commanding no name soccer AI is boring to me. But the car based physics and fly bys of Rocket League mix together two arguably unrelatable sports genre's and turn them into a almost inseperable bunch. Players gain boosts based on a grid based placement of boost pads across the field with super boosts placed at tactical and predictable locations that make for competative twinge some folks will love. The satisfaction of taking a full boost and keeping it going by hitting boost pad upon boost pad and then JUST making the jump to hit the ball in is literally one of the greatest satisfactions.Matchmaking is satisfactory lag and ping are not a huge problem with few exceptions as per the usual with any game against human beings. Gameplay may get repetative only because you will feel the need to play it again and again simply because of how inherently fun it is. Cars come with customization but get this it's unlocked completely in gameplay. This is amazing considering I wouldn't have thought any less of this game for charging pennies on the dollar for silly hats or new paint jobs for my little RC buddy.All in all this was definately worth the $20 tag. Even if you just have one friend we were able to play a couple matches of 1v1 (Which I dominated Haha!) and then went to public teams so we could still have fun without it being unfair. I don't see why someone without friends can't enjoy it either!
title: Rocket League®

review: So from a te al standpoint Rocket League is a pretty decent game overall. The servers can be a little iffy at times and you may encounter some FPS drop on one of the arenas but it is a solid game. On the other hand the community is hit and miss. You will have some fun players who are chill and enjoy the game but you will also find a lot of players who are toxic and extremely serious. You will find plenty of griefers who will either self goal ram you or just flat out quit if you get scored on once. You will probably hear plenty of racial slurs and deal with lots of hate from players with small vocabularies as well if you make small mistakes even early on. The community is about as toxic as League of Legends and CSGO so that is a major downside. But you can simply disable chat and ignore them if you need to. So overall the game is pretty good but most of the playerbase is pretty bad.
title: Rocket League®

review: Although I have a fair number of games in my library I always gravitate towards one that keeps me sucked in for months if not years at a time. Since I downloaded Rocket League I can't remember the last time I wanted to play a game more than this one I have to force myself to even play Skyrim or Civ. It is unexpectedly satisfying to play a close game score an incredible goal or see myself (and hopefully my rank) improve over time. And as much as Psyonix is dogged for their matchmaking system they do a fantastic job in making the game fun for every level of play even bad plats like me. Why wouldn't you spend 20 dollars on this game? Talk about a (goal) steal.

review: Rocket league is a great game. I like the fact that you have to communicate with your team members in order to be successful. Though I do wish that new players coming into the game were ranked accordingly and not having to be matched against high ranked players. For example I am a challenger elite and one of my buddies is new to the game. I wish the matchmaking could be balanced to where our opponents would be evenly matched for example I challenge elite versus a challenger elite and let's say a prospect which is a prospect one of each skill level. On each team rather than facing the matchmaking of the higher skill in the server for example if I was a rising star and my buddy was a prospect then our opponents would be rising stars. It's sometimes frustrating for the newer players because they have yet experienced the game enough to where they would be able to have a fighting chance. And make them not want to play out of frustration.

review: Rocket League is the game that I go to whenever I am bored whenever I only have 10 minutes to play a game and whenever I just want to listen to music and chill out. The high paced action creates a game that is hard to put down and hard to stop picking back up. There are multitudes of aspects to the game even more than you would expect. You can battle competitively against other players trying to get the top rank you can set up unique gamemodes to play in private matches with your friends you can become an item collector and learn about the Rocket League economy and trade with other players in order to make your car the most luxurious vehicle out there or you can simply chill and play some simple laid back car soccer. However the online community can get pretty vulgar and unfriendly which is one of the few negatives of the game.With such a cheap price the game contains so much content and entertainment for anyone no matter what the age.

review: I like it. It's very good. The hum of the engines on the turf encapsulates the exciting football orientated theme of this sport game. There is a reason that this game has been on the top seller list for a month it is addicting. Every game is match based your existence while playing this game is to score as many goals in 5 minutes against the other team while simultaneously protecting your goal. There is a massive amount of skill involved but that should not deter new players as the mechanics are quite simple and easy to learn. I see this as a big e sports game in the future. Get ready to scream from excitement and then let the tears flow as you make amazing goals and accidently score on your own team.

review: You are doing yourself a disservice by not owning this game already. Excellent graphics runs like a dream on High even on my laptop's GT765M with no overheating and looks amazing.The gameplay is very easy to grasp but seriously difficult to execute well. Practice makes perfect!The game is clearly optimised for controller users. I tried to play with a keyboard but found it impossibly difficult. Using a controller feels very natural and allows for much finer control.No microtransactions no pay to win just good old fashioned fun. I have not had this much fun playing a multiplayer game since Dystopia came out as a HL2 mod when I was in High School.

review: Rocket League... this game right here is insanly fun! It requires lots of skill to get good at or you're a physics major and you play on PC. Although this game has a high skill ceiling it can be very fun even for the noobiest of noobs especially with friends. If you can get 3 or 4 friends who play this game alll together hop in a skype call or TeamSpeak you bound to have funnny moments and hilarious time ahead. If you're a competitive person there is a ranked mode with your name on it. This is the only major game that I know that I s cross platform with a console that being the PS4. wait .. WHAT?! Cross platform with PlayStation! What IS this madness?! THIS. IS. A really awesome ing game that has a bit of something for everyone I suggest you give it a try.

review: This game is so much fun to play wether your good or bad. The matchmaking is very quick no matter the type of game mode your playing. The whole aspect of flying just makes the game 1000 times better. Also there are many different ways you could play the game. There is training where you can practice your skills season where you can play against AI's hoops which is basketball and regular/ranked (1v1 2v2 3v3 4v4) multiplayer matches. This game is also compatible with a number of platforms. You should buy this game and all of the awesome things that come with it. Tip You'll have a better expierence playing with a controller appose to a keyboard.

review: Fun and has nice graphics. Although the gameplay is enjoyable it's not all what it's hyped up to be. Yea it's fun but you will always get matched up with people who doesn't know how to play even when you're a higher rank. I don't know why people say the community is toxic when literally NO ONE talks. It's rare to even see those text chat quotes. I guess it's fun if you have friends to play with but playing solo will make you frustrated. Don't jam the "W" key like I did I put so much force on that key because in this game you'll feel like you will have to jam the key to go full speed. My "W" key currently works but it gets stuck (Not Physically) and makes my character go foward even after I let go depending on how long I held it.

review: The first thing I've noticed was that the directional controls were reverse (A was right and D was left) so I changed the key bindings. Then I used my controller and the same thing happened. That is no real problem but what really annoys me is the stupid AI. When you are in a match and a teammate leaves he is replaced by a lobotomized AI partner who only produces own goals. But its even worse in single player where your whole team is a bunch of lobotomized AI partner and don't give me any of this "its supposed to be played in multiplayer" BS. If a game has no real singleplayer experience it's not worth twenty bucks. Only buy it when it is on sale.

review: Alright... I have played enough of this game to make a review that is true.So first off i would like to make a note So for those who dont know the history of this game and the devs here u go So back in 2008 Psyonix made a gun called "Supersonic Acrobatic Rocket Powered Batlle Cars" This game wasnt really well known but was a really great game in its age. So Years go by and the players of SSARPBC were shrinking but those who stayed were just getting better and better. Now many years later... Psyonix brings a new game... the "sequel" of SSARPBC which is really the remake. Using todays tech to make a new one Now it is known as Rocket League. And it is now actully known and one of the best games on steam.So review time!Graphics The Graphics in this game are actully really good if ur computer can handle it of course.Audio This game has great music and the audio is just as fine.PlayTime This game can be played forever its match after match like tf2 or csgo PGameplay This game is way different then most games today and its what makes it so greatControls The Controls are fine tho u should use a controller if u canSideNote!!!!I LOVE THIS GAME

review: At first I thought soccer with cars was stupid. Now I think it's great fun. As someone who has predominantly played Counter Strike and other FPS titles in the past Rocket League is a breath of fresh air. Games are short and exciting which is great for people who don't have the time to dedicate 60+ minutes for one match of another game. There's plenty of skill based mechanics to improve upon and the matchmaking system seems to do a decent enough job at matching you with people roughly around your own skill level.

review: Rocket League is simple in concept control and gameplay. Despite this it is one of the most engaging games I have ever played. While the game may be simple the skill cap on what you can do is insane. When you first start you will fumble around and miss shots left and right but every once in a while you get that perfect play. That perfect play sticks in your head and taunts you. "You can do so much better". And you always can.The game runs like a charm and could probably be managed on low end computers to run smoothly. It has cross platform multiplayer with the ps4 where it is free so the population is large enough to not be an issue for now.I can't think of a single negative of this game if you like a simple but engaging game you can dip a lot of time into as you get better and better.Plus who knows maybe it will go full eSports and become a popular competitive spectator sport. Better get gud now.
title: Rocket League®

review: This game is awesome it was much more fun than i expected and i have spent countless amount of time in this game. It has split screen which was one of the main reasons for me to buy this game. The team is slowly improving the game in every aspect. I used to have lag issues but they heard my voice and despite being not a lot of change in my ping they fixed it to make it competitively playable. The game even has a split screen online mode so you and your friend can team up with perfect sync. The graphics are also awesome and its hard to believe this is made by unreal engine 3.However one of the things i dont like about the game is that although they dont give an advantage over gameplay the standard cars look very bad compared to the DLCs and the ones awarded in crates.Overall i love the game definitely recommend buying it
title: Rocket League®

review: Best game I've played in a while Very simple Very addictive Easy to play but Hard to master. The Devs are doing a great job with this game new things are getting added overtime and the way they dish out DLC is a great essentially half paid half free. One edition I would like to see would be custom leagues for friends etc so we have the option to arrange tournaments etc.I only have one bad point and this would probably not bother most players but the single player game is terrible The computer AI is absolutely shocking. I played the single player game just to earn the achievements and it's basically you against the five AI/Bots! Yes that's right your own team mates WILL run the ball into your own goal from the half way line given the chance.To sum it up buy this game for multiplayer not for single player.8.5/10

review: This is my first game review and might be my last but its a really fun game. Its a very interesting take on a soccer game and it does it very well.Pros Great gameplay 'Simple but hard to master' kind of mechanics You can enact your soccer fantasies using an RC car like controls. (A point worth mentioning alone)Cons The match making can be a bit iffy. (I assume there is a skill level calculation of players because everytime we win a match my team gets matched with some effin pros who really know how to bend it like Beckham.) Expect a learning curve. Requires Teamwork. (Plebs consider this a con what to do) Server problems. (those of you in SEA expect 100 ish ping)For extra motivation check out Fyshokid on Youtube 10/10 he will hat trick the this game into the goal which is your brain.https //www.youtube.com/user/Fyshokid EDIT Corrected &amp added in some stuff.

Offline Seasons mode with bots when your wifi is too slow/not working A huge community from newbies to all star champions Servers will find players near your skill for fair gameplay Stunning graphics Graphics can be lowered for gamers with low specs Mutators in exhibition and private online matches (Unlimited boost gigantic ball cube ball low gravity and many more) DLCs just feature new cars not giving any unfair advantages to players. So it doesn't make Rocket League a "pay to win" game Cross platform multiplayer (Wait did I already say that? Oh sorry just that there are too much positive things that I lost track) Definitely not a waste of time( ) You're reading this review instead of playing it Not on Mac/Linux as of the time I'm writing this review but I'm sure that they will add support for all platforms soon

review: Rocket League. Hmmm what's the best way to describe you. Fun yet infuriating. Fast yet slow. It's more of a sport than it is a video game. If you want to succeed and go far you need a good team and good communication skills. 3v3 and 2v2 are the main game modes for this game but I'm not here to focus on that. Let's talk about the weird game modes. Rumble. It's 3v3 with random powers that you can use to score goals with or mess up the other team. There are a lot more tactics and angle shots involved so it doesn't always go your way even when you have the right powers. Go ahead and give it a shot if you've never played it. It's really fun Dropshot. A better basket ball like game compared to hoops also combined with volleyball. The objective of the game is the break the floor open like your shooting at it and it'll open up revealing the goal. The more damage you do to the opposing teams floor the bigger the goal just remember that when you score a goal the floor will clear up next round. It's a very team based game. Gotta be passing to each other to charge the ball so it'll do more damage the the floor. Lots of aerials and wall shots to have an advantage at this game mode. Snow Day well. You're interesting. You have to change up your tactics in this 3v3 ice hockey type game mode. The puck acts different to a ball and you gotta block more shots by just being infront of the puck. A lot of redirections and wall runs to actively do well and score in this interesting game mode. Hoops. That's about all I have to say about that game mode. Not a fan of it. It's like basketball but in a bad way.This is the first review I've done in a while. Any pointers would be helpful )
title: Rocket League®

review: After spending a decent amount of time in game both on PC and PS4 I gotta say it's one of the best game I've ever played. If you like playing multiplayer games of mixed genre which can easily immerse you even if you don't play them multiple hours a day. Even if you don't exactly love this type of games. Well even if you don't like soccer nor racing games at all. The heck I'm talking about this game is for EVERYONE! Age or taste doesn't matter you should give it a shot at least. You can lay back and play casual games try out various modes even better if you got friend(s) to play with.You can teach it your daughter/son/brother/sister/father/neighbor WHOEVER and play against bots on splitscreen on Sunday afternoons.Or you can try to become one of the elite Rocket League players and work your way up to Champion tier whilst playing 7 hours a day and lose your job or skip school.The game's visuals mechanics controls physics basically everything is 10/10.Dev team is one of the best I've ever came across.And look at the price tag. There's plenty of games here that are 3 times the price and deliver less than Rocket League or don't deliver at all.

review: This game is one of the games that must be in your library if you own steam. It's that Perfect! I have never had a problem with this game nor have I ever found a glitch/bug. This game is amazingly polished and has loads of content. This game gets updated regularly with new content adding more hours of gameplay. There is also a competitive mode one of the best ranking systems and loads more of potential hours of playtime.This game isn't about having the best car it's about who has the best skill. To be skilled at the game you must practice ALOT. This is the racing sports game of CS GO.A rocket league DLC consists of new cars skins and decals. They are launched with every new map update. Best of all these maps are 100% free and are available to everyone. The DLC content is just for style and customization it doesn't make you any better. It makes you look better.In conclusin buy it.....

review: Warning Before buying this game be aware you will spend your money on it.This game is great.I started out not really having fun and it reminded me of when I did real sports.People wouldn't explain them to me so the team would always hate me and not let me do anything.But it gets more fun as you get better. After the basic tutorial &amp a friend helping me practice I immediately loved this game.It's really fun there's an abundance of modes and here's where you'll spend your money There's so many DLC vehicles and cases. But the vehicles dont have to be purchased nor do the skins or cosmetics. There's random item drops which seem so far to get a little more sparse but more rare as you level up. But let's talk about the vehicles. They aren't $200 and they are not purely cosmetic. (*cough* tf2 *cough*) They actually go at different speeds have different turning radiuses grip and weights.I mean the online community isn't super terrible but teamwork could definitely be easier here considering it's a team game.This is worth the $20.

review: The good outweighs the bad it's just the bad has more detail. READ ON! BAD POINTS The matching server needs improvement. How the hell a rookie is expected to beat a veteran 1v1 is beyond me.. also how people are expected to play with 300+ ping is also beyond me.This is a 20 game+DLC that's more than happy to pit you against people you've no chance of beating and then ripping your ranks away from you.to make it playable make the matching a little more even and get the client to test the server (ping it) before joining so people don't have to play with the magical red "DISCONNECTED!" logo. all it takes is for the game to start matchmaking again if the server selected is unusable!Remember this is a high speed low drag game ping of more than 100 is undesired because you start seeing things like the ball and players glitching around. I have quite a few times been in a situation where I scored a really nice goal but it didn't count because I was lagged. I watched the ball go into the back of the net and then their team get a goal because what happend on the server is the ball was saved from me then planted in my goal. Nice going They score the goal I should have had. GOOD POINTS complaining asside it's a pretty simple game. Football in cars up to 4 a side (unless you're going for the ranked matches then it's up to 3 a side). There is no "off side" nor penalty for blowing up the enemy.. however you are rewarded with an explosion and the inability to see for a second or so.the cars have rockets attached for getting around at rapid pace killing the enemy and flying. Trust me I can't get the hang of that bit. I like my Delorean and to keep my wheels near the ground.Each public match is 5 minutes (add time for goal replays). Overtime is applicable if the scores are even at the end of the game. It truely is a thrash and go while you wait game.. and while the matching server does get it wrong sometimes it doesn't get it wrong all the time.The graphics are something else. Really really pretty though it is easy to disorient yourself.. so watch out!

review: Do you like to play fun games?..Well I sure hope so that is the reason you are here after all. This is not a "fun" game in that sense it is an addictingly exhilarating game. The physics collision controls style and overall gameplay are bar none. The game has a polish to it that many games do not have nowadays. Even when it originally released the only major problems were that the servers were slightly malfunctioning. Because of the relatively short matches (5 minutes) the games are in a sense bite sized. Not too much not too little. It's not like a game of battlefield or COD where after 20 40 minutes a game is resolved leaving many gamers bored or tired. The short 5 minutes matches are packed with action and intensity. ONe thing I love about it is the something not mentioned in reviews I've read previosuly. The ability to comeback in any game regardless of the score is immense. Down 3 4 or even 5 goals? Doesn't matter step your game up and win. The game mechanics allow so much skill to be expressed that comebacks are nearly always possible. There is real quantifiable skill that is to be gained by getting good at this game. I'd say more but that would take all night to write it.Pros CheapGreat learning curveLots of fun with friendsLots of fun with yourselfCons Not freeRating 10/10Would buy again.Highly Highly recommend it.
title: Rocket League®

review: Buy this game.It's easy to play but it has TONS of room to perfect your playing and pull off some truly amazing stuff.As should be obvious by now it's soccer with rocket powered RC cars. Your cars have the ability to pull off jumps flips barrel rolls boost speed using rocket power and even fly. Flying effectively is the most difficult skill to master. However with practice it's possible to pull off something like driving up a wall flipping off and rocket flying into the ball scoring a goal.The AI opponents are terrible and the only reason to play offline games is to practice your skills so you can pull your weight in online matches with real players. The game also features training that focuses on various skills the game requires such as scoring goals and playing goalie. Each training has 3 different difficulty levels and they do effectively prepare you to take those skills onto the field if you spend time with them.To elaborate on the AI...I've played offline and seen one of my team mates literally drive the ball ALL THE WAY accross the field and shoot the ball into our own goal. This happens a lot. Honestly it's frustrating to play offline because it sometimes feels like the AI is programmed to just hit the ball as much as possible regardless of the concequences of the hit. You can be lined up for a perfect goal you close in and prepare to take your shot...and a ing AI team mate comes out of nowhere and hits the ball way the out into the middle of nowhere ruining a sure goal. AI playing goalie is a toss up. They'll either pull off the most t saves ever or just stand immobile in the goal and let the ball go in. Long story short the AI is the weakest part of this entire game.Customization is pretty nice though there aren't a whole lot of options for players who don't want to make their car look like a joke especially in the "hat" department. All customization is only for appearance and has little or no effect on your gameplay. The only choice that effects your game is which car you choose as each one has a different hit box and different angles to it. It is essential to take the shape of your car into account when lining up a shot especially at an angle.There aren't many problems with the online mode. There needs to be more of a match making system especially in un ranked modes. You could end up with a team mate who is pro caliber or you could get a day 1 noob who can't tell which goal he's supposed to shoot at (hint the one who's color is opposite your own dumbass). Before you play online I STRONGLY recommend playing offline seasons and doing training until you reach the point where you won't be a burden to whichever team you end up on. You'd be amazed how far ahead you'll be compared to the average player if you take this advice.I give it a 9/10Not the kind of game most people will be able to play for hours on end but you'll definitely get your money's worth if this concept interests you and you're willing to put in a little time getting good.
title: Rocket League®

review: I rarely play sports or racing games but Rocket League is an excellent easy to learn &amp difficult to master arcade racing football (soccer) game! Post release updates and social media interaction show that the devs care about the players and eSports through by adding new content in the base game as well as DLC. Since there's plenty of praise for RL let me go some of the game's caveats "Cross platform gameplay" does NOT mean that you can join players in a party/private match that are on a different platform. It just means when you queue up for general online play you can get matched up with other PC and PS4 players. 1.05 update notes say "There are no immediate plans to let you join players in a party on another platform". Fields/levels are all functionally the same right now. Aside from plans for game Mutators I am not aware of plans to make certain fields have different terrain/features. A game controller gives higher turning precision control than a keyboard &amp mouse. Camera rotation cannot be controlled by mouse movement. Only two in game camera selections Fixed or Ball Cam. There's a dozen config camera related options in the pause menu though. May offer "enough" for handling griefers &amp leavers. 15 minute online ban for leaving a match has had a mixed reception by the community and right now there is no in game report system but that's coming. Rank Point system for competitive play can be confusing for points won/lost after a match especially in higher ranks. AI available when playing offline can be dumb sometimes and score on own goal when it rushes back to defend.
title: Rocket League®

review: HOLY F*** I HATE SPORTS BUT I LOVE THIS GAMEI can't explain why but my love of cars simulators and need for high octane arcade thrills somehow conjure up a massive love for this title. In the first week I played 25 hours and couldn't get enough. YOU PLAY SOCCER/FOOTBALL WITH CARS THAT FLY. It's literally the greatest. The controls are easy and the pace is perfect. Play 5 minutes or play 5 hours the flexibility is on you. Get bored playing by yourself? Ask your dorm neighbor to come over with his Xbox controller to get whooped. Get competitive with people who usually don't even like video games. It's super accessible as a first game to people who've never played on a PC before. If it gets too cumbersome for them you can modify the gameplay with the newest update. This game is absolutely perfect for a college dorm setup because the learning curve accompanies all. It will never stop being challenging and will never become too difficult to insure someone ragequits.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League ReviewFirst of all sorry for my bad English.Rocket League is a vehicular soccer video game developed and published by Psyonix. Soccer with rocket cars Rocket League has one to four players assigned to each of the two teams to push a ball into their opponent's goal and score points over the course of a match. The game includes cross play between another platforms.GAMEPLAY (10/10)I dont know what I must say except "Fun!" You just drive your rocket car and shoot the ball. Maybe this game can relieves your stress.GRAPHIC (9/10)This game has pretty graphic with low specs requirement.MULTIPLAYER (9/10)Has competitive mode to increase your skill with another players who have similar skills like DOTA2 has MMR.PRICE WORTH (10/10)You would never regret after purchased this game even you dont have any friend who play this.CONCLUSIONSugestion if you want play this game disable chat mute everyone because they all just bothering you. Easy to play hard to master. Gamepad or controller recommended. Highly recommended!

review: After putting 262 hours into this game. I am finally ready to write a reviewThis game is absolutely HORRIBLE. Heres reasons why 1. No campaign. I wanted an epic story about the cars and maybe theres a villain who drives the Roadhog because that car looks like a rocket league mafia. But nope theres no campaign and no storyline how am I supposed to figure out how Dracos were made if theres no storyline?2. DLC Cost too much. 2 dollars for a car? No rockets why is it called ROCKET league. I wanna shoot rockets at people. In conclusion this is the worst game I have ever played in my life.

review: I loved Supersonic Acrobatic Rocket Powered Battle Cars. It felt like a simple yet fun game to play with friends. I was worried that rocket league would completely butcher on of my top favorite family games by changing the gameplay aspects completely. Fortunately the game designers are able to see amazing game aspects and did not change them too much. Rocket league takes Supersonic Acrobatic Rocket Powered Battle Cars and adds aspects that we can respect. Cars were added Customization is at its highest point and the maps are incredibly designed. If you have a chance to pick this game up make a smart decision and do!

review: Soccer meets driving once again in the long awaited physics based sequel to the beloved arena classic Supersonic Acrobatic Rocket Powered Battle Cars! A futuristic Sports Action game Rocket League equips players with booster rigged vehicles that can be crashed into balls for incredible goals or epic saves across multiple highly detailed arenas. Using an advanced physics system to simulate realistic interactions Rocket League relies on mass and momentum to give players a complete sense of intuitive control in this unbelievable high octane re imagining of association football. Awesome features include All new Season Mode that allows players to enjoy a full single player experience Extensive Battle Car customizations with more than 10 billion possible combinations Unlockable items and vehicles stat tracking leaderboards and more Addictive 8 player online action with a variety of different team sizes and configurations Amazing 2 3 and 4 player splitscreen mode that can be played locally or taken online against other splitscreen players Broadcast quality replays that allow you to fast forward rewind or view the action from anywhere in the arena Competitive cross platform gameplay with PlayStation 4 users
title: Rocket League®

This game is a thousand times better this way.

review: So at first I wanted to do a silly/stupid review but this game for realz has no need to. You will have plenty of silly/stupid moments within that I don't have to even state it.I bought Rocket League because it seemed to be what everyone else was doing type of thing but seriously there is a reason. I've played all match types and even the single player and seriously have not had a dull moment. It's repetitive yes. But the fun in it comes from pulling off sweet moves you would expect from pro players in your FIRST MATCH. Yeah. it's one pof those games Easy to pick up but mastery comes within numerous hours. And even in those first 1 2 ...100 hours (You will probably play it that long trust me.) There is never a dull moment and even when you find a dull moment? It will have you coming back for more... Just in' buy it already. All your friends have it and for good reason. Do it like Nike.

review: I have more fun playing this game then any other game that I own on PC or console right now. I have a PS4 so I obviously got it on there for free so I played it for like 50 hours on there first. This game is amazing to play with friends or by yourself. My friends on PS4 are fun to play with but they are not very good at the game. I started to play by myself and actually had a lot of fun playing with better players. I figured I would get on my gaming PC so I can play without them knowing I am online playing! I have not regreted my decision. This game looks and plays fundamentally the same on PC as it does on PS4. However I do not know if it is in my head or not but I do think that the game plays substantially smoother on the PC. I know a lot of people were complaining about the servers to start out with however my experience has been very good on both the PC and PS4. There are some instances where you ping will be randomly high for no reason but it will fix itself by the next game most of the time. I would recommend this game to anyone regardless of the type of game you like to play. It is well worth the 20 dollars on PC. I know I will play the heck out of this game for months and maybe even years. I see this game becoming CS GO popular if it isn't already.
title: Rocket League®

review: I love this game
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket LeagueHonestly I never knew such a simple concept could be so much fun. The very addictive gameplay could have you playing this for hours on end easily. You will lose track of time. The game is very simple and easy to learn but hard to master. With a full training mode you're able to work on advanced techniques and learning to control your car and the ball. The game may be easy to learn but depending on how much time you spend on learning new tricks with your car and learn how to control the ball better from other players you will see yourself rise above the average player.Playing this with friends is a blast. With up to 4v4 online PVP you and up to 3 friends can all battle it out against others. Teamwork is a must in this game.Cameras. The camerawork in this game is phenominal. Although you will mostly keep it on the ball cam (no homo) the game offers two variations of cameras. The ball cam which follows the ball everywhere it goes is smooth and nice to look at the camera was crucial to this game and they nailed it.FINAL SCORE 10/10 (No really this game is a full 10 out of 10. It's a must own. Why do you not have this game yet?) TL DR Buy the game
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is just flat out fun and chances are you've never played anything quite like it. The premise is obvious Control a souped up RC car to try and knock the ball into the opposing teams goal. This is simple on paper but proves to be much more of a challenge in practice. Of course you get the hang of things and getting the ball moving in the right direction becomes easier as you play. The customization is pretty robust even if there is a significant lack of free car bodies. You might even get a flashback or two from the first few need for speed games with all the cosmetics you'll be playing with.I would absolutely recommend Rocket League to just about anyone. Even in a match where you lose you'll probably be having fun anyway so long as you don't take it too seriously. Both teams falling over backwards in a corner trying to get the ball towards or away from the goal is simultaneously the most frustrating and the funniest pile up you will ever be a part of. I don't know about you but the hilarious novelty of trying to play soccer with a car will never grow old.

review: This game has been my life ever since it was released. I bought it initially on PS4 and proceeded to buy it again for PC. Love the game in it's entirety. No pay to win features friendly(ish) community and a constant craving to get better and get that 'Champion' title on ranked. You'll start off uncordinated and slow and eventually suprise the hell out of yourself when you're flying through the air hitting the trickiest shots at ridiculous angles. The only thing I would like to see is a profanity filter for the feint of heart instead of banning anyone who types a curse word that is a little overboard.
title: Rocket League®

review: Back in 2016 I believe my group of friends was searching for a game we all could play together. Since none of us were Steam users back then you can understand that games like NFS and such which have integrated online party systems were not our best fit. As the time of couch co op was coming to a close one of us stumbled upon a funny little game Rocket League."Dude you won't believe but you play football(soccer) with your cars you boost and all and most of all it has four way splitscreen gaming" and that was it. We hooked up the game to our LCD and started playing only to fail effortlessly in performing even the simplest of tasks. We bumped into each other instead of actually hitting the ball kept boosting and flicking in hopes of getting something done while one of our friends actually got so irritated that he went back home. Rest of us kept on mashing buttons and so on only to eventually understand how sensitive are movements should be. "GOAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAL" finally the sound of victory.We were told that if you're not playing online you're not really playing the game since players FLY in the air while playing matches and it was something alien to us. I went back to the game and starting boosting my car in random angles after a single jump and man I started flying all across the map.This damn game it awakened a whole new friendship within my friends circle and we'd all play the game together for hours understanding management practicing on our accuracy and so forth. Eventually we bought this game on Steam and man it was one of the best decisions I've ever made in my gaming world.I will quote Thanos for a bold and simple explanation of this game as an emotional journey."In time you will know what it is like to lose. To feel so desperately that you're right. Yet to fail all the same. Dread it. Run from it. Destiny still arrives."You will fall and keep falling until you hit the spot in this game. It is an excruciating journey and I would recommend you to try it out.Psyonix does a great job with the constant updates the community is really generous and matchmaking is also decent.Hit me up if you do buy the game I'll get you started on the basics or well I can be your first rocketeer friend.Rock on!
title: Rocket League®

review: Like many of the best games the concept is simple and mastering it takes trememdous time and effort. My only complaint with Rocket League is that all you get is a bouncy car soccer game. There are no other modes. The game play is extremely straight forward. I feel this would be more appropriate as a mini game in GTA than a standalone game for 20 dollars. It's great and I certainly enjoy it. I just wish there was more to enjoy. Things I'd love to see implemented shoot outs ranked team play larger arenas and larger player limits pentalties / penalty kicks car damage alternative game modes

review: + really awesome gameplay addictive game gameplay wise 10/10. For the record I never played any game more than a month or two every time I just got bored eventually and had to lay the game off. This game? Bought it about a year or year and a half ago and did not have any hiatus longer than a day or two. + teaches you self control. After a time you understand you have to take a break after few lost games in a row. This game is about 70% about psyche its about how concentrated and how chill you are. The second you become frustrated and you lose concentration you lose the game. enormously stupid community of people. Seriously you have never met bigger number of a holes until you played rocket league. Community 2/10 meaning you meet about two fine people out of 10. The rest is not just mean. They are the biggest bunch of 12 y.o. spoiled brats laughing in your face constantly. aquadome map (needlessly detailed brings fps down)overall 9/10 because you can turn off the chat. If you are a nice person buy it. If you have high self esteem and if you are arogant go grow up an then when you behave properly buy the game and enjoy.

review: good game but has serious issues. matchmaking is terribly unbalanced. 90% of the matches are stomps which makes players quit. because players quit all the time they get replaced with ai who actively shoot goals for the other team making the games even more one sided. the experience rankings show player skill pretty accurately. players have the option to hide it though which adds nothing while taking away from seeing if you are in a fair match or not. the camera is not bad but when the ball goes up in the air nothing is visible on the field. when the ball is in the air the camera should hold the ball at the top of the screen not the center. around the edges of the field your camera will constantly be in areas that completely cover the screen. you literally have to guess what is going on when this happens. charging for keys to open up crates isnt terrible but it is when you get an item (which usually isnt a crate) once every few hours. take into account that you can get items in crates for cars you do not own you can get duplicates of items in crates(which not everyone trades so this sucks) and crate items can only be combined with other items from the same crate to turn them into something else. overall rocket league is a good game but i cannot recommend it with the huge focus on dlc maps no one likes and competitive rocket league that no one watches instead of problems that have been in the game since the start.NEWEST UPDATE matchmaking has gotten significantly worse. ive played against multiple grand champions (im a veteran so im not a tenth as good as them). the teams are always stacked super heavy. it will be like master master expert vs veteran (me) semi pro pro. people try to talk about mmr and stuff it really doesnt matter. the experience rankings dictate who wins the game 95% of the time so can we just have matchmaking based on that? Just got out of a match where I was teamed up with two rookies against a team of master players. They made fun of the rookies on my team. This is the garbage that having such a cancerous matchmaking system creates.

review: Драути и сегодня я расскажу как я апал 1 челенджер. Короче поднял я недавно проспект илитку и забросил рл на неделю. Возвращаюсь начинаю трениться в соло. Играю я такой играю. Иду в соло рейтинг и против меня выпадает челик со 2 челенджером и я (я был пропест илиткой). Еле еле я выйграл эту катку и меня апнули было 10 потных игр и я поднялся до 5 дивизиона я тогда был ец какой потный. На 5 дивизионе я ещё выйграл 7 игр и меня не повысили и началась полоса неудачи. Мне кидало пездец какиж жёстких игроков. Кто то фристайлил ец как дриблил и меня понизили до 2 дивизиона. Я выкарабкался из помойки опять дошел до 5 дивизиона сыграл игр 35 (быо вин поражение) и в самой последней игре мне попался 3 челенджер. Сказать что я ничего не сказать. Было ец как потно игра длилась 15 минут (10 минут доп.времени) после этой игры я апнул своего 1 челенджера и ец как сгорел. Короче где то 50 игр 2.5 часа ец как до нервов. Игра топич кто бы чего не говорил.

review: Ok so before getting this I was like.. cars and football whatever. But this is literally one of the most fun games ever! (Remember that? Fun?) Some of the best games always seem to be the ones with an incredibly simple premise but end up having some of the most in depth gameplay here you drive a car around and try and hit a ball in a goal. But whenever I think I'm going well I play with some people who have developed some new weird and wonderful techniques. Games also just works without issue no lag great matching of skill large community. Only improvement needed is party forming across platforms.

review: One of the dumbest ideas ever You're a car playing football.It is however a really fun and addicting game. While it initially may look like everything happens based on luck when you take time to actually learn the game and it's tricks you'll be surprised how much knowledge and skill is involved on many of the plays.It is compatible with a controller and has a nice tutorial for the newcomers. The cars have an easy handling and you can make some flashy plays even at low level.So far the community is pretty nice and you can communicate with the players via chat in game voice communication or with a dozen of fast accessible pre created phrases. Also the game has dedicated servers and it's really easy and fast to find and join a game as (for now) there are tons of people to play with.I actually think they should have gone for a F2P style and profit by selling cosmetics like TF2 or LoL though.Anyway either you're a newbie or a veteran you'll enjoy it and have tons of fun! Recommended!
title: Rocket League®

review: Hands down my favorite pick up and play title for the last few months. This game's design is tuned *just right* in so many areas to make things fun fast fair and balanced. Looking back on it I don't know if I would have ever bought this game had it not come with the Steam Controller. I'm so glad it did though.Game is always being updated with new content All purchases are completely cosmetic. Neat movie tie ins with some car skins. Great recent visual update. New stages and game play modes being added all the time. My (seriously) only complaint I wish that ranked matches were only ever held in the "base" soccer field meaning the ubiquitous rectangular prism. Like Final Destination in SSBM a vanilla map like that really puts everything in a skills based arena and gives a nice level playing ground. Introducing new maps into the rotation is annoying in my 450.0 hours of play time I have yet to meet a person who likes playing on the Mad Max field.
title: Rocket League®

review: Best couch co op game in existence. My girlfriend and i have spent many a hour with the previous game on ps3 im so glad they brought this game to steam. This game takes the basics from the original and just improves massively over it. The controls are basic and easy to learn however due to the airial maneuvering and jumps able to be performed the skill ceiling is very high. The visual customisiation of the vehicles is highly rewarding and the season mode is a welcome addition. It runs very well on my PC and it looks amazing. 10/10 Would reccomend to anyone and i fully expect to be spending many a hour playing this game.

review: Rocket League is one of the best pickups I've had in years. This game is extremely fast paced competetive &amp just plain addicting. If you have a couple friends that you play PC games with I would HIGHLY suggest you all picking this game up. It's the most fun we've had playing a game in months maybe even years. I heard my friend say this over our voice chat and I believe he said a developer of "Rocket League" said this not too long ago... "Rocket League is like checkers when you first start out but when you start getting into it... it turns completely into a game of Chess." Not word for word or anything I re phrased it to the best of my ability from my horrible memory but still... that statement couldn't be more true. You'll be having a blast and think it's just a simple game... then out of absolute no where it becomes extremely challenging and strategic. They have a few custimizations at the moment. But I hear they're going to just keep adding and adding to this game. Stoked for the future of "Rocket League". I support it 100% and really hope you give it a chance.I will also be updating my review as time goes on.
title: Rocket League®

review: Very nice game but the developers are found guilty of a few illegal scams here and there.Scam 1 Image Quality. Max resolution is artificially limited to 1080p. That's extremely illegal right there. Needs a fix.Scam 2 1440p resolution is not available in the game menu despite having virtual resolution enabled in AMD panel.Scam 3 Anti Aliasing doesn't clean the image 100%. Needs higher resolutions and better AA.Scam 4 Screen tearing with V Sync OFF.Scam 5 Input lag with V Sync ON.Scam 6 No options for GTA4 or CrysisWars camera styles. Needs more camera styles and better viewing angles.Scam 7 No mod tools or user made maps. That's extremely illegal right there. Needs more maps and mods.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is pure simple fun. Give it a try despite any preconceived notions you may have about soccer or racing videogames. This is one of those games that you end up playing for 2+ hours when you were looking to kill a few minutes. Customization aspect is there and there is a ranked mode. Devs are consistent with updates and exploring new unique gamemodes. However they have ignored a few glitches that really should have been hotfixed by now. Still the core gameplay is tight and it's sure to keep you occupied. Buy it especially if it's on sale.

review: I'm a guy who absolutely hates sports. If you ask anyone I know a defining characteristic about my personality there's a possibility that it is something they might mention. However I absolutely love Rocket League. The physics and controls are a joy and it's an immeasurable amount of fun running around trying to snag the ball away from my friends whether it's through a fun power up or just a little ingenuity. I recommend this game for anyone even if you're not a fan of sports. If you enjoy having a good time with your friends (or anyone via the game's online mode) and like being sneaky and strategizing in clever ways this game is for you.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is a great multiplayer game. When first hearing of the game's concept you may be hesitant to believe that it is fun to play but it is! Playing soccer with crazy turbo boosting cars is insane. But this game has branched off from soccer as well. Now there is hockey and basketball to test your skills at too. The company behind this game is also incredible. Psyonix listens to the Rocket League community implementing necessary gameplay tweaks and is regularly adding new content. They have introduced new game modes cars and maps every couple of months which keeps players coming back. 9.5/10

review: I've played this game for hundreds of hours and still have yet to feel bored of the game. I received this game in a bundle with the steam link and it has dominated my gaming life since. All other games just don't seem as fun after playing this game. The skill cap is hard to reach and there's always more to perfect. The community on the other hand is not as good as the game. While I was in the lower two tiers of ranks almost everybody I played with had a superiority complex and had some of the most vulgar and rude language I've ever seen. I've received death threats for goals that shouldn't have happened and much more indecent things... As you rise to Rising Star and above you'll realize not everybody is a jerk and people acknowledge when they are wrong. Great game meh community if you don't plan to get too competitive. I would recommend it if you have the money to spare. Great game to play with friends.
title: Rocket League®

review: Very good game
title: Rocket League®

review: Every person I've shown this game to has loved it. Here's a number of reasons to give it a shot Dialed in physics. Super tight driving controls. Super tight FLYING controls (although hard to master). Quick fast gameplay and games (5 minute rounds by default). Numerous FREE updates and modes from the game devs. Tons of customization options for your vehicle (free and paid). The birth of numerous jaw dropping and hillarious moments that can only be created by rocket boosting cars around on a soccer field.Just give it a go on a friend's console and there's a 90% chance you'll be hooked.

review: I 100% Recommend this game. I have 800 hours in Rocket league at this time and I can say for sure I have gotten everything I want in a competative sports game from it! Many people might not follow through and continue playing this game for a few reasons and I can tell you a few and how to get over them and play the game to it's fullest.Many people just abandon the game because they think they aren't good enough. When I was a noob i remember saying "one day I want to do an aerial" and every day before school i played for an hour every day after school i played for a few hours just practicing and eventually i reached where I am now doing aerial dribbles and passing more than I've ever seen before. Many people might also abandon the game because they don't have anyone to play with. I had that problem until I met someone named Alex and we've been playing together for a couple months now and it is so much fun communicating and playing as a team. So find people to play with it is very fun. Don't give up and if you're going to buy the game buy it and never give up. Practice practice practice practice. Trust me. Have fun!

review: What can be said about Rocket league that has not already been said?First i would like to say that i am not a huge fan of e sport style games. Games Like DOTA CS GO and LOL are not really a great game to just go out and play the communities and players can be rather toxic and annoying when even playing casual games (overwatch goes without saying). However with rocket league an average gamer can pick up the game and actually have a good time playing with almost anyone while there are toxic members in ever facet of every game this one seems to be more easy to deal with and have less heads to worry about. While im all for some good jabs at opponents as most people can probably contest some people are just unbearable. (if i had a dollar for ever jack wad that told me to kys i could pay a few months rent in advance)The platform is spot on and it goes without saying that the game has become rather polished over the years leaving a clean and fun competitive environment to flex ones skills and improve.DLC is all cosmetic and some of the money they get form sales goes towards having more tournaments with larger cash pools. so its really refreshing to see this as opposed to PTW style DLC.If you game with a lot of friends i recommend this game it's fun and can really lead to some epic high energy matches. There is a learning curve to get over as far as getting better at the game and being able to preform high skilled maneuvers. But overall most of these skills are not impossible to lean and eventually become more proficient at.Finally i will say this if you do not like games that require time and patients to learn and possibly even master this or many other e sport titles may not be your cup of tea. But if you like physically grinding to become better and like rich competitive environments then rocket league is a solid buy.
title: Rocket League®

review: I love the game spent already XYZ hours playing it. Never played any other game for so long. And still... I DON'T RECOMMEND IT. Why? Because of the community.The game owners just don't care about the peoples behavior. You can't really play a normal competitive game without any problems. It happens so rarely that you can really play a normal 3 vs 3 game with strangers. It's barely possible. There are always jerks in one or the other team that decided to ff because it's already 0 1 people go afk just leave matches play against their teams troll insult other players etc. You win most of the matches because there are idiots in the opposite team and you lose most of the matches because there are idiots in your team. You can play the best match ever and still lose you can play like a noob and win because little kids in the other team are fighting with each other. It just doesn't matter. And of course reporting other players doesn't change anything.If you like to be frustrated than play it. It took too much time to understand that this game just make me furious. And I don't care if I win or lose the way it happens makes me crazy. DON'T PLAY THIS GAME. Peace out.

review: Bought this game last night and completely worth the $20. The mechanics and feel of the game are solid. However if you are looking to just play single player I highly suggest that you not buy this game then. This game heavily works on Multiple experience and with friends! Even if your losing in a match it is still awesome to play!Pros Solid Mechanics Great simple concepts and control scheme (so that anyone can pick it up!) Great multiplayer servers (experienced very little lag) Skins and custom features for your car! REPLAY CAM! The moments when you score an epic goal just keeps you going!Some thoughts I would love for them to have a better system for assists. There are plenty of times where I had a assist between 3 people but it only registers the last two. The VOIP in game is kind of off can't tell who is talking or if it is only with your team or everyone in the match. Look forward to see what kind of extra things they will put down the road.

And lets face it Rocket League wouldn't be as good without the online section of the game.However recently (well... a few months ago) the game started becoming as popular as it was maybe because of the 'free game days' on Xbox where you can try games out which it was featured in. So I decieded to go back and play it... well I never thought you could be so pleasently suprised with a video game! The lag was obviously fixed and various new maps and car decals were released. And now I'm loving the game!

review: Nothing compares to the euphoria I experiance when playing this game. It is the best game ever period.Wether I bit into a taco for the first time held a baby for the first time or took my first 10 inch BBC absolutely nothing has compared me for the ecstacy and endorphin released high that this game has brought me. Ever spread peanut butter without it clumping?Ever dropped a fierce poop without splash back? Gotten free quacmole at a costa VITA? Well none of those sensations compare to the experiance this game provides. If you do not purchase this game You are not only a trump supporter. You are an enemy to man kind and God's light itself.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket propelled RC cars no 30 FPS cap... and probably the only game even slightly related to football (Soccar to the yanks) that ain't the world's most boring waste of money!Now for a little more depth (That's what she said)I got this game during the Steam sales to give it a try. I'm not a massive fan of anything related to footbal (imo it's just a bunch of overpaid fairies kicking a ball (and each other) around a feild for 90 minutes... BOOOORING!) and I must say... IT'S FUN. The mechanics of the game itself are rock solid it's pretty tense at times and overall very addictive! My rule of thumb for games is usually "If this game doesn't have me hooked in under 30 minutes I ain't keepin' it!"... I can safely say this masterpiece of a game is 100% staying in my games library!!PROS RC cars!!HATS!!! (I mean what game's complete without a fez!?)An EXTREMELY wide range of customisations for your carsOn the game engine Coded using the Unreal SDK so it looks breathtaking and runs like butter... even on my 4 year old Radeon 7900 class GPUs maxed out 1440P CROSSFIRE X ALL THE WAY! You guys did an amazong job of optimising this game!flawless controller support (If you're that type of player... Which I am for this game specifically) and the KB/Mouse controls are good as well!Cons Sorry guys... If you want a reaosn to NOT buy this game because you have the Steam sale insanity... Don't have one!! BUY THIS GAME!

review: You get out of this game what you put in.Rocket League is not a sports game its a sport. You don't have player ratings or level up your shooting or unlock the best character. The only thing you can choose is your car and they all go the same speed.Well doesn't that make it boring there's no progression its just playing a soccer match over and over?HELL NO!You want a perfectly lobbed pass right in front of your teammate and over your defender? You don't hit Lt+A and your car just knows how to do it. You dribble the ball on top of your car and once the ball is the perfect angle over your car you pop that sucker over him then your teammate doesn't just hit B and he shoots he has to time the hit and know should I flip into it or will that make it go over? Maybe just a guiding bump.There are endless possibilities!You practice your own moves startegies and plays. The only thing they set you up with is the field and yet it can be infintely rewarding getting better and climbing through the league divisions.It's not a sports game. Its Rocket League.10/10 Would score own goal like it was a 5 year old soccer game again.

review: "If while I'm driving a 6ft diameter soccer ball should suddenly appear on the road I will be ready. Very ready. Thank you Rocket League!" Sir Alf's Big Book of Thanks Vol. 2 pg 82.Rocket League is a 3 dimensional adrenaline pumping sport featuring two goals rocket propelled cars and a giant soccer ball. It's the kind of game that gets so intense you might jump out of your seat to try and put a little extra english on that critical strike. Then upon missing throw the controller across the room. Then sit heads in hands and let the emotions go because this is the 2018 and it doesn't make you any less a man...but i digress. 10/10 for the most part but as far as online play goes be warned homenetwork/server problems can noobify you in an instant and leave you frustrated.Long live Rocket League!

review: I think a lot of people see this game as just silly fun and while it is it also is good at being a soccer game itself. Most other sports games like Fifa or Madden have you in command of a team. You aren't actually playing the sport you're telling people in the game how to play. While that's all well and good it isn't really a game about that sport it's a game about you in command of a sports team. In Rocket League you're playing soccer. You are in complete control of one member of the team and only that member. You can work with your teammates on the fly but you are unable to take control of their vehicles. That's what makes this so good. You feel something when goals happen because it's directly related to what you as a player have done. You didn't tell some guy to run down the field with the ball to strike you actually DID that. Couple that with good sounds nice graphics and plenty of non payed for unlockables to keep you going and Rocket League becomes an amazing video game. If it wasn't for the tight and refined controls of a car this game probably wouldn't work but here we are.
title: Rocket League®

review: I received this game for free when I bought my steam controller. I thought to myself "Oh that game looks okay. That's a nice little bonus don't konw if I'll play it."The game sat unplayed for over a month before I fired it up. I honestly didn't expect much but wanted to see what it was all about.Boy did I underestimate this title. This is game is more fun than hanging out with Bill Murray all night. In fact the only thing that could be more fun than this game is playing this game with BIll Murray on the couch next to you.It takes a little bit to warm up to the controls but once you do you'll be scoring goals and making epic saves left and right. I had no idea I wanted a game where you played soccer or hockey with cars... but now that I have it my life is finally complete.This is more fun than Mario Kart. Easily.

review: This game a pleasant pallet cleanser in the wash of recycled ideas. Its success is credited to the fact it is the only game that provides this kind of experience at a level that fells premium. It has very naturally developed an eSports scene that I consider joining in on. It can be played at all levels from comfort food gaming to hardcore team based deathmatches.Pros Great eSports and community support Cross platform with PS4 ensures longevity and fast lobby matching Competent gauntlet of standard video and display options Small file size runs great on all modern computers Tight as frack controlsCons None so far. Some cosmetic items and cars have DLC paywall but I wont discount a developer for making money on purely cosmetic items.

review: Great game to play with friends. Would recommend to anyone that has friends. Would not recommend to people without friends. In other words this game derives much of its value from social interactions and while it is possible to play in a bubble like many online multiplayer games you lose most of what you pay for when you do this. If you and a group of friends are looking for something to play for a couple hours a week together this is the game for you.

review: Rocket League is definately up there when it comes to great games. I would recomend this game to anyone. It is a game that is easy to learn and hard to master. It is a game i find myself riggling around in my chair trying to hit the ball. Screaming at my team mate for stealling my shot. Rage quiting because of my horrible internet. Death starring my computer for only being able to play it on virtually min settings and low resolusion and only getting 30 40 frames. (Nvidia 210) I am currently pestering my friends who dont already have the game to get the game. The support from physonic and the continuous updates keep players active. You start of as a rookie madly rushing towards the ball trying to hit it anyway you can. Semi pro You start to see a way of doing things you ocationally leave it for someone in a better position to hit. Able to perform some saves.Pro The person who starts closest to goal realises that he should stay back and defend at the kickoff after a goal and at the start of the game a minute number of people realise they can use boost while jumping and start doing small airials. People realise how to jump off the wall and hit the ball. Able to save goals well.Veteran Learn about / become better at airials. able to jump off a wall ad use boost to hit the ball. Airial saves.Expert Able to free style airial hit airials with great acuracy. Perform rediculously sketchy shots. Better airial saves. You become increasingly mad at the matchmaking system as you are partnered with semi pros and are versing legends.Master Able to free style airial with great acuracy (some people). Able to perform great airials. Legend able to do everything better.Rocketeer (not sure how to spell it) Joins a match 1 0 gets it to 1 10 leaves with 5 seconds left with the other team screaming at themselves for being bad.
title: Rocket League®

review: Pros +Very fun gameplay especially with friends.Cons Filled to the brim with microtransaction crates ala Counter Strike Global Offensive and Team Fortress 2. They're all cosmetic items such as new car models and paint finishes however these were previously stand alone DLC packs that didn't rely on gambling. The proceeds of the sales goes towards the prize pool for official Rocket League eSports events. While the gameplay itself is fun what isn't fun are the abysmal game servers. Even if you have a ping time in the 20 or 30s of milliseconds you'll still get rubberbanding. It seems that even with the massive amounts of cash generated from game sales and microtransactions Psyonix just can't afford good servers to handle the load of players even at non peak hours.

So much fun and addictive! I stopped playing MOBAs and online FPS and I was looking for something else that I could play constantly and not getting tired. This is the game for me at the moment! Two years now and never getting tired of it yet.. Own it on PC + Console!

review: In the past I was reluctant to purchase this game even though my friends all said it was great. I thought it would just be an arcade feeling game that would get old after about 10hrs of play. I couldn't be more wrong. Whether you play this game casually in small bursts or competitively with a team this game is an absolute blast. By far one of the happiest purchases I have in my library.The only negative I can really think of is that all the different car types you can choose from are not just aesthetic changes like they seem. Only recently did I discover they actually have different sized hitboxes and turning speeds. For casual players this shouldn't matter at all but for competitive players it's a bit of a downer. I love the look of some of the cars but they come out to be slightly worse than others. In a competitive environment it's never good to put yourself at a disadvantage no matter how small.
