review: I've just hit the big 5 0 in hours for Rocket League and that means it's a major hit for me. In the case of Rocket League it's simply because it's so fun that hardly a day goes by that I don't play at least a couple matches.The concept is simple enough cars + soccer but the execution is what really makes it. It's all about your own abilities as well as the situational awareness you and your teammates have. See a teammate setting up a shot? Lay back a few seconds and prepare to go for the goal. The opposing team just made a shot and your team has no one backfield? Better prepare to defend if no one else is. Is the opposing team's star player in front of you and looking at taking a shot? Might be time to boost into them for a demolition!As the examples above illustrate it's very much a game where both being smarter than always going for the ball as well as tactical skill will make a difference. To be sure being able to make those jump shots will play a considerable role and if you're facing a team with much better tactics it will be hard to win. But it's so gratifying to see your teammates take advantage of your setups as well and so frustrating when you're unable to score because the other team is sure to always have someone ready to defend on a second's notice.The controls also deserve a note since the game recommends a controller. I didn't buy the game until trying it on a free weekend due to that recommendation but thankfully the game works just fine with a keyboard + mouse. The precision on turns is not quite as good but you can still performs lots of sick moves without a controller and feel naturally in control of your car. I have a friend who's in the Challenger tier with keyboard + mouse so you don't need a controller to become pretty good. I did recently start using my XBox (original) controller in the game and that works well enough too especially after a couple input rebinds. As a PC gamer historically I'm still better with keyboard + mouse than controller but my tenative plan at this point is to switch to controller for soccer and stick with keyboard + mouse for the rather different hockey mode.Hockey Mode (Snow Day) deserves a mention of its own. This has become my favorite game mode and while the amount of games is about 98% soccer 1% basketball 1% hockey there's still more than enough hockey to find a game quickly in the U.S. East region even though it's the middle of summer. This mode plays with a puck that's less bouncy than the regular soccer ball and thus is much more a game about the edges of the field and angles of attack. After learning how to set up shots in that mode it's become the icing on the cake for me and I'd highly recommend giving it a try.Spec wise the game is not especially demanding. I typically play on a Radeon 6870 that's below the recommended specs but I can still run the game at 60 FPS steady with near max settings at 1920x1200. And it looks amazing. On my laptop with a Mobility Radeon 5870 and Windows XP (which isn't even officially supported but works) I have to turn the specs down but it's still plenty playable. At least as long as I'm on Ethernet mediocre wireless and high pings do have a noticeable negative impact on the game. So pack an Ethernet cord if you're playing it at a friend's place but as long as you have halfway decent graphics you'll probably be fine in that department.At this point I see no foreseeable end in sight to Rocket League being in my standard repertoire of games. I plan it at home. I play it with friends. There's soccer hockey Rocket Labs for a bit of variety in life. And I'm still learning new techniques that increase my skill but as importantly the number of maneouvers I have to play with in game. An excellent game and I'd definitely recommend picking it up.

review: Product received for free. EDIT NOW ON MAC AND STEAMOS!TL DR BUY IT NOW A MASTERPIECE.(Even though I won this game it does not effect any of my opinions or points in the review)This game is f**king amazing and if you don't have it buy it NOW! It is well worth the money and the DLC is very reasonably priced especially with the 2 car packs. Even though I only got the game last night I'm already considering getting the DLC this game is a MASTERPIECE. But with all things beautiful the internet kills it. But this time literally. The servers at the moment are terribly plagued with rubber banding. This effects the game A LOT when playing online. My ping is at a constant 20 40 yet I get pretty bad rubber banding. The worst thing is it's the console's fault. Ever since there was crossplay the servers went to s**t. If this carries on it may affect my score more than it does already.Anyway overall I give this game a 9/10 on it's own without the server problem and 7/10 with the server problem.Scoring System1 Terrible don't ever buy it2 Buy as a joke if 90% off and you don't want any friends3 Only buy for yourself if you hate yourself4 Buy when on 90% off for 10 30 mins of gameplay5 Decent amount of gameplay buy when on sale6 Buy for an above average experience7 Quite good game buy if you want a good experience8 Buy ASAP when on &gt 30% sale9 Buy even when on a minimal sale/no sale at all10 F**king masterpiece. Buy ASAP no matter whatIf this review was helpful please tell me. If not tell me what to improve!

I could say RC cars but I feel like they imagine it better with Hot Wheels. I can't recommend this game enough. Matches are fairly quick so it's easy to play just for a little bit. Sometimes you have a few bad matches and want to quit but then the next one is a good match. There are always a ton of players online all the time so wait times are usually 5 20 seconds to get into a match. What are you waiting for?? Get the game now!!

review: The most fun game I have played in a while. Was legitimately addicted to it for the first 3 weeks. If the youtube videos of this game look fun and awesome then you well love it as I do. Definitely need to stick to whatever control method you are most used to (controller/keyboard) as I started trying to play this with a keyboard and struggled because I was not used to playing on one (plus it was a laptop keyboard) although I could see having much less trouble if I got used to it. Hooked up an Xbox One controller to my computer though and it improved my game significantly since that is what I am used to. Also a great game to play with friends or people you can talk with so you dont have to enjoy all the great/crazy/epic moments by yourself.

review: This game is a lot of fun but it has a very difficult learning curve. If you plan to be competitive online you HAVE to learn how to do aerial hits and other tricks because a lot of people will NOT take it easy on you. There's very little room for error and the camera controls aren't the best. Oftentimes I'll find myself wildly flying far past the ball after I flipped the opposite direction I moved the controller. Perhaps these issues are my fault but I digress. The online community is very toxic but if you play with friends that are competent at the game you'll have a good time. Despite all the negatives that go along with this game I do recommend it because it's a lot of fun to play (with friends.)

review: Excellent gameGood graphics customisation replayability competitiveness and never ending perfectionism.This game allows you to customize your car using stickers colors hats trails explosions engine sound (although a part in each category is locked by a paywall or crates with keys system). It's using a ingame trading system with items such as crates skins car models etc. It's also insanely replayable and allows the player to constantly see himself improve as hours are invested. Learning new strategies and once impossible moves such as aerials prove themselves really satisfying once learned and applied perfectly.Now yes there's smurfs around... However when you think of it most games with ranking systems have this issue. It also has few minor issues with ranking and casual matchmaking which is generally close to perfect (sometimes had a couple of tight games with 1 0 on overtime!)Really good game should defenitely give it a try.

review: This is one of the more *fun* PC games I have played in a long time. It's great for me because I can sit down and play for 15 minutes and get just as much out of it as the rare times that I am able to play for an hour or more.I use an XBox One controller connected via USB and it works perfectly. Controls are flawless and I often forget that I am using my Windows PC.The soundtrack is surprisingly good this is one of the few games that I pause Spotify for while I play. Throw on the headset and enjoy the tunes!All in all great game huge replay value and you can't beat the price.P.S. Basketball is coming in a few days... Yes I said it BASKETBALL including an official NBA DLC!

review: I really wanted to try and and get into Rocket League but my controller wouldn't work. I know I know I'm rocking an older dreamGear DGPS3 1394 (2010?)but the thing works with virtually every other program I've thrown at it. I read somewhere on Psyonix's forums that due to cost they decided to not include DirectInput. This means that you have to "trick" the computer into thinking you have an Xbox 360 controller that uses Xinput. I tried using Xbox360ce to no avail. Probably a solid title no big doubts there but I'm a little ticked Steam gets controller support happy when something so integral to that notion is left out. Beware if you don't have an Xbox controller it may not work or entail some jumping through hoops.

review: One of the greatest games ever made. Seeing as I have over 600 hours on this game I thought I'd weigh in. Rocket League is a game that is similar to Counter Strike (in the competitive way). My thoughts? 600 hours in and I still suck I'm okay in this. I know how to do aerials and I can hit the ball decently but sometimes you see people that do amazing freestyle shots and you just want to be like them. That is why I want to keep playing this it's all about progression. And when you do get frustrated (trust me you will) you can easily quit the game after a couple of games because the games it self only takes less than 6ish minutes (unless you have a crazy overtime play). Buy this game support the devs they listen this game is a classic already. I love it I love the community. I love the saltiness it brings out in me and other players. It's an awesome game.PS Rumble is f****ing awesome.

review: Games addictive as . Ranked feels hit and miss with match ups sometimes you will fight lower leveled players and slaughter them other times u will fight higher ranked players and get slaughtered ('Balance' D).Casuals are ok game runs good although i have internet lag and hangups can be fatal.The Level Design is pretty good all though the starting maps are clones with different skins it feels different and some people will play better/worse on different maps cos Brain Reasons.The Cars Handle differently although some feel the same most people use Dominus (DLC car) or the Octane (Vanilla car) which has lead me to develop and irrational hatred of those that use them XD (I use mostly Takuma and Merc D).Each car has strengths and weakness Dominus has reach but Takuma has flexibility..........(mass effect 2 joke...sorry)its worth 20 bucks so buy it.

review: So. When I read the patch notes and explanation of the trade in system it clearly stated you can exchange "duplicate" items for an item with a higher rarity. Seeing as I liked this idea I headed over to de manage inventory icon and decided to try this feature. TO NO AVAIL. As I selected my Traffic Cone Homburg Chick Magnet Chef's Hat and Shuriken toppers to trade in thinking they were duplicates I received some nice Wildcat Ears in return. Only to find out later that all five of my so stated "duplicates" were gone from my Garage.I hope that this is either an early bug or that the explanation on your website is faulty because I was unprepared to lose five toppers that weren't actually duplicates just to get some cat ears I probably won't equip in the near future.Other than that. This game rocks and is the best hybrid casual/competitive game to hit my steam account since Garry's Mod.
title: Rocket League®

review: This game lives up to the hype it had whern first released even over a year later. The biggest part of that is Psyonix's commitment to continuous free updates to the maps wearables and game types. The physics are very intuitive feeling and despite playing for over 50 hours there are still aspects of the same I haven't "mastered" yet (flying shots anyone?). One can thoroughly enjoy this game regardless of their affinity for soccer and/or racing games as the controls are simple (I recommend a controller) and the matches informal.

review: Edit Psyonix fixed this game. New patch not a stutter or hiccup since. Buy this game.I love this game. It 's the most fun I 've had with a video game in a very long time. Unfortunately the game recently became virtually unplayable for me. The game is suffering incredible drops in FPS and severe stuttering. I have a fairly high end pc build (i7 3930k GTX 980ti 32GB RAM game installed on SSD) and after many hours of scouring the internet for a fix I am still unable to resolve this. Support messages to Psyonix have been unanswered after weeks.Psyonix please fix this game.

review: Rocket league is one of the best games I've ever played. Most people would disagree. There are of course some pros and cons to this game. But overall the idea is amazing.Rocket cars and a ball. It's like combining 2 of men's favorite things into one. SOCCAR.PROS The game has a lot of amazing DLCs. The game music is AMAZING.The car customizing is pretty cool. The physics is being improved.The game is fast paced. CONS The game is SO heavy on the graphics card and CPU. It may cause over heating could range from fps lags to complete shut down of your PC. IF you're not using a godlike pc of course.The match making could be a bit annoying in ranks.I get random ping lags in some servers. One game I can be happy with my ping the other game my ping goes up to 300 for no reason. And I always queue in the same Europe/Middle East regions. Of course other people can name a lot more pros and cons to this game but I'm just sharing my opinion.
title: Rocket League®

review: THis is just a wonderful multiplayer game. Easy to learn incredibly difficult to master this game just packs a huge amount of great gameplay into a super simple easy to digest package. The matches are pretty short so if you find yourself on a bad team or dont like the players its easy to just finish out and hop into a new lobby. Playing with friends and learning to coordinate is a blast and the game is well supported with free updates and some awesome cosmetic DLC. Cant really think of a bad thing to say here the game just keeps getting better and better the longer it goes.

review: Possibly the most awesome non RPG game of all time. Five minute doses of riveting sports like thrills without the mindless thuggery of actual team based sports (if I offend you good you ing halfwit). I have only (and will only) played against bots but I find myself both challenged and delighted. Excitement! Rockets! Soccer (football for the civilized nations)! Explosions! Rough approximations of physics! And DAMMIT ATTACK THE BALL ATTACK THE EFFING BALL YOU MOTHER oh my bots scored for me. Um. I'm helping!I'm not helping. Still having fun though.PS. the music is **great**.

review: I wanted to post this when I had way more time on this game so I knew pretty much all of the games features and basically "how to play... well." I'm still not there yet but I'm gonna post it now because why not? I play well and know most advanced mechanics and play styles and a bit of freestyle. OK I'll stop rambling on about how good I am when I'm clearly still a noob to this "easy to learn hard to master" game. So where to start? Well this game will make you rage a lot. To be honest the ranked pairing system still isn't where it needs to be. As an expert you may get paired with a legend maybe a pro. It may be a 9 0 game to you or maybe 0 9 to them. *Time doesn't mean skill* Okay so the gameplay. The controls are insanely smooth (unless you play with a keyboard and mouse but unlucky you if so) the bounces feel realistic and all the cars are slightly different with some slower to turn but a sleeker hitbox and some may have a very good turning circle but very robust large hitbox all better for a different play style. (eg. Dominus for attacking Octane for midfield and Merc for defence.) And on to graphics even though you shouldn't worry too much about those in a fast paced game are very pretty and have a great atmosphere. It feels like you're in a real stadium but instead of a normal football ground you're playing car football in a floating arena around a city or a park. The game is a huge huge jump from it's predecessor "acrobatic rocket powered battle cars". Which if you loved as child (or teenager) you will almost certainly love this if not more. The devolepers are always coming with new patches and updates and also have merchandise. (Which to be honest I bought a lot of c ) Overall it's a very challenging fun fast paced game I'm sure you will play for hundreds of hours on end.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is one of the most addictive games I have ever played. I originally got it for free on PS Plus when it first came out and instantly put over 100 or so hours into it. Rocket League is the very definition of "easy to learn hard to master". The game takes about 10 or so minutes to really learn the controls but there is so much more to learn. The game constantly revolves around skill and pure luck. The community is very active and for only $20 this game is an absolute steal!

review: When I play an online game like a shooter against other players and someone kills me...well that doesn't happen. No one kills me. Because that would mean that all those people are better than me and that is not acceptable. Why would they lie like that. They are lying if they kill me. And that means I will have to kill...everyone...slowly...in real life. Someone...everyone will pay.That about sums up how my brain reacts to online PvP. But with Rocket League I can actually have fun and not feel pressured or (too) angry. I guess that has partially to do with the fact that players do not attack each other as much as they attack the goal. But it is also because the game just has a happy silly and easy to grasp gameplay. This game compares well to Insurgency. That may sound strange since Insurgency is an FPS but the energy and efficiency of both games are similar. You get into a match quite fast. Once the game is over new players are found if some players leave. The flow keeps going. The game's not too fast not too slow. On top of that the game looks great and runs smoothly. There are customization options and different game types. I frankly can't find a negative...Rocket Leage is quite possibly the most fun I've had with a computer.
title: Rocket League®

review: I am not a big fan of sports game but this game will change your mind. My work buddy suggested this game to me and I was hesitant at first. But I bought the game for 14 bucks on green man gaming and I started playing it with my work buddy. It was brutal and had a hard time with the controls but once you go though the tutorials and play some more online matches you will instantly become hooked to this game and will be hankering to play one more match before calling it quits.This game is simple pure and chaotically fun. Absolutely the BEST GAME of 2015. I heard the servers were bad in the beginning but it is actually fine. I am getting into matches quickly and there are no timeouts or server crashes. Give this game a chance non sports fan and you will become addicted to this game. I give it a 9/10 Awesome.

review: I love this game. It is probably the greatest game I have ever played in my life. I have played over 700 hours of this game and don't regret a single second of it. In fact I will probably sink atleast 700+ more hours into it. Why? Because it was fun throughout all levels of learning and gameplay! I am STILL learning a lot of stuff in this game even though it seems so simple. I loved this game the first game I played when I could barely hit the ball I loved this game the first time I hit an aerial I loved this game the first time I got a freestyle off the wall shot. There is so much room to grow and learn from this game while you get to enjoy playing it! HIGHLY reccomend ... unless you have obligations or a life outside of Rocket League ... then you will lose that.
title: Rocket League®

review: Love this game. Put a lot hours in this on PS4 when it was on Plus and bought it again here a year later. Still tons of players on the servers and still getting some great matches. I still have a problem with the matchmaking though. I'll have a few good runs where I'm matched with players with similar ranks and we have good competitive evenly matched games. But once that brief run is over I'm constantly getting matches with players several levels higher than me and those games just aren't fun. Three Experts two Masters. and little old Semi Pro me... not quite a fair fight. Sometimes they'll throw in another Semi Pro or Pro player but often times when that happens that player ends up on my team so the odds are even less in our favor. Despite those matchmaking frustrations I'll keep coming back to this game.

review: For the uninitiated Rocket League is essentially soccer but all play is done with remote control cars that can jump flip and fly through the air. Sounds easy right? WRONG. Anyone can play and enjoy this game but it takes HUNDREDS of hours to master. Even when losing this is a game that is hard to not have fun playing. There are hundreds of custom items to make your car "your own" and it can be maddening just how many options there are. None of the cosmetic stuff affects game play at all but its fun to have a setup that no one has seen.If you're looking for a game that is fun easy to learn hard to master and has very high replay ability this is the game for you. Ive been playing for 2 years and STILL love it as much (if not more) as the first time I played it. 5/5 stars and I HIGHLY recommend it...
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is a great way to spend your time. This game is just pure fun. Soaring through the air hitting a ball with a car sounds weird but is incredibly entertaining. The customization is amazing. The Cars look great. The arenas look great. And in my roughly 250 hours of playing I am yet to encounter a glitch. My only criticism with the game would be the trading trading only affects the look of your car but besides that makes no difference to gameplay. I'd give the 9.8 out of 10 really worth it.

review: You thought you had finally resolved the mysteries and discovered the answers to life's many questions didn't you little avocado? You'd boiled the spinach of life and found rich leafy textures appealing to your adult soul but in the back of your mind something shrieked to the marimba of uncertainty.Memories of a field adorned with the ruin of mechanical foes long past. A gently gliding exploder ball that denies you regardless of your choice in shirt/pants combos. An eternal foe revving a thousand cylinders of rage at you with amorous intentDelve deep into this battlefield of worlds and know that the yours is the hand of fate in this land of goals and broken dreams. Yours are the eyes that will see the goal before you and reach for it with beckoning fingers only to be swept away by the moustache tendrils of defeat. Time and time again you will witness the acrobatics of an elegant foe and dream of their demise by the wheels of your trusty neon steed. Yet as your eager dreams of glorious combat fade you are left with the bittersweet cinnamon of realization stuck to your molars. Was it combat you truly sought? Or only the elusive lechuga we all know to be the heartbeat of all things? The lechuga is a ephemeral concept my friend few can truly grasp it in scarred fingers and truly see it for its identity. Strife and struggle will make your heart weary to the world but do not let it seal your eyes to the truth of things. Be unafraid to flip your motor car repeatedly while boosting across this sanguine field of blood and bones. The field is your stage and you must be the true warrior to win all the fights upon it. This game is both the bees and their knees I would play it for one million minutes at least.
title: Rocket League®

review: Servers still suck.Resets of rankings and leaderboards.I have the best ping in matches yet I still regularly get server lag and most often close to the ball in front of the net (ie the worst possible time to get lag).No report function for teammates. Just played a game where a guy spun on his top the whole match. While I laughed a lot his teammate was angry.In pub games teammates regularly leave and are replaced by bots. You are regularly thrown into matches where it is halfway done and the score sucks. In ranked games if a teammate leaves you're down a man. What fun when a 3v3 becomes 3v2. You can also start matches where not everyone loads and the game is then canceled (wait for match load wait for players wait for loaders nothing what fun!).No reporting no muting these are two really simple features for an online game so there is not a lot of variety or real polish. This game is worth maybe 5 bucks at most. Wait for it on sale. PS4 players get it free and that is a good deal because that is what it is really worth NOTHING.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is the sports game that every one should play. The game is entertaining fresh nothing about it is salt inducing cause there are no cheap strategy everything is skill based. And best of all each match is a 5 min adrenaline packed game.The only downside I mean the only single con about this game is the Unreliable Servers. I live in India and have to play on a 180 ping server of EU against players with 28 ping. Because other servers give me 250 to 400 ping. Psyonix have voiced their concern recently regarding the server issues so in the near future expect this game to be as big as other MOBA games.

review: This game is awesome and it keeps getting better. It's a simple concept and the controls are fairly easy to learn. Since the game released there are now ice hockey and basketball game modes as well as "Rocket Labs" which are experimental game types with different types of maps balls and physics. With all the options and the addicting nature of the game plus the frequent updates it's unlikely you'll get bored.It's worth noting though that it will take some time to get good at the "acrobatic" aspect with jumping flipping and boosting although you can still win plenty of games without having to utilize those too much.If you have a laptop or an older PC you might get lag at the beginning of the match but most new PCs should run it fine. It's definitely worth the full price which is what I paid and I don't regret it.

review: Rocket league is a great game. It has mixed football with flying cars whats not to like about it. For my review I am going to break it down into different segments and first will be....Gameplay it is an incredibly difficult game to play. However no matter how good or bad you are you are always able to have fun on this game. Theres plenty of different game modes like rumble or basketball (hoops) and its a simple idea that provides hours upon hours of fun. It is a game of skill though you cant just learn everything in a day different skills will require hard work and a lot of practice to perform like air dribbling which means (you guessed it) to dribble or carry the ball through the air with your car. Theres a lot of cars to try out each having their own benefit to use with different turning circles hitboxes etc... Theres an absolute tonne of stuff that goes into the mechanical side to the game which is your skillset but theres also the mentality that you need. In order to gain ranks and improve skill in team based gamemodes like 2v2s you need to learn rotation and when to attack and when not to attack. It is a really simple idea but with a very complex learning curve. I mean im about 800hrs in (with ps4 hours roughly included) and im only diamond rank 1 which is barely *good*. Each gamemode also has a different style of play like in solo you will typically be more passive but the more team mates you play with the more creative and assertive you can be. The gameplay I rate a 9/10. The only reason it isn't a 10/10 is because if you play solo the game can become very repetitive and boring for those who aren't competitive and the somewhat bad matchmaking system.Next is the cosmetic side to the game. This wasn't too great at the start of the game as there wasn't too many customisable options however with the new season just starting it has opened up a world of oppertunity to look majestic while putting opponents to shame. You can change colors. decals wheels toppers antennas goal explosions the wheel track your car has when it reaches *supersonic*. Everything has become customisable and im sure Psyonix is working on more stuff as we speak. Not as complex as the gameplay and no color sliders or anything but it is a decent customisation system they have made and will rate it an 8/10Finally my last topic is the community. The community like most games are terrible at the lower ranks you miss an easy ball you get spammed with "what a save!" constantly. However psyonix has listened to our complaints about this kind of behaviour in more extreme cases like swearing and just complete sh*t talk. Luckily enough many players are against the toxicity as you move towards the higher ranks so it gets better the more you do. However its usually not until you reach Platinum rank that the toxicity really takes a nose dive in consistency. For these reasons im giving the community a 7/10 because there are a lot of people willing to help others prosper in the game its just a small amount overall that are toxic. My overall rating is an 8/10 for this game. I have put a lot of hours into the game and have had a great experience and have even met some of my best friends on here. A great game to play overall with tonnes of fun. I wont go into trading because im pretty sure thats similar to most other games. Hope you found this helpful!

review: All cars have same speed Good Limited Boost Makes Sense Paint Decal Wheels and Boost Trail Customization Standard Holiday Specials to be released later All cars do NOT have the same size collision boxes a bit Strange but helps with different playstyles Physics Works as Intended. Go play some table tennis and look at the angles the paddle hits the ball and where the ball goes. PINCH (not crush) a ping pong ball between your thumb and index finger and watch it go flying. Go play some billiards or watch Pool trick shots and see how the point of contact and angle hitting the cue ball affects its speed and trajectory and show it bounces off the sides of the billiards table. Servers Not Great Matchmaking Terrible Hats DEAR ERIS WHY? IT'S A FACKING CAR!

review: By far one of the best games I have ever played. The skill gap from the world's best to casual friends who play at a party is both massive but also doesn't matter. Anyone can play this game and will have fun regardless of age and skill level. The DLC is purely cosmetic so there is no pay to win.There are a variety of game modes to play and so far the producers don't seem to take them away after a few weeks like in league of legends. The cross play between PS4 and PC creates a bigger scene around the game.The frequency of updates is not too fast nor too slow.The new steam workshop support adds an immense amount of undiscovered potential.There is no pressure to win unless you want to be competitive. There are plently of options for casual players players who like competition and those who want to be the world's best.The sole point of this game is to "have fun" which Psyonix seems to have mastered across all ages and skill levels.
title: Rocket League®

review: I don't like sports games. I don't particularly like soccer/football I mostly play single player story driven games. If they have a multiplayer mode I might take a peek but then retreat into SP territory again. Would I recommend Rocket League? yes.But. This game is nothing short of amazing. Having played a little over 200hrs now it's consistently the first thing that crosses my mind when contemplating what to play. Extremely fun and balanced gameplay that doesn't ever get boring different modes local splitscreen multiplayer even for online matches. Matchmaking is good Servers are generally reliable. There is no way to obtain items that give you an edge over other players everything you can buy or unlock is purely cosmetic except for the different car models which differ in the shape of their hitbox and their turning radius but those differences are marginal and mostly come down to personal preference. So the whole game comes down to your skill and the learning curve is huge. You get to grips with the controls quickly but you're constantly learning and making just slightly cooler moves each game and you have so much headroom for getting better.Conclusion I've bought a lot of the DLCs and quite some keys for the game and I'll continue doing so because I feel the 20 or so bucks you're paying for the base game just aren't adequate for all the fun and playtime I get out of this game. The developer is awesome and pushes out new free content on a regular basis. Oh and the contents of the DLCs and crates are sick and high quality as well.Tips Get a controller. It's definitely playable with KB+M but you have so much more control over your car with a gamepad. Remap your buttons. Put air roll and poweslide somewhere you can press them simultaneously with the boost button. The benefit won't show at first but it's going to be hugely helpful once you get better and start to do aerials.
title: Rocket League®

review: In recent patches this game has just gotten worse and worse the September and I think the May or June patch is what ruined it. Laggy servers which have only gotten worse and worse over time and especially the "bug fixes" regarding the collision detection which has now been made way over sensitive.Every time two players even slightly tap each other one or both of them will just go flying away to their home planet. Or when two players hit the ball at roughly the same time they will bounce off of each other 95% of the time. This happened before the recent patches maybe 40% of the time but now it's all the time these collisions seem like they come out of a Blues Brothers movie and it happens all the ****ing time.The amount of times you will just get launched into orbit over every god damn hit is just rage inducing. Couple that with dreadful lag because Psyonix just can't be bothered to have decent servers(because this wan't always a problem when the game first came out it got worse over time) Imagine someone hits the ball and it shoots off in a direction but then the ball changes direction as if the server just got it wrong and goes back and corrects its error which leaves the player completely juked. Or if someone almost hits the ball same deal the ball reacts as if it got hit and you see it happen for a quarter second then the ball teleports to its original course and behaves as if it was never hit because it technically wasn't it's like the Server shows you what would have happened then corrects it.It's maddening to the point where this once incredible game is completely ruined...I wish I could adequately describe the lag and the overly sensitive collision detection but I can't if you feel like wasting 20 of your hard earned dollars you can see for yourself.
title: Rocket League®

review: This might very well be one of the best games I have ever played.I have to say something huge here I am normally a HUGE story game player. I have never truly enjoyed sports games before this one. But Rocket League is incredible.See instead of taking a boring normal premise like "You are a soccer coach now! Direct your team to victory!" You get tossed in as one of the players and told basic controls and how to play and are then told to go play other people. This game is incredibly simple to understand and play but hard to master. It has depth in all the right ways a progressions system that means absolutely nothing but serves as a tracker for how well you are doing customization for your cars but mot importantly depth in the gameplay. There is real strategy that you have to learn in this game that you can't learn by reading guides. You have to get a feel for it and really play to understand how the game works. Because of this it draws you in as a new player and keeps you interested as an experienced player. You want to keep getting better so you keep playing and learning how it all works. Finally getting that first aerial goal (even though it probably sucked and was super lucky) is incredibly gratifying because of the hours of work you put into it. Add to it the new experimental and hoops maps which have been added recently and there is even more to learn explore and play with. Now you can really find a niche in this game that suits you well.I can absolutely recommend this game it's amazing.
title: Rocket League®

review: It involves a car. A ball. And lots of teamwork. Teamwork is a big component in this game. I often play this game with my son and his friends and we have a blast. Which can also be frustrating (with young teenage boys when you just want to get a quick game in) waiting 30min. so they can do all their trades. This is quite a change from other games that I play. It s non stop go. For instance playing PUBG where you can go a whole game not seeing another player only to be shot in the back. We have done some custom matches which can be quite interesting. Changing in game gravity size of the ball amount of boost Guaranteed a few laughs with friends.I do have a few hours of game time but I go to long in between sessions to hone my skills. I haven t gotten the hang of aerial hits. Probably never will sad I do highly recommend this game to just have some fun mostly clean game play with friends.

review: I've got about 140hrs on this PC version but many more hundreds of hours on the PS4 version which is more or less the same. I play the PC version when I'm more casually just playing solo. This game (if you allow it) will give you the full spectrum of emotions frustration anger intense rage self loathing cautious optimism the feeling of being a resplendant golden god conquering the forces of darkness etc. There's the occasional night (this is a game where there are "nights" of it by necessity because you will not want to just play 1 or 2 games when you sit down) where the emotion is simply things are going pretty good I'm content. And it's rocket car soccer.Tip for players wanting to get better on the fundamentals Try out the training modes where they set up situations for you to goal keep or score. They really do teach you to use the full capabilities of the car that might not be obvious just playing at first.

The game has a cosmetic sistem where u can earn hats paints ect... and the best part is u can get really cool ones just for playing the game. Personally im not a dedicated ranked player (i rarely play it) but i can say as a casual game is one of the best out there. A very good game design is that all cars are equal u get 0 advantage if you are using any car that the game gives or one that u can buy in the store. Overall if you are looking for a fun and easy to get into game defenetly recoment and for the price tag u get 101% of your moneys worth.

review: Amazingly addictive game. The "basics" are easy to pick up. Drive at the ball work with your team (the latter one seems to take some people longer than others to develop). It will take you hundreds of hours to actually begin mastering techniques required to be really good at the game. That said you will enjoy every match and every minute while building up your skill (assuming you learn to ignore the trolls and the few jerks who think the game revolves around them winning 24/7). This isn't LoL no need to be nasty keep it friendly and almost everyone else will too.

review: Rocket league...Rocket league...Rocket league...Age E 10+/ Everyone over 10This is the perfect game for gamers it's basically football with cars. You can also do basketball and hockey but this game is a must buy it's EPIC! For parents This is a fun joyful game Excellent for playing with others there is CO OP and online Multiplayer. Players have permission to type or talk with their voice. There aren't that many swearing people on rocket league but if your worried you can easily Mute people and you can change it so you can't hear anybody using there own voice. The game is Football with cars it is way different to EA's FIFA though In my opinion I enjoy this game and would recommend it to 7 years old. I say 7 because for people under the game is way to hard! They might find it boring quickly so it is a good present for a 7 year old I would also recommend it for 10 years old because the game is rated E 10+ Everyone over 10.I hope this helped you choose whether to purchase this or not.Sorry for grammar and spelling issues.Bye!

review: The pros Fluid mechanics movement feels responsive and is easy to get to grips with No difference in difficulty playing with a controller or a mouse Enjoyable with friends had some great laughs even though my mates are imbeciles Well balanced range of skill levels you'll find yourself playing against people about as good as you almost all the time Plenty to learn always some new technique or strategy to try out and master Absolute blast to play no matter what you want out of it competitive or casualThe cons Filthy DLC cars ruining our fun pay to win game please fix thanks guv.

review: Bought this game after only seeing it on twitch here and there didn't know what to expect but that it looked fun. It's a BOAT LOAD OF FUN. It's easy to pick up and play but difficult to master your car because of how the mid air rocket boosting physics work. I've never used a controller at my PC but I'll have to pick one up for this game. The game even tells you it's highly beneficial and at first I was thinking "yeah yeah " but when you play you'll understand.The graphics are crisp sound effects are rewarding and you get cool cosmetics and different cars almost every match you play so there's always something new. They don't shove microtransactions in your face whatsoever either.I'm only about 3 hours in but already I'm glad I added this game to my collection. I've never really played sports games but this was the best way to do it. If you're looking for something new grab it now.
title: Rocket League®

review: Highly recommended game. The learning curve is so smooth and enjoyable on all parts. You start off barely able to hit the ball and progressively work your way to flying through the air to land a ball. For anyone who wants to become an advanced player there are metagame tactics involved but these don't become necessary until you've mastered all the basics. Overall a great game for casual and competitive play.

review: Started playing Rocket League after being recommended to me by a friend on launch day 2015. Since then I've moved from PS4 to steam. This game has the best fun per dollar ratio ever. Updates are free and occur regularly gameplay is fun quick and addictive. Five minute sessions are long enough to feel complete and quick enough to hook you into an all nighter playing over and over. Ths game is my go to when I want to relax or play competitively. Very much worth the purchase for you or a friend. People who care about people tell other people about Rocket League
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is an example where a simple absurd idea is so strong and so engaging that it doesn t need a ton of extra features around it. The rush of ripping across the pitch at full turbo to deny a shot on goal with a clutch bicycle kick is enough to bring me back time and time again for just one more match even without meaningful progression systems. Rocket League is a great goofy easy to learn and difficult to master action sports game which demands that you grab a few friends and play a few rounds.

review: I recommend it because you will have A LOT of fun in your first 200 hours playtime. And which game offers so many hours of fun for about 20 Euro/Dollar?It's all about the matchmakingIn normal games we always have to play against high tier players which have played like 1200+ hours and can hit the ball from any position perfectly. With an experience of about 500 hours (Legend Rank) it is truly possible to win for me and my mate but we have to play perfect as well. There is a BIG difference in skil between Legend Level 60 and Legend 69. The difference is about another 500 hours of playtime.We just can not believe that it became so rare to face players on the same level of experince as well as playing versus players below that level.I mean it is not such a big deal but should be definitely improved.Pro MatchmakingWe play a lot of ranked games in the All Star region (2vs2). In most cases we have to play good games versus players with the same experience. Contra MatchmakingNow I played Standard (3vs3) without a mate and won all 10 placement matches. I met Rookie players and many Semi Pro's there why? I get ranked into Prospect 3 D2 after winning all 10 placements. This makes no sense to me.In 2vs2 we were promoted to into Challenger 3 after also winning all 10 placement matches.That means I meet many beginners on Prospect in my own team as well as on the other side. And that in turn means I can not get a good winstreak to climb fast. Because I can not carry all the games where I get really bad players on my side.But I see this as a challange too. By time you forget how to play versus people who don't hit the easiest balls.tl dr What I want to say at all is that Psyonix should try to focus the matchmaking for placement matches and Normal games more on playtime or Level than on whatever they use now lol.Thanks for the game Psyonix and keep you great work going. Your Free and paid DLCs are always great!
title: Rocket League®

review: Pros Fun Fast paced at times Ranked play CustomizationCons Unfair matchmaking Unbalanced matches Lag even in nearby servers Match aborting bans Essential movements tedious to do on keyboard and when you done they disappoint Controller's basically a mustThis game was fun for a while and the tutorials were pretty good. But the specific tutorials such as the All Star Goalie I found were nearly impossible to complete and no tips were given on how to do them other than block goals. I got in a Ranked Doubles match. I'm a Novice and was paired against a Novice and a Semi pro. A second or so into the match my partner leaves leaving me defenseless and giving the opposing players a free win. There was no possible way of me coming back and the fact that someone of higher skill level was on the other team made it even harder. If you don't have a controller you might as well give up your hopes of being All Star rank. Other than that pretty good game.

review: After 10 hours I'm ready to review. I don't play sports or racing games. From watching gameplay vids it looked like something that would be simple to play hard to master and I was right. My favorite part of this game is how casual it is. You don't spend hours in a lobby choosing levels etc. The matchmaker works fine in about 30 seconds. Also games only last about 6 7 minutes so you don't need a huge time commitment to play.Leavers can be a problem and they definitely need to add some type of penalty for leaving matches early. The other area for improvement is all levels look different but play the same. I'd add some death traps or obstacles that make you jump higher or snare you for a second..to give the game some variety since there really arent any weapons or anything other than just driving and jumping around.I'd recommend this game for players of all ages..go get it now!
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League one of the best if not THE best game on steam at the moment for only 15 you have a game with endless hours of play. Every match is different and unique to the last as you and your firends fly around the arena hitting bicycle kicks into the back of the net. This game is a gem and is perfect in every way from customizability to chaos mode. This game is definitley worth picking up and trying out I would recommend a friend and a controller at all times (Splitscreen Co op is compatible) 10/10

review: Edit Changed to recommended because they fixed their game crashes and while it still lags a bit sometimes it is a major improvement.Get ready to be angrier at your teammates then the other team. The games come rapid fire and are almost always a lot of fun. The 13yo making sex noises on his mic every 10 games or so is annoying and to my knowledge there is no way to mute individual players but the games come and go so quick and you can easily find another lobby pretty quickly. The unlocks are all cosmetic which is great there is no grind to unlock better cars. If you have a couple other friends that have the game it can be an insane amount of fun. One of those games that ruins the next day because you are having too much fun to put it down and go to bed.The price tag seems a bit high for what it is but you will quickly forget how much you paid for it once you start playing. Original Review Really Really fun and addictive game. When it works.They weren't ready for all their players though if you can get the game to not crash then you are in for an unplayable lag fest. When they have fixed the constant (2 or 3 times a hour) crashes and increase their server capacity then the game is def worth your money.Because people assumed that i had a crappy computer which was the reason why i was crashing/complaining r9 280x i5 4th gen16gig ram
title: Rocket League®

review: Simple game with a high skill ceiling. I enjoy the fast pace and how quickly each match is. Other games you really have to dedicate a good portion of your time to play. However in Rocket League you can just play a quick match of five minutes whenever you feel like playing. I convinced some of my friends to try Rocket League and they enjoyed it as well and they were hesitant at first because they said it wasn't their type of game. This game is like bumper cars and soccer in one.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League on PC/PS4 is a ton of fun and you really feel great when your playing really good.Rocket League is a rocket powered acrobatic stunt car soccer/Footie game that makes you want to bust out your old hot wheels/Micro Machines cars and play soccer/footie with them. The Ball you play with has a type of billards/geometry physics based kinetic motion to it. You really have to practice your shots in order to be like Paul Newman in The Hustler. It is more exciting than real soccer/Footie!side note It's really funny to see everyone go after the ball and dolphin flip and dolphin dive for the ball. it looks like they're all having a giant dolphin orgy at Sea World. but If I were you just stand back at laugh at them but don't participate in them because you'll look siily.Instead follow these great words In the words of the great hockey player Wayne Gretzky "A good hockey player plays where the puck is. A great hockey player plays where the puck is going to be." This quote is a very great tip not only in hockey but also in Rocket League as well as in soccer/footie in general. You should do best to remember that.
title: Rocket League®

review: Highly addictive fast paced mix of a demolition derby arena and football (the one that involves feet). You have two things going for you rocket power and acrobatics. And whether you play solo or in team your goal is simple score more goals that an enemy does!You may not be as skilled as a pro player not versatile enough but that shouldn't deter you from playing as there's tons of fun to be had.This game has solid mechanics great vivid visuals can be fully controlled with both a gamepad and a keyboard has a lot of customization options both free and payed. It also implements the popular but controversial crate system though here it can be disabled if it bothers you.Non of the DLC are pay to win and game receives regular free updates for more than a year now. The most recent added an immensely fun Rumble game mode that adds power ups in the mix among other things.This one is a definite recommendation.
title: Rocket League®

review: Tl drThe game is great fun the community is pretty bad I've played over 300 hours of this game and it's gone from my favorite game to my least favorite in 3 years.I have over 200 hours on PS4 and hit champion there so I know what I'm alking about. Rocket League remained my favorite game for the past two years but now that I've switched to PC and the community has settled to a more or less consistent range of players I'm kind of sick of it. In regards to competitive mode...2v2 should be renamed to 50/50 (in reference to your chances of finding a viable partner) 3v3 chat is almost always toxic the most popular tactic in 1v1 is to tilt you once you get behind making you play worse and 3v3(solo) is one of the worst ways to play the game. 2v2 has become pretty much standard amd smurfs make the usual runs considerably often. 7 times of 10 your partner will troll if you don't forfeit at 3 46 with a score of 0/2.The community...Half the time you'll run into people that just want to have fun or climb the rnaked ladder and the other half of the time you'll interact with the most insufferable members of the Rocket League playerbase. Death threats verbal abuse mic spamming in game trolling trade scams text spamming you name it. This is pretty exclusive to competitive however just be prepared. Why the community is the way it is...It is possible to report players in Rocket League for all the actions listed above however this rarely has any real bearing on their ability to play the game or not. To my knowledge there aren't any players that have been banned for repeat abuses of the communication systems trolling to cause their teammates to lose or scamming other players out of cosmetics from any in game report. There isn't a leaver buster type system in place that punishes players from leaving competitve games often. The only penalty I've seen is a 15 minute time out for any of the previously mentioned actions. In short there's no midigation for player behaviour and its all over the ladder. The game is good but most people you play with in competitive will be insufferable.
title: Rocket League®

review: Insanely fun. There is a lot of talk about the breakneck physics of this game ... it icludes driving up and around on fences but it is self consistent. The controls with an Xbox Once controller are great. The bot training (exhibition matches) is great for practice but it all comes alive when you play online. Six rocket propelled cars vying for a huge exploding soccer ball is just the most amazing chaos.Upgrades don't change the fundamentals of game play so it's all up to driving and flying skill. Thumbs up!

review: 1 hour in you'll have fun. 10 hours in you're able to hit the ball into the goal. 100 hours in you're convinced you're a god. 300 hours in you realize you suck. This game will be a constant struggle between destroying noobs and getting completely annihilated. On very rare occasions you'll come up against a team that is so evenly matched with yours in every way. These rare games are so much fun to play it doesn't matter who wins. The complex skills that have been derived from such a simple concept are astounding. This game truly takes thousands of hours to master no matter what your skill rank says.

review: Product received for free. Got RL for free with the steam controller preorder. Even if I had to pay for it it's been one of the best games I've ever played definitely worth the $20. They update constantly and you can either play a few matches for 30 mins or binge it for a day straight. Once you get the controls down it's fantastic and highly replayable. A bit frustrating at first when you're getting wrecked by people who know what they're doing and are scoring air goals. Great game!
title: Rocket League®

review: Honestly this is a game i would not have pictured myself playing. I'm not one to play many sports games (i favor the more rpg style) and i don't have an obsession with cars but this game is very good. I first played this at my friend's house and it was great. I went home bought it and still really enjoy it. First of all the graphics are super good. The effects and different textures are very detailed and make playing Rocket League appealing to the eyes. I'm not sure how they look on lower settings but if you play on higher quality you can for sure see that effort was put into graphics not just gameplay. Focusing more on gameplay you'll start off pretty bad but as you progress and learn through the game you'll be pleasently surprised at the many tricks you can do once you learn controls. You can play non human characters train play online matches and even customize your car. To sum it up Rocket League is addictive and something you should definitely try.
title: Rocket League®

review: WOW! WOW! WOW!I bought this game thinking I would treat it like most games I play 10 20 hours of play and then I'd put it back on the digital shelf never to be played again. I was gladly mistaken.I write this review 9 months later with 453 hours on PC and another 150 on PS4 and I have no plans to put this game down. I sat down planning to type out a nice little essay on why you should buy this game but then I realized I'd rather just go play itBut don't just take my word for it. Right now there are over 60 000 positive reviews for this game you can read but honestly you should just save yourself the time and buy it now.
title: Rocket League®

review: So after 1500+ hours I think i'm ready to write a review. I'll just keep it short by saying that this game is simply the best. It takes a long time to master but a very short time to start having fun. The best way to play is with friends. Although you can still have fun alone be prepared for the oh so lovely teammates that think they're the best and spam "What a save!" or the always sarcastic "Nice shot!". But all in all if you've been on the fence about getting this game just get it. Your life will be over.
title: Rocket League®

review: I have played this game on both the PS4 and PC quite a lot. I'm not the best player but I always have fun. The game is easy to learn and hard to master. I have definitely not mastered it yet. I have however enjoyed probably 600+ hours in this game. Considering I got it for free on the PS4 it is an incredible return on my investment. Because I loved a game that I got for free so much I've now bought it several times for friends on both PC and PS4. I can not recommend this game enough.

review: One of the best Multi player games out there.Pros Lack of hating and trolls easy to leave and match and be replaced Easy to earn cars hats trails and flags Great graphics to suit all pc's and laptops Great gameplay that isn't the same every match A good amount of pitches to learn Rank system Points given for saving clearing the ball shooting and assisting as well as scoring Not pay to winCons Ranks are in no way due to skill just that you have played for awhile Points given in a match don't count for holding the ball in the midfield and what counts as an assist could be improved The AL that join if a player leaves untill another joins are crap and tend to steal goalsOverall the other cons are to small to put its a well rounded game that is fun and has a great player base.Well worth you're time and money (once its NOT pay to win).My game of the year for 201510/10
title: Rocket League®

review: Hi so Rocket League is a game that gets you addicted very quickly! It's a hell lot of fun to play when you get the first hang on it. I played almost 200 hours now and im still learning so much things 'bout the game.Also I like the queueing system it's quick and easy! THANK YOU!10/10 would play again! Must buy I think!

review: In short it is an amazing game. I had delayed looking into it for almost a year because I am generally skeptic of highly acclaimed games but when I finally took it and gave it a try I was shockingly impressed. It is ridiculously entertaining and it basically has unlimited replay value. There are things which could be improved of course but all in all I would give it a 9/10. Pros crazy cool concept ridiculously fun easy to jump into good tutorials nice variety of cars high variety of visual customization of cars cross platform split screen option (2 3 or 4 players) great background music.Cons can't change names of other players in split screen unclear car differences (stats) only three solo (offline) season difficulties (easy medium hard) VERY unclear and confusing ranking system some arenas have too many details/flashing lights/colors making it difficult to focus on the ball and opponents.
title: Rocket League®

review: Very addictive and entertaining game. Rocket League is a game that always introduces new aspects to you and never lets you get bored. It is definitely a 'just 5 more minutes' game but amazingly entertaining at the same time. The trading community is excellent and finally getting an item you always wanted can leave you feeling so accomplished. The car customization itself is an awesome feature that offers so many different customizations. As you progress through the different skill levels there are new techniques to learn and playstyles which are awesome to know. The competitive scene behind this game is getting larger and it is so fun to watch such high level players play!All in all i'd completely recommend this game to anyone whether you're a casual player or very competitive!

review: What can be said about Rocket League that hasn't been said already by tens of thousands of people all over the world? Rocket League is a flashy soccer style game with rocket cars that is fast paced technically challenging and psychologically emotionally and maybe even physically rewarding games out there. The competetive scene is active and involved with few seasons under it's belt at the time of this writing. This game seems to fulfill everything that I personally look for in a video game and it serves it up like hot lunch every time I play it. Rocket League is the best game that I ever took a chance on buying without knowing anything about it. Period.

review: I find the game fun and to be something along the lines of a power trip you get to play sports like football/soccer and basketball with cars and those cars have rockets attached to them propelling them in the air. That sounds like a macho fantasy I had once after playing flatout 2 and watching the car football/soccer episode of top gear and now it's a game. I was full chub... oh right the review.THE GOOD Controls are good I mean really good to the point of being able to play decently (after a decent amount of practise) with the keyboard and mouse. I played it with a controller though as it feels more natural to steer the various cars. Cars. There are many of them and the only advantage each car offers is how they look for example a can will hit the ball differently than a wedge shaped sports car there's also customisation. Not need for speed carbon levels but you can change the wheels the many vanity items on the roof of your car primary and secondary colours and the wraps for each car so not so bad. Theres voice chat. Simple to learn game yet hard to master game controls.THE BAD This might just be me but whenever I got in a game while running a voice chatting app (skype discord or even curse) it would shoot my ping to wayyy over 200 commonly reaching 500? Basically unplayable levels. The A.I is pretty bad.OVERALLThe game is quite fun with various elements to keep it fresh but if you're playing it do so with a friend because it's much more fun to be able to blame someone you know because they missed the ball and let the other team score a point.
title: Rocket League®

review: This is probably one fo the most unique and fun games I have ever played. I play this game almost every day and have quickly racked up a good amount of hours. To put that into perspective I have almost as much hours here than I do on Fallout 4 which I must admit isnt alot compared to others but still. I love this game and recommend it but it certainly isnt perfect. Pros. Nothing else like it Can be played for fun and goof off or be played seriously and you can actually win with either playstyle depending on how bad your opponents are Not a toxic community in the chat Fun customization of your cars You can clearly tell someones skill in this game and you can not hard carry a game as easily as in other games. You really do need teamwork. Crossplay with PS4. Not alot of games have crossplay.Cons Theres no report system. Theres not alot to report since the the community is not toxic but Ive played a couple ranked games where I've had teammates who drove in circles the entire game and when the ball gets close to our own goal they purposefuly hit in. Ive lost quite a bit of ranked points because of this. Keyboard controls suck. Controler is mandatory.

title: Rocket League®

review: The game itself is pretty fun and challenging. It was a brilliant idea for a new game. However there are many issues that need to be resolved by Psyonix.1. There is a significant number of people in the community that are toxic as hell. Spamming "What a save!" and "Great shot!" gets very irritating especially when they are more often used to mock teamates than they are to actually be sincere. The number of people going AFK or quitting mid match is ridiculous. I was suprised to see that there isn't any way to report these players. Not a pleasant experience. In the end the game ends up being more aggravating than it is fun.2. Even with a ping of &lt 60 I have experienced lots of rubberbanding and lag. There seems to be no real reason for that.Both of these issues come from the developer Psyonix. I have played another online multiplayer game developed by them (Nosgoth) and it has the same issues. There is no way to report terrible teamates and server issues are rampant. I tried to start playing Rocket League again recently but quickly was reminded why I stopped playing in the first place. Good game/ bad server issues/ toxic community.I won't be playing again until I hear that they have made some improvements.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League looked sort of intriguing to me so I tried it. It's a simple idea it's basically just soccer with cars. Oh but you can also fly and double jump in any direction! Basically it's the coolest game and is currently my favorite to play right now.My favorite things are 1) it has a bots mode (seems like so few games do nowadays)2) the developer's seem really intelligent about doing dlc for example when they made a new map they gave it to all players for free which avoided separating their player base. But they do offer really cool dlc but it doesn't ruin it for those who don't buy it3) it's not just hitting a ball with a car. You can boost. You can boost up in the air and get the ball before everyone else getting a huge advantage! you can double jump and do a flip into the ball in any direction which adds for an immense amount of skill. Basically what I'm saying is that there are a lot of techniques to being good which makes it very fun to play.4) the sky is the limit for how good you can be (well more like the ceiling is the limit)5) it's freaking car soccer!!!!!There isn't really anything I don't like and nothing big I would suggest they fix. Certainly the more they add to the game the cooler it'll be but I am guessing the developers will keep doing just that anyway.

review: Rocket League is definitley the best Esports/Competitive game in my oppinion. This is because Rocket League is the most similar to real life sports and is more accesible for everyone. The game is easy to learn so anyone can enjoy but very difficult to master. The simiarities to soccer and the crazy unpredictable physics engine make the game almost as fun to watch as it is to play. Watching the RLCS is especially enjoyable as seeing crazy pro players pull off epic tricks is quite entertaining. If you're interested in a competitive sports game Rocket League should be your first choice. Its not a simulator like FIFA and there aren't as many try hards as in other competitive games. Rocket League is an awesome unique sports game that can be easygoing or very competitive. Its a great choice for anybody.

review: I made a review about this game when it first came out and its too good of a game to let that sit there (also I got a better computer) so let's change that.This game is a game that makes you think "what a simple concept! This should provide a few hours of fun!" That's where your wrong it's a game with an extrodinarily high skill cap it's easy to play very hard to master. It is constantly updated with things like new crates and maps that get you to come back. But I warn you now this game will introduce you to some very nice people in one match then turn that on its head and the next match you meet the most toxic player you have ever faced satisfying to beat? Yes. But the game with how much I love it has created a community that I sometimes hate to meet new people within it. Granted thats monsly on ranked but they sometimes find their way into free play.All that being said the toxic community can't keep me away from wanting to master all the moves and become the best Rocket League player. But you may be saying "well this doesn't sound like a game for me! I can't do all those flips and rocket jumps I would never be able to do it!" Well you person undermining yourself first I say get some confidence in your abilities second I say you will get better just practice and the skill will come and third I say fine then there is a whole other side to this game! The trading aspect learn the market buy and sell your way to virtual riches in the form of colored cars and keys. Trade for the best looking items. This game has a lot of things people will like but if it doesn't sound fun yet then fine. You can leave just know your missing out )
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is one of those rare titles that embodies everything a video game should be. Do you value gameplay? Rocket League's mechanics are tight enjoyable easy to pick up and difficult to master. You like pretty graphics? Check. You want customization? Deck out your car however you like with a smorgasbord of options. You want an enjoyable offline single player experience? Check out the season mode. Just want to relax and play a pickup game at your place with a few friends? Jump into a split screen exhibition match. Prefer online multiplayer? Then the real question is how many teammates do you want and do you want a casual or competitive experience? Want to watch replays of your best moments? Done. Like having new arenas and modes added to a game over time? They're free. Have just one friend around and want to play online against others? You can. Have friends who own the game on other systems and want to play against them? It is possible. Okay with DLC but feel it should not be a gamechanger? All paid DLC is cosmetic. Dream of playing this game as famous cars like the Delorean from Back to the Future or the Batmobile? That option is here (for a price). Enjoy a catchy soundtrack? You are in for a treat. Want to play hockey or basketball with the same formula? Wish granted. User generated arenas? Curated ones are already here and more are on the way through Steam Workshop integration. Consistent updates? In spades. What more could you reasonably ask for?That is not to say Rocket League has zero flaws. The cosmetic DLC has consistently become less and less of a good value (2 new cars and extras used to be only $3.99 now you only get one car with fewer extras for $1.99 or get a random item for $1.50) and the cross system play is sadly limited only to private matches (no party system) but these are minor quibbles in the face of an incredibly strong base package.So should you buy Rocket League? Well do you like sports? Buy it. Are you (like me) disinterested in sports? Buy it. Do you like having fun? Buy it. In short if you like video games this game is for you.
title: Rocket League®

review: Easy to pick up very hard to master that's what I can figure out of Rocket League so far in the meager time I've played it for. I will update this review as I play it for longer.Basically it's some Sci Fi Futuristic form of soccer where you play with cars instead of people. It has quite the learning curve and it takes a lot of practice to be even decent. This game is INCREDIBLY unique and barely any other game will transfer its skills to this game. You will very likely start in the lowest rank in the game when you first start (Bronze 1) and will suck at that too. Contrary to CS GO where you probably wont start in Silver 1 unless your aim is garbage you are pretty much guaranteed to start in Bronze 1 in this game. There's a lot of new concepts to learn in this game that no other game can transfer their skills to at least in my experience. It's fun there's a lot of things to learn it's new I love it. People usually aren't too competitive in my experience however there has been 1 that told me to uninstall the game after I missed a goal. You likely won't be able to do ANYTHING until you have 50 100 hours in this game you will just be horrible.Overall it's a satisfying game when you're good and hitting a goal just feels so satisfying a lot more satisfying than say a kill in CS GO. It's fun it's good I recommend it.
title: Rocket League®

review: I had been eyeing Rocket League for quite some time. Seeing YouTubers play was quite fun. When the Steam Winter Sale 2015 hit I decided I'd give it a whirl for $12.99. Now I can confirm that it is indeed worth it's full retail price! I dove into this game thinking it'd be much easier than it is but was hit with a wall of difficulty. The ball's physics will play tricks on you left and right leaving you wondering how you missed the ball or how the ball went in that direction. I am constantly being frustrated with the ball not doing what I was expecting it to do or not going the direction I hit it in.On top of the frustrating ball physics when playing with teammates it can also be very irritating as they will run into you left and right while you're trying to shoot for the goal. Playing with friends does not refrain from this happening and it's even worse as you have the ability to verbally abuse them over voice chat. You will constantly see yourself going for the perfect goal for someone to hit the ball into the corner of the field for the sake of touching the ball.The controls in Rocket League aren't the best with keyboard and mouse but they aren't the worst. Fiddle with them a bit for them to suit your needs and you'll be golden. I constantly found myself boosting instead of jumping however nor did I find it easy to control my car when going aerial no matter what I did. So I gave up trying with my keyboard and mouse and play mainly with my Xbox 360 controller (Xbox One controller also supported). Splitscreen play and PlayStation to PC crossplay is awesome and leads to the game always having matches. I wish more games were to do this rather than splitting communities of games apart. I love to play splitscreen with my girlfriend while playing with my buddies online and going up against other PS4/PC players online. Sadly the only issue with splitscreen on PC is you MUST have two controllers not a controller and a mouse and keyboard. Luckily my family owns several PlayStation 4's so I could use a DualShock 4 controller with some drivers. Since the game already utilizes the DS4 on PlayStation the buttons even show up as the proper cross circle triangle and square which I found awesome.Despite the many issues I have whilst playing Rocket League I still played 20 hours fairly quickly and never once got bored. Getting epic goals will make you scream and shout and make you feel accomplished every single time and it's an awesome feeling no matter how many you score a game. The rounds are short and sweet coming in at only 5 minutes and you find games instantly whether you play 1v1 2v2 3v3 or 4v4. This is a must own game for any Steam user and I highly recommend it especially if you have a friend or two to play with whether it be online or in the real world sitting on your couch.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is well worth your money. It's a refreshing entry in the virtual sports genre and one that doesn't take itself too seriously. The basics of the game (double jumps boosts) are easy to get the hang of. Don't want to embarass yourself online? Start a single player campaign or just revisit the tutorial to hone your skills. Plus you can just jump online play a five minute match and get out. Great for when you have an hour or two to kill. The servers were a bit laggy after launch but this has been largely resolved. When it comes to multinational servers there are always improvements to be made but Rocket League has tidied itself up quite nicely. The online ranking system could have been deeper but it gets the job done. After a while it becomes addicting to see your ranking points increase or decrease after every match urging you to play another quick game to compensate for that one loss or keep the winning streak going.In short Rocket League is a nice little game with a simple and fun formula but also a game that gives you all the tools to develop your own playing style. Not one match you play will ever be the same. Grab a couple friends and start playing right now.
