review: UPDATE 2017 After some certain update the game is totally unplayable and lags and rubber banding everywhere and the developer doesnt seem to give a damn about it so will give it a "No" for now until they fix itThis is my edited (official) review of Rocket League after playing it 144 hours I believe I will be able to give it a proper review.Gameplay The gameplay is beautiful kinda of tricky for keyboard but you can get the hang of it soon enough if you plan to purchase the game it is recommened to have a controller for easier gameplay.Some of the key bindings for keyboard are wierd (at least to me) and you might need to rebind to be comfortable and be able to play it more smoothly with keyboard and mouse.The gameplay is so much fun especially when you go against or with your friends and work out a plan and so on.Graphics &amp Art Design The art is not realistic nor too cartoony it has this feeling of warm and nice design to it that fits it everything goes together very well.It has very nice sharp colors and lines making it easy for you to see and notice stuff off the batIt has many colors to use and beautiful arena colors as well as nice addons of colors and textures for you to add to your own car and customize it.Music &amp Sound Rocket League has a very uplifting music with lyrics most of the time it is great and I recommend purchasing the soundtrack if you like it.There aren't that many songs in the playlist and it will eventaully get looped but you can always open your own music and listen to it while playing the game.And the game shows how much the developers have spent detail into making the sound effects and such as you have uniqe sounds for everything single thing and it isnt looped from hitting the ball to the trails and many more.Community Rocket League's community is very helpful most of the time. If you have an issue with the game you can post it on the steam discussion and mostly get a fast answer either by the moderators or players on how to fix it.Even in game the community is very nice there aren't much rage quiters (to my knowladge) and most of them are very good sport when losing and so on.Cash Shop The cash shop for rocket league is very simple and reasonable the prices for the DLC's for the game go from $0 $5 and the developers give amazing things in the DLC for the price and all of them are cosmetic and doesnt effect the gameplay at all.Suggestions I would love to see a in game mini map where you can tell where the ball/your team mates are to help keep track of them.Would love to see more maps with different aspects in it as bumps and jumps and so on.It will be great to have a export system or editor system for the replay saves to make some cool videos from it.It will look way better if the colors for online teams acted the same as season mode and had more colors and the goal area changed color depending on the team color.I would like to see some love to keyboard and mouse gameplay to make it easier and such.Is the game worth to buy for the price? Yes and if you do make sure to get the DLC just for being awesome the game is 100% fun and easy to play with friends and family. I myself cant wait to see more updates to the game.DISCLAIMER This is my own opinion on the game and review you might think differently about it.Thank you.
title: Rocket League®

review: I got this game years ago when i was once a normal boy. As soon as i spent my first dollar i felt my chromosomes draining away as I opened crate after crate rare decal after rare decal. After my first 1 cases I took a selfie and made it my steam profile picture and facebook profile picture to. I thought I was the king of the world after i got this rare decal until I decided to trade it for the first time. This guy added me and I asked if i could have his white wheels and he replied "MY WHITE ZOMBAS FOR YOUR OCTANE BUZZ KILL ARE YOU !" I awnsered with a truthful response of "P(SDUGB SFPEDBPFGP. yes." He left the game and I cried while eating ice cream. After about 184789 ice cream buckets later I played my first competitive and my team was yelling into the mic so much that I lost all of the chromosomes that remained inside of me. My next game I remembered that my dad used to abuse me as a child and shove his longest popsicles he could find down my throat until I passed out. When I woke up there would be warm coconut juice all over my chest. Oh yea I forgot i was writing a review... This game mek me shart pants good

review: Beginners review (3hours). Rocket League really manages to deliver moments of fist pumping celebration I haven't seen in many other titles I play. I was never into football (soccer) but had enjoyed that element of Fifa (local MP) on the odd occasion too. Fifa never felt right but the addition of customisable cars with rockets strapped to them actually makes all the difference. Low cost quick rounds and heaps of fun and that's just on matchmaking (looking forward to teaming up with friends too)
title: Rocket League®

review: You get a new customization item after every match no matter how awful you are. I feel satisfied every match.
title: Rocket League®

review: This game is... amazing. I've logged upwards of eleventy thousand hours so far still suck and still enjoy every game.Pros Super high skill cap while still being fun while you learn. Once you're good the level of strategy and skill is off the charts and you feel like a superhero. Just plain FUN. Very visceral feeling to the game especially when scoring goals. Matchmaking is decent primarily in ranked games. You'll see the occasional smurf at low levels but for the most part everyone sucks as badly as you as you learn making it fun. Lots of cars to pick from with slightly different (though hidden) stats. Lots of visual customizability. Very pretty. Cons Hard as hell. Still super fun but you'll spend your first several hours unable to even hit the ball where you want to. Push through it. So worth it. A few trolls here and there but hey... this is the interwebs. Tips Do the tutorials! Trust me. If you don't you'll spend a ton of hours never even considering what you can do.
title: Rocket League®

review: I've dabbled in this game a bit. It's kinda fun.Update From what I've seen in my years of playing this game is if you spend money on lootboxes its gonna make you very salty. If you use the trade network to get what you want thats another story. My thought? I think the chance for a good roll on a crate is very slim in my experience. I think it's programmed that way. If its not then devs if you see this prove me wrong. Like I said I've been playing since year one. 70 plus crates in my inventory. Good game though if you never spend money other than the entry fee. But to the game though If you are a noob prepare for a little hate on your skills but survive through it gets better. Controls are tight. Graphics are basic but efficient. Music soundtrack is crazy good. Bottom line is buy it. Best "holy I only have 7 minutes to game before work" that you'll ever have.

review: Community is utterly bad. They rage at anyone who makes a single mistake because they seemingly find it funny. In every 5th game there is always this one troll who destroys the whole gameplay. But guess what you get the loss for the game. And don't even believe that reporting anyone will ever result in anything. The worst thing is basically that there is no "leavebuster" which means you can play forever on without you being punished for leaving a game just for fun. The Devs are protecting their decisions on not implementing something like this by that the house could be on fire of such a player and so can not be punished for leaving a game... They seemingly forgot that the team mate is always punished only because his mate leaves...

review: WARNING Rocket League contains the following...Censorship of words and it's automatic with threat of a permanent ban. They won't tell you what words. It's fully possible for anyone to mute you and opponents can choose to have you muted by default so there is no good reason for such censorship. A manual review may also ban you for 'poor language ' although this is also never specified.Welcome to the future.Aside from that it's truly a great game and the most consistently enjoyable multiplayer competition I've experienced.

review: Absolutly Love this game! It reminds me of FIFA and Need For Speed combined into one game with my love for cars when I was in my mid teens and soccer which I still love to play. review: OVERALL 9.5/10Psyonix has really done something amazing here creating a unique title that looks and plays great with nearly unlimited replay ability. I can say with the utmost confidence that the number one game that is preventing me from really working toward my goals with this website is the fact that I can not stop playing Rocket League. I can easily admit that I am absolutely obsessed with this game and it comes to my surprise while writing this that I would easily rank it in my top ten favorite games of all time brushing shoulders with the likes of Final Fantasy 7 and The Last of Us. While the idea of the game might come across as a bid odd to some people it is something that once you experience it you will see how great it is. And with such insignificant issues to complain amount the developers commitment to bringing massive levels of content very consistently shows a real love for the baby they have created. Job well done Psyonix Rocket League deserves all of the praise it can get.Link to full review http //www.violentcolor.com/reviewcontent/2016/6/21/rocket league

review: I'll be honest I wasn't expecting this game to live up to the hype. Of course I never buy into hype so I can't be disappointed if a game sucks (*cough* No Man's Sky *cough*) but I'm still pleasantly surprised whenever a game manages to be good and live up to what everyone is saying about it.I like to describe the gameplay of Rocket League to my friends who haven't heard of it like this "Start with soccer put the field in a cage make the balls bigger and floatier and replace the people with 3v3 teams of RC cars that can jump around and fly through the air." If that description doesn't get them curious I can tell that they probably wouldn't be interested in trying it out. If that description piqued your curiousity you owe it to yourself to at least try this one out.There's not really much I can say about the gameplay other than the fact that advanced moves like hitting the ball in mid air are extremely difficult to pull off but extremely satisfying the first time you do. I'm still a novice but I'm at least good enough that I occasionally yell at the "Pro" level bots for doing something really stupid. That's not because their programming is horrible but because they're just dumb enough that I find myself thinking I'm smarter than them. There's an offline singleplayer "season" mode along with split screen and online multiplayer but no matter how you play the game itself is going to be pretty similar across all modes unless you vary the player's skill level.(Side note If I ever get enough people to buy into the idea I want to hold a version of the singleplayer season entirely with human teams.)Where this game really shines is in those game changing moments. They don't happen every game but when they do happen they stick in your head for the next few matches and make you feel very confident if you're the one who did it. If you can follow the action of an average game I reccommend watching some plays from the Rocket League Championship Series or RLCS. There are so many game changing moments in those matches it's frankly amazing. You might also learn a trick or two you can adapt into your playstyle.I have only two complaints about this game First some of the achievements depend on you owning DLC cars but achievements tied to DLC seems standard enough that I can't really call Rocket League in particular out for it. Second you can't sell the crates and keys on the Steam Marketplace. I understand not selling the keys but some of us don't have the money for microtransactions so if we get a crate it'll just sit there unused. I say we should be able to at least sell the crates on the Marketplace but neither of these complaints are enough to not reccommend the game.If you enjoy fast paced action support indie developers want to master a game's more difficult tactics to get an edge or just need a party game for you and your buddies to play (split screen or online) this game is definetly worth your time.

review: EDIT Late 2017 still my favourite game! It becomes better and better...This game took me so much of my free time but brought me so much fun in exchange. I played tons of hours alone but also with randoms and friends. I admit I'm a huge fanboy but that's because this game brings all that I want from a sports like game. It has online multiplayer with competitive and fun modes single player agains KI to practise some stuff and of course tons of content to unlock.The cars all have different hitboxes but none of them is overpowered so the balance is very great. BUT the cars all have their own charme and possibilities. Long vehicles for example are super great for freestyle flights on the other side thick vehicles like the bang bus are great for pressing and playing as a goalie.Online competitive is fun and well managed but sometimes the rank system can be a bit demotivating. It just feels like win 1 match &gt nothing lose 1 match &gt demotion at least most of the time. But if you own the skill you will also have your positive moments. Soundtrack is also nice. The community is mostly fair and funny but there are more and more hater/flamer kiddies playing Rocket League (feel free to ignore/report/ban them ) ).My last words go to the devs You guys created such a great successor of SARPBC and it landed on all three big gaming platforms. Also I think that you pushed the game industry into the right direction when it comes cross network play. In addition the monthly updates bring a lot of content. Very often I thought RL is so full of features it can't get any greater. But then you smash out things like the Rumble mode or the upcoming training mode or Steam Workshop support. The DLCs became a little more expensive over time but you know what? If you keep on maintaining RL like that I enjoy paying you for that and that IS indeed a rare occasion! Love you Psyonix &lt 3

In Rocket League you get behind the wheel of one of a number of different cars and face off against up to 4 opponents in an effort to hit a giant football in to the opposing team's goal. review: This is probably the best sports game ever made and the only one an antisocial gamer like myself will ever like. It is 100% worth it's price tag.Pros ITS REALLY FUN tight controls for skill based gameplay epic car customization good enough ai (That's about as good as it gets with AI) a great game to play with friends the atmospheres and playing fields of the different maps have a ton of fun variety cool mutator settings to mess around with like low gravity I can have a Roosterteeth flagCons though it's necessary for the game's balance the turn radius will drive you insane as your drive circles around the ball missing it repeatedly not as much fun without some friends to play withIdeas/Suggestions I don't really have any! The game's pretty much perfect as is. If I were to ask for anything from the developers it would be more! More maps more modes more car customization options all of it. There's no lack of these things in the game but that doesn't change me from wanting more of it! However the game does have dlc so if you really want more than you can purchase the dlc.10/10.

review: One of my personal favorites. The physics are good (generally) the visuals are exactly as good as they need to be. The gameplay is phenomenal. You don't have to commit to an hour long gameplay session but you will often find yourself spending that much time and more in a single sitting.There is somewhat of a steep learning curve but as you advance through the ranks you'll always find new moves to learn new tactics to employ and become all around better at controlling your little rocket car.Extremely frustrating and at times enormously satisfing at others. No other game gets my heart racing like a close fast paced game of rocket league. Buy it now!

I played during the free weekend and I would recommend the game twice if I could it is INSANELY fun with friends once you all master the controls (2 3 days)!There are PLENTY of game modes so you will need some time to get bored (I've spent 3 days playing only soccar).The voice chat (F) makes it 10x more ridiculous (along with chat trolls of course).Graphics wise it looks amazing on high.There are A LOT of customisation options in game some of which ARE paid but there is PLENTY of microtransaction free content.The servers were a tiny tad unstable but I'm assuming that was because I played during the free weekend PIt sems to be able to run on the most rusty of tin cans like my PC on low settings even I never go above 70% usage on my gpu with these settings.Price wise it's a bit expensive for a game like this but this is steam...GET IT ON SALEOverall it feels more than polished! )SO Insanely fun gameplay + decently low price + friends + LOADS of customisation options + soft on your rig GET IT NOW CUZ THE DURN DEAL GONNA END10 / 10

title: Rocket League®

review: Psyonix's magnum opus Rocket League is one of the most fun games I've had the joy to play. The master of fast paced addictive gameplay the 5 minute matches keep you playing into the early hours of the morning and never failing to keep the action above 60mph! The vertical flexability that the openness of a Rocket League pitch offers is incredible boasting a Cirque de liberté for you to perform all sorts of zany twists and turns in mid air it's remarkable to see glorious goals and superb saves made by some of the insanely talented players. One can better their Rocket League play naturally by simply enjoying the game however the more difficult tricks like airials freestyles dribbling and perfect positioning take some serious skill and precision and are a sight to see in competitive play. The game's perfectly playable with either a controller or mouse 'n' keyboard so it's up to you to decide how you play. The customisation is great fine tuning your Rocket Powered Battle Car is fantastic and the options are near endless offering plenty of choice. However there is microtransactions. But these are implemented in one of the best ways I've seen in any game they're not intrusive or necessary for victory AT ALL they're simply cosmetic. The free Rumble gamemode is serious fun and it's nice to see the devs frequently adding new features and stadiums to one of the most fun games of 2015. I don't care too much for either cars or football but I adore Rocket League. Totally worth its full price and it's a steal on sale highly recommended.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is undoubtedly my #1 hidden gem of 2015.First off let's talk gameplay. It's fun. Really fun. The incredibly simple physics based gameplay makes the game approachable to everyone since holding down the boost button and going straight for the ball is certainly an acceptable early game strategy. But as you progress in the game you begin to develop tactics and timing and you're more capable of controlling your car and making it do what you want. Basically what I'm saying is that this game is fun and the gradual progression of you as a player makes the game pretty damn addicting as well. I don't know how many times I've said to myself "I'll just play one more game" only to find myself still sitting in front of my monitor an hour or two later.Besides the tight gameplay and controls this game has a hell of a community. I've made more friends playing this game for a week than I've made in the past 3 years on steam with 100+ games. The only relatable experience for me is back in the golden days of Halo 3 where randoms would invite you to custom matches and you'd spend hours goofing off with people you barely knew. It truly represents the best part of gaming just being able to have fun with friends and strangers alike.If you think you have any interest in this game at all I'd recommend dropping the $20 and getting Rocket League. Truly a unique gaming experience that I haven't had in quite a long time.
title: Rocket League®

review: Product received for free. In this game you can toss a ball shaped bomb designed by Michael Baywith rocket accelerated R/C Hot Wheel toy cars. If it isn't something the what is?One of the best games I've ever played with. This game needs skills and reflexes. And a good team. If you play it with friends then it can entertain you for hours. Per day. Because you will never get rid of that game anymore you will want to play it every single day because it gives you adrenaline doesn't disappoint you even if you loose and you will always find some spare time to play with it. Matchmaking is lightning fast I found the rounds a bit short (5 minutes) but it just matter of taste I guess there was a good reason behind it. PS4 crossplay is an awesome thing it's a really rare thing in the game industry nowadays and I just simply don't get it why. It could be a bit better though you can't create a party with your PS4 friend due to the fact PlayStation has no Steam and PC can't join to PlayStation Network. But private matches works fine which is nice. DLCs are only cosmetic doesn't kill the balance I bought all of them because I got the game itself for free as a gift from my friend and the 20 I planned to spend on it was already on my Steam Account ( P). Music DLC doesn't worth to buy. I didn't like the default keybinds if you already played any racing games you will find it confusing as well I guarantee it. But you can get used to the default one as well I just rebinded them 'cause I'm an NFS idiot don't mind me. If you see this thing on discount don't miss it buy it immediately. But if you decide to buy it for 20 it still worths it.
title: Rocket League®

review: Today Priscilla and I stopped by some local newspapers as we drove through Alabama. One editor I met with was an elderly man in a tattered suit. I said to him "You look like you need some money old timer. I'll pay you 10 thousand dollars to eat one of those newspapers." He had a good laugh at that."Why are you laughing?" I continued. "Eat the paper. Eat it or I swear to god I'll buy your newspaper and turn it into an anime fanzine. If you don't start munching on that sport section right now you'll be writing articles about Naruto till you're cold in the grave. I'm a billionaire you think anyone will stop me?"It took him 42 minutes to eat that paper. For 42 minutes I had total power over that man. I'd never felt more alive. I bet that's what being president feels like.

review: Edit 9 12 17 If there was an option to give a neutral review I would give it.However as the game progresses more and more content is being locked behind loot boxes.and there really is no excuse for lootboxes (especially when there is no way of unlocking them without paying money.)It's a good game at it's core however it is now being milked untill it's dry by its devoloper.Edit ugh.....with the aqua update psyonix once again give loads of free stuff as a result im changing my review to positive while I still hate the crate system the rest of the game is still worth playing. end of edit I love this game to bits great fun with friends or on your own however Plans are to add a new micro transaction system wich besides being totally unnecisary is not "micro" at all it's most expensive option will cost you the same as the game and you'll only get a bunch of items from them.Micro transactions are never justifiable especially this TF2/CS go micro transaction system wich is the worst of the worst.TL DR very fun game but if you plan on getting all the items beware soon you will have to pay hundreds of euro's (or your regional equivalent) to do so.

review: This is a team game. A fast game. Easy to learn hard to master.This is a great game.If you're into a unique team based fast paced game of sports you've come to the right place. Rocket League offers a range of game modes from standard 3v3 to basket ball to absolute chaos. There's the calm side of the game with the huge trading platforms.There's the creator's side with the car presets and training pack creation.There's excitement suspension and exploding happiness when you finally net the sickest shot ever in an overtime.Playing this game makes me feel like I'm watching the finals of Champions League and my team winning. +beautiful game+nice physics+great range of activities+fun to play+workshop activity supported servers are sometimes ranking system could use a fix up

review: As you can see I've put 50 hours into Rocket League so far. When I say 'so far' I really mean that because this game can be a lot of fun. For the most part I play with a friend of mine IRL he will come to my house and we are able to play the game splitscreen and online. I'm very happy with this feature. It's hard to find games for me to play with a friend on my PC and when we do it's usually an indy game without a lot of content or a game that's been badly ported. Having something to play online means many hours of play as opposed to however many it takes to finish the campaign of most other games.As for the game itself think of it this way what makes both racing and soccer more fun? Rockets.And maybe a hockey puck.
title: Rocket League®

review: Pretty simple formula here you and your teammates hit a ball across the field with RC cars and try to score more points than your opponents.You can fill up your meter and boost your car to very high speeds to hit the ball further and blow up other cars by crashing into them.That's the whole game.But ROCKET LEAGUE's simplicity is its genius. With tight controls colourful graphics awesome sense of speed &amp impact and solid car customization this arcade sports game is incredibly easy to get into and will have you feeling very pumped.Highly recommend this for you and your friends

review: Great fun on your own or with friends. I have only experienced 2 issues with this game so far The server disconnecting every single player in the competitive lobby all at once and giving each of us a cooldown for 'leaving the game' despite us having no choice because we were kicked out. People take this game far too seriously some times and it's sometimes fun to watch sometimes sad. xDOther than the 2 previous points the game is great fun. Good customisation for vehicles and a good variety of maps and modes. If you're looking to have fun and play competitive without really having to worry too much about strategy then this is a great game.

review: Awesome game really fun and funny. I really recommend this game if u have syblings at home or friends/neighbours that come over to your house almost every weekend. Make sure u have good internet and router tho cuz it gets really annoying when u miss those shots D. i also recommend playing this game with controllers cuz sometimes u get confused with the controls on keyboard they arent so easy to use either unless if u are hardcore pc game. A good time killer if u r reading this when it's on sale and doubtful if u wanna get it or not JUST DO IT.quik update(for Steam Awards) Guys when i first saw this game...i was like nah m8 no one's gonna buy it cause its seemed to be silly since cars hit a ball. And even when the game released only some pple where talking and that too barely. So i was like lemme just watch a gameplay and then lets judge this game( U cant judge a book by its cover)so i searched up rocket league and the first video was from that dude called "JELLY" pretty popular. Man! when i saw it i was laughing cause of its silliness but then i saw video on the"reccomended for you"side which was from rocket league cinema Those plays looked so awesome those aerials pinch shots pools mid air passes freestyles.... man! I was like this one heck of a game!. So I got this game and its still a heck of game!.

review: Car to ball. Ball to car. Hats. The words "noob" "your mother" "3v1" and the letters "EZ" appear to be the player base' main method of communication. Spamalot of "What A Save!" very common. Quitters. Not a lot of defensive players. Move from goal and be chided as "useless" and be forever asked "how did you not save that?". Occasional crushing one player defeats. THE PLAYER WHO WANTS TO HIT EVERY BALL. Breathe deeply. Let them. There's little to do but to try to pick up the pieces.Addiction. Frustration. Elation. Joy. Bewilderment. Terror. Awe.It takes all sorts to play this game and they all do.I recommend that you turn off the chat box altogether. It's pointless unless you have friends with you. It helps to have a plan of attack but occasionally you'll completely surprise the trolls with a glorious win and all the defeats before are worth the wait for that moment.It's a great game. Very well optimised plays on my old Toshiba laptop just as well as my PC with the obvious exception of the graphical quality. The physics can be tricky but fun even when you still don't quite understand what the hell is going on. Highly recommended for all levels of interest recreational or serious players. Psyonix have done a great job in ensuring as many people can enjoy this game as possible.
title: Rocket League®

review: Let me start by saying if you put more than 50 hours into this game you'll probably put more than 300 into it. It is so much fun and highly addictive because there is always a new skill to learn and if there isn't there is always another game to play. I highly recommend this game because it is such a unique blend of traditional sports and racing genres that will keep you coming back for more.

review: This game is amazing! Go press the button. Buy it now. You won't regret it.I am worried for a few things though The lack of map variety. I would like to see more maps added to the game. What is already there is very good that's why I would like more. Also I'd like more cars to choose. Single Player content. The season mode is good but I would want to get more invested on my teams. I mean I'd like to keep track of how many seasons each team won including my own for example. Something like a trophy room would be awesome. LOL. Also it'd be nice that the bots tended to be more defensive or to be attackers. Also more variety for the teammates.So yeah this game is awesome even though I don't like football (or Soccer) that much. I'll be wasting more hours of my life on it that's for sure.EDIT There more cars now. More maps too. Now you don't have an excuse. BUY IT.

review: Just awesome! Play that with friends and you're sure to get really bad at it really fast because you'll have sweat and tears of joy in your eyes.It's really simple take the boring parts out of football (the players) add jumping cars and a huge ball and here you are! Rocket League! Gameplay is quite simple you can get the hang of it in a few minutes. But to be able to AIM it'll take you a little more time.The game has different modes you can alter the size shape and weight of the ball you can tweak the gravity... Enough to get the game going for hours and forget to sleep once or twice.Buy this and have fun!

review: This game is an awesome game and its actually realy fun. Playing with friends is probibly the best part . There is a HUGE learning curve that I still need to master. For the most part this game is fine but... the matchmaking is the worst I have ever seen. When you reach rank 10 you become semi pro Pro 20 Veteran 30. I was so exited because i got out of rookie and into semi pro so i decided i should go on to a ranked game. At first I didnt check to see what rank he was considering it was a ranked match and guess what... A ing Veteran I am barley Semi Pro.... going against... a Veteran. Come on really I got onto a ranked match thinking that it would be RANKED but I guess not. I'm leaving this NOT RECOMENDED until this gets fixed because its a small thing that makes a big diffrence.
title: Rocket League®

review: It really takes a lot of skill to make a game that is more hype to watch and play than a traditional sport.Rocket League is a game I highly recommend as it is one of the best multiplayer/sports games to come out this year thus far.This is probably one of my favorite soccer(or sports game in general) games to come out since Mario Strikers Charged.It's just incredibly fun to play even before I've played 2 hours.It's a very raw game where the focus is on having fun.10/10 Better than FIFA
title: Rocket League®

review: Really fun game!!!Customizable VehiclesFast paced full contact sport! has that NHL feel if you have a party!RC Rocket Powered Soccer/Football at its finest this game is loved by all age groups DSome people complain that it's a little difficult to get the hang of but i assure you just some time practicing and you'll be surprising yourself laughing scoring blowing cars up flying accross the Dome Stadium and bicycle kicking your way to the TOP!suggest this to every one and everyone!there is currently only ONE flaw with this game. The party system. You can have a party but you can only play ranked with 1 other person for 2v2's. The only other ranked gametypes are for solo play and they are 1v1 2v2 3v3I believe they should allow parties to play anything from 2v2 4v4 RANKED.Exhibition can get pretty darn easy so allowing the ranked increase will make this game 10x betteri have dual graphics however i havnt had any issues with that.there is very minor server issues but i really don't think it's the servers i think it's the people Queing up. I've always been low ping in this game however i see and vs people at like 160 ping constantly and that creates skippy game play.
title: Rocket League®

review: This is a game of football where the players are all cars. The game is very fast there's a lot of skill involved but the controls are simple and it's easy to play more Mario Kart than a "proper" car sim.There are a few different cars in the game with others available as unlocks and DLC. I found the single player game a bit repetitive. There's not a proper campaign which doesn't help. The graphics and sound are good.It's funny watching a car race the length of the pitch in order to put the ball in from the goal line only to miss and go crashing into the back of the net. This happens very frequently.I think I would probably enjoy this multiplayer but none of my friends own it. This is possibly because I'm a sad sack no mates.

review: At the time I'm writing this I am 728 hours into the game for the record...Rocket League is the kind of game I never thought I would like. Playing soccer with a car is wierd period. However this is neither a standard soccer game nor is it a car game. At its core the gameplay of Rocket League is a team based arena. 3 players (or less) battle 3 other. They each have a battle car that they control to try and drive a ball in the opposite team's goal. It doesn't get any simpler than this. The game revolves only around 2 skills one must aquire Mechanics and Strategy (game sense).That makes the game fun straight away. nothing to buy nothing to grind no waiting. Being skill focused the game has a huge learning curve and a training program inside the game is available to help you improve your mechanics that is how you control the car to move the ball the way you want and game sense. You are matched against player of your level and get better as you play.Being a team game you have to cooperate with others. So yes you'll never know who you'll end up with. if you want to be able to comunicate create your own or join a comunity of players you will play with. If you are easily tilted disable the chat. Relax and focus.There is nothing more rewarding than being MVP of the game. The better you play the better you'll want to play. Fast paced quick matches are ideal if you don't want to play for extended periods of time.A great Esport game with growing tournament scene.It is truely the first game I am so eager to improve at. I'm not a very fast learner and I play video games mostly for fun. I'm 30 and I have a full time job so I'll never be pro. I picked up the game a year ago. I immediately decided to get better at it. My goal is to be ranked champion. Currently I'm ranked diamond not yet a rocketeer. There is still a bit of road ahead of me but I truely enjoy every hour. pick it up it is a great pvp game.
title: Rocket League®

review: Holy crap is this a fun game. I'm usually not on board with sports games but this is just...it's whimiscal. It's Soccer at the core. But then it's also got an interesting twist on it because you're cars with rocket boosters on them. So it doesn't just feel like a sports game it feels like something else too. It's like a Mario Kart game compared to a NASCAR game. It's a twist on a sport that makes it fun and whimsical.I've only played a little bit but I can just sense that this is going to be an absolute time sink for me. And I'm perfectly okay with this.Only issue I've come up with so far is that playing against a player who is more skilled than you can just absolutely blow your self esteem. The Hockey game mode kept giving me guys who were much higher ranked than me and losing a game 5 1 or 12 1 feels bad man. I don't think it's supposed to do that I think it's supposed to find people close to you in skill to play against but a couple of times some real pro dudes slipped through and just destroyed everything I love.Still damn fun game. Definitely worth checking out.

review: This is an amazingly fun yet elegantly simple game.The short and sweet of it is that it's Soccer but with cars that can double jump and booster.PROS Elegantly simple easy to learnEntirely skill basedTeamwork feels naturalIncredibly intensely funNo DLC or microtransactions of any kind. I don't know about future plans but I love that in a gameCONS It's a team game so quitters are a thingLag when it was noticable (not often) was very much so because of the fast pace of the gameAs of writing no way to play in a party or communicate with my PS4 friendsI feel like I first have to mention that I am not a fan of racing games soccer or sports in general. Despite that I was hooked on this game in the first round. The simplicity means that you and up to 3 of your friends can pick it up any time and you wont have to explain any rules. This makes it a great local game to play to have a high energy intensely fun time. Competing against or cooperating with your friends are both equally enjoyable even as the losing team.Although the controls and rules are dirt simple the game has complexity and is deeply skill based. Moments that inspire "Hell yeah!"s and "Daaaayyyuuum"s are plenty and the replay feature that comes after every goal nearly always has something worth watching to show. Once I bought the game on my PC and played solo online I found difficulty surpressing loud shouts of glee and longed for an audience to see the many spectacular occassions that dot the experience of playing. Doing well feels so damn good and mistakes seem to slip away as the pace and intensity of the game consumes you.Teamwork seems to come naturally and with the exception of a bit too many rage quitters the online community was polite and surprisingly forgiving.It just feels good all around. Every aspect of playing felt solid smooth and satisfying.
title: Rocket League®

review: One of my favorite games of the year if not ever. Since day one I have been addicted to RL and can't stop playing. Im glad I stuck through all the issues of launch this game is amazing now 10/10Update After playing for over 1 000 hours this is still the best game ive everyplayed. the replayability is top tier and the developers at Psyonix are some of the best ive seen when it comes to pushing out new content constantly and listening to its fan base in regards to what we want to see. They are also quick to fix and own up to mistakes.
title: Rocket League®

review: The game is fun. Is it worth the $20 to get the game? hmm yes. If I were to describe this game it would be the game you play when you are inbetween games and nothing really seems interesting and you need to waste like an hour. That being said it is really fun to play sometimes Frustrating but fun. People you play with are normally nice although the ingame chat is completely broken. It takes around 50 hours to really start to get a good understanding of the game and especially aerial hits/goals. Not something (Atleast for me or my friends) that we hope on and could play for 8 hours but is very competitve.7.5/10
title: Rocket League®
